description:
Five stars all the way! I've tried pizza "diabola" with salami and Italian sausage and it was amazing. 

It's a Neapolitan style of pizza and I must say it's really close to the original. Mozzarella is sweet, tomato sauce adds this amazing acidity and meat is of top notch quality. 

One of the best meals I had in San Francisco so far.
author: Michał K.

description:
First, the pizza was excellent. The cheese was creamy, the tomato sauce vibrant, basil fresh, and pepperoni was perfectly spicy.

I stopped by because the reviews were good, but immediately I was in the awkward position of whether I should find something else for dinner because they close in 20 minutes. The man who was firing the pizzas, explained curtly that it's to-go only as they close soon.  I should have just accepted his clear body language and found something else to eat, because I gave the wrong answer by saying to-go was alright, and both myself and my girlfriend felt his annoyance. 

Though their sign says pizza cooks in 2 minutes, I felt that I greatly inconvenienced this worker for asking for to-go with plenty of time to complete my order before "close".

Ultimately, I wouldn't have been compelled to write a review if they, at first, said, "I'm sorry, we close soon and this is the reason why it would be difficult to make food for you." If he really wanted to refuse service, he should have just said no, instead his bad attitude really soured the experience.

Although a little pricey, the quality and taste of the pizza, means CPC still deserves a recommendation, but just don't go in the last half hour of business.
author: Justin G.

description:
This is the worst pizza we have ever had. Frozen pizza would have been a better choice. 
The concierge at the Sheraton recommended this place (it was the closest to our hotel of his recommendations). 
The crust was burned on the bottom and uncooked throughout the sauce was flavorless. It was overall just burned, soggy and and sloppy. We were tired and ended up just eating the toppings and leaving the horrible crust. 
If you are a pizza lover and crave pizza frozen is a better bet than this pizza. Really awful!!
As a rule if you call ahead and they tell you your pizza will be ready in 10 minutes I guess expect the worst!
author: Laurie P.

description:
SUMMARY: Holy legit pizza! Oh man, we are just dying to go back to have their margerita pizza again!

BACKGROUND
The wife and I were out at Fort Mason to check out an arts and crafts show.  We parked a bit farther than expected, so we decided to have lunch first before we went to the show.  

CARMEL PIZZA
A tiny little place in the famous Fisherman's Wharf area, CPC is a nicely decorated place with quite the Italian theme going.  They really created a great little atmosphere in such a small space.  We were impressed and I think you will be too.  

One thing though that you might find difficult if you're under 5'10" is the very unusually high counter.

FOOD
As we didn't want to be too full going to the show, we split their margherita pizza, a soda, and a bottle of water.  So let's talk about, no GUSH, about this pizza:  while it's not a true NY thin crust, I don't think it's intended to be.  But the crust was incredible.  Very thin like we like it and crispy all around.  Like perfectly crispy.  And the sauce. We talked with the owners about their ingredients and she said all their pizza sauce was made fresh on premise.  I totally can believe it.  And of course the cheese and basil.  In combination, wow.  We still talk about their pizza.  It was that good!

Oh they have their own freshly made chili oil.  While not as spicy as we like it, it was enough to add that right amount of spicy flavor that's right for Italian food.

RETURN VISIT?
Emphatic yes! If only we lived closer!
author: Bob K.

description:
This place is amazing. Went on a Sunday evening & it wasn't crowded. I ordered two pizzas bianca & margarita.. And let me tell you I'm craving  that pizza as I 'm writing this review. Pizza was perfection from sauce cheese to the crust. There's an ice cream place right next to it and that's how we ended the night. 
I can't wait to go back again and I think I'll definitely choose Sunday evening to beat the traffic.
author: Aman P.

description: This location was close to our hotel, we were getting hangry and this had some good reviews. We ordered the Americana and a beer..because it was happy hour and what goes better with pizza than beer? The pizza was fairly quick to make. It had a thin crust and some of the toppings would fall off as you would eat it. But as you can tell from the pic of already eaten pizza we were too hungry to notice as it was going down. The service was averagely pleasant and they had nice outdoor seating.
author: Claudiana C.

description:
Friendly staff, cute place. Decent prices for being so close to pier 39. There was no line and my pizza was done 5 minutes after I paid. 
Toppings were fresh but I wasn't a huge fan of the dough and crust. 
My hotel was only a 2 minute walk and it already got soggy when I got to my room. I guess it's also personal preferences as well, pizza can be tricky.
author: Val L.

description:
Wow found this gym just walking down Fishermans Wharf craving pizza. It was one of the best decisions yet. So we wanted a little break from seafood and wanted pizza. We yelped and came here. Very small little place you can miss it. 

We ordered the all pork pizza and diovola. Omg hands down one of the best pizzas I've had. It's made in a stone wood fire oven which is the best. It's thin crust (my fav). It's not too oily and just right amount of spice. The All Pork Pizza was the best. 

It came out with a side of chili oil. That was the best part. We just drizzled that all over the pizza and asked for more! we loved it so much we had to order another pizza. So delicious. It looks like a local spot too because the owner was very familiar with the customers and he was a very nice guy. 

Only bad thing, I think the price of the pizzas should be less. The size is quite small for the price but does not take away from all the flavors and goodness of the pizza. I would pay for it again and again but for someone causally walking by they might pass on it.
author: Sandra R.

description: Lovely little spot. Great pizza, cute decor and friendly service. A true gem in a sea of options in Fisherman's Wharf. Will definitely be back and likely often when craving pizza!
author: Justin Y.

description:
Nice place for a pizza off the main drag of the pier. It's in a cozy patio where you order from the counter and they'll bring the pizza out. I got the Diavola and I was nervous that I'd have a ton left over eating by myself but surprisingly... I ate it all. The pizza isn't super filling and the first few bites of the slice are almost paper thin. Luckily it gets better as you work your way up to that fabulous blistered and chewy crust. I almost wish they would make a giant pizza donut where they cut away the middle of the pizza and just give you the outskirts.. anyways.

The price is pretty high, at $14-$20 a pizza. If you're sharing as a snack it may be justified but I think if you're super hungry sharing a pizza won't fill you up much. They do offer 3 types of bottled beers here so it's a nice retreat from the sun and the crowds. I did enjoy my time here even and you can't really complain about anything being overpriced in this area. Happy I stopped in.
author: Emily B.

description: Stop here just to grab a quick bite to eat as I was touring the city and fell in love with this place. Pizza was amazing and fresh. Very well cooked and the people there was nice. If ever around the area it's a must stop and try
author: Julius T.

description:
I love the place.  Have for a good 6-7 years.  Every time I come in town from Texas I come here and bring my family, guests, and coworkers here for a great pizza.   

The outdoor seating is nice and they are always changing it. Looks great and improved each visit.  Folks inside are always nice with a smile and deliver great pizza each time.  

See you next time!!!  Joe
author: Earnest S.

description: I got the Romantical pizza with heirloom tomatoes, balsamic glaze and extra arugula! It was amazing!!! Crust was thin and it had a great tasting char on it. Hubby got just pepperoni and he loved that too! Great little place!!
author: Lisa T.

description:
Why have I not discovered this place sooner is beyond me! My friend and I were walking in the area since it was a nice day out and she recommended to grab a pie here. I never heard of this place and since it was in the fisherman's wharf area so I was a bit skeptical. Ummm it's a hidden gem for sure!! What stood out was that they have a wood fire oven somewhere in there. It's a small spot so I was trying to see where it was but couldn't see it. They do have a huge stack of wood on the side though. 

We ordered a margherita pizza and it came out perfect. The dough was nicely done with a little char but not enough to detract from the overall taste. The tomatoes they use have the perfect amount of sweetness and tang and not too wet that it makes the pizza soggy. The only thing to comment is I wish it had a little more olive oil on it, but that's subjective. I'm still surprised at how good it was though.It takes me back to some of the great spots in NY! Definitely will be coming back again!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Pizzas are excellent (one of the best I ever had) but come a bit more pricey ($18-$22) that you might expect for the US
Dough is thin and they use only quality and fresh ingredients, one pizza is sufficient for a whole meal
There are around 20 seats available inside this outside restaurant but do know they have NO restrooms (they have one further away in fisherman wharf shared with other businesses/restaurants for that)
author: Leo P.

description: Me and the wife visited San Fran for a week. After eating mediocre food for most of our trip we decided to try this place. This place is a must try when in San Fran and honestly the best pizza I ever had!
author: Derrick S.

description: This place is insanely amazing!! The pizza melted in my mouth like butter!! The pizza was so good!! Wow!!
author: Bella E.

description: Yes! This place is legit! Margherita pizza with prosciutto so yummy! Must try when in Fisherman's Wharf located right across the Walgreens in Fisherman's wharf.
author: Rissa K.

description:
Thanks Aj & Amanda for the awesome pizza  
And cool vibes.

The pizza is always delicious and consistent a definite must on the wharf !
author: SkyeBlu W.

description:
Really dig this place. Kitchy patio vibe operating out of a trailer.

Typical California style pizza, not New York or Chicago style but still pretty good though.

Friendly and accommodating employees.

Super fast service...they made our pizza in like 5 minutes.

Bottled beer available.

Five stars, I'll be back.
author: Scott S.

description: After our Alcatraz tour we were starved and having a hard time finding a place that we could agree on. We rolled up to this spot after checking yelp. I didn't realize it was a food truck that offered outside seating. It was a bit cold so i would've preferred going indoors but we were there, already paid for parking and the man working seemed pleasant. We ordered the Quattro formagg pizza, 4 cheese, with spinach on one half and sausage on the other. The pizza was ok. For it being the 3 cheese pizza it didn't have very much cheese... it was expensive for what it was and I probably wouldn't go back. The place behind hotel Zoe across the street from the grocery store was better even though it took longer.
author: Ashley V.

description:
They serve an amazing authentic pizza. Thin crust, piping hot. My husband and I had a late evening snack here so one pizza was plenty. If we had been super hungry it would not have been enough and we would have ordered two. What can I say? We love to eat! Eat well that is, and Carmel Pizza Company does it right. 

Our Margarita Pizza was exactly as we hoped it would be and the glass bottled soda washed it down perfectly. 

Great little "hole in the wall."  

The ambiance is great too!
author: Juanita I.

description: Fun place, great pizza.  Fits the vibe of the area. Loved it.  The patio is a great place to watch folks head to the warf.  Its San Fran priced both worth it  if you have time to hang out a while.
author: Larry G.

description:
We walked by this place on our way to another restaurant and they were handing out flyers. We decide not to eat there since we had plans elsewhere. The next day remembered the flyers that was handed to us and looked them up on YELP. Since they had good reviews, we decide to try them for lunch. 
I was not impressed with their overpriced pizza and the service was poor. They also don't tell you that they charge for eating at their tables ( a cover charge). You are already paying a minimum of $14 for a medium pizza with NO meat. So I would NOT recommend this pizza place to any tourist visiting SF. SF has SO MANY better eateries to enjoy.
author: Vincent A.

description: Oven brick pizza..build your own..they have allot of toppings..it's thin crusted not greasy
author: Tonie S.

description: Great oven fired crust. Fresh ingredients. Very cool little outdoor spot to relax from a busy day of sight seeing
author: Bj R.

description: A cool little spot with a fun and cozy vibe. Staff was pleasant and the flavor was good. Very clean especially for being an outdoor place. Pizza was thin as expected but had a crispness on the bottom to it that was a pleasant surprise (doesn't fall all over when you pick up a slice lol) a bit pricey, $17 and change for one topping
author: Matt S.

description: Saw the high reviews so we stopped in and shared the Americana pizza.  Right when I picked it up, all the toppings fell off.  The middle was so wet and mushy. No idea where the high reviews came from, but we wouldn't come back here.
author: Vi Y.

description: Great pizza. It's very thin so a good idea to let it "set" as it cools down before trying to pick it up. Tastes sooo good and fresh though. Also would recommend getting one pizza per person as they're fairly small. One is enough to fill me up though!
author: Rosie L.

description:
First time and the pizza is wonderful. With an Anchor Steam beer .... very nice and perfect. The service was excellent and the atmosphere so relaxing.  Don't pass up this small place!!!!

Mahalos from a Hawaiian couple
author: J P.

description:
Amazing homemade dough!
Their "Quattro Formaggi" pizza is the bomb!
Excellent flavor & attentive staff. 
Reasonable pricing too. 
I'm a pizza snob from Philly and give this place high marks!
Glenn
author: Glenn F.

description:
I wrestled with whether or not to write a review. Why? The pizza was really good and I enjoy supporting non-chain businesses like this that put quality and experience before profit squeezing. I'm always afraid that something negative that I experienced could have been a one-off situation, so I prefer writing about places that I have visited more than once. Still, I've passed by this place quite a few times before finally buying a pizza. Carmel Pizza Company is slowly building a reputation as a great little pizza spot near the touristy Fisherman's Wharf area. 

FOOD:

First off: The pizza was good. I mean, it was REALLY good. It tasted a little better than I expected -- and my expectations were already a bit high. Like others have written, it did taste like a healthier, gourmet pizza that you might find at a classier locale. My dad lived in Italy and this tastes a lot like the pizza that he described of Naples. I've had similar pizzas (even in San Francisco), but this was certainly comparable with the "fine" (aka pricey) pizza pies found elsewhere. 

We ordered the Margherita. I requested pepperoni to be added only upon half of the pizza (and I was willing to pay for full price), but the man said that they don't do split toppings. I was disappointed, because I was willing to pay full price for half the pepperoni slices (not difficult or "splitting" the toppings in my opinion). 

LOCATION: The Carmel Pizza Company is located on Jones Street between Jefferson Street (along the bay) and Beach Street. It is located right off the sidewalk in front of Fisherman's Wharf Parking. It is also nestled between a few other shops -- like The Baked Bear ice cream cookie sandwiches and Tanguito (the Argentinian empenada food shop). It can be hard to see it if you're not looking -- because the patio obscures the little restaurant from view. Thankfully, there is a little sign out front.

It is also located very near the seafood spots along the grotto and wharf. If you're not into crab, then this is a perfect option while touring that area!

EXPERIENCE: The patio is small with limited seating. There are a few tables out front too (along the sidewalk). Thankfully, my wife and I were biking through the city and stopped during the early afternoon on a weekday.  

There was a Hispanic couple with young children dining on the patio. They purchased a pizza and the husband walked next door and bought either an Argentinian empenada from Tanguito or some fish from The Codmother. While the rest of the family dined on pizza, he took a bite of his food. However, the woman working there informed him (from the serving window) that they don't permit outside food. The man quickly put his food away and waited patiently while his family finished their food. I really felt bad for the man -- because there weren't any crowds waiting for food. 

If I had to rate this place on the basis of the food and proximity to the Fisherman's Wharf, it would be a solid FIVE STARS. However, I was a bit disappointed by the unwillingness to add pepperoni to just one side of the pizza (despite a willingness to pay for pepperoni for the entire pizza). 

More importantly, I felt embarrassed for the young couple and their two children being unabashedly scolded for having "outside food." I completely get the fact that restaurants don't like outside food on their premises. However, in this case, these were obviously tourists (they said that they were from Southern California) and they were sitting in the patio eating a pizza and drinks from Carmel Pizza Company anyway at a time in which there weren't other customers waiting for seats. 

Those minor issues caused me to drop a star from an otherwise perfect five stars. The food was terrific! It was well worth the money and time!
author: Chris M.

description: This is good Pizza for West coast style.  If youre gonna compare it to New York Pizza, you can't do that.    This isn't New York so you're not gonna find it here.     Surprisingly tho, This crust was good!  They actually stretch it out and form it there.  They have a wood Fire going in a nice dome style Brick oven. It gives the crust a bit of a crunch and slight char which is what you want.  The cheese was decent, I call it mild Mozzarella but was good texture.  The sauce wasn't zesty at all in my taste and also a tad mild but was ample on the slices.   I gave them 4 stars only because they're charging a Dollar for Parmesan cheese as a topping and the prices for a personal pie are a tad high.    If the sauce had some roasted garlic flavor or some fresh oregano or some fresh basil and the marinara or pizza sauce was bright zesty or bold and the pie came out garnished. I'd give it 5 stars for sure! At that price, I just feel like I'm being banged out for the grated cheese.   Overall it's a good slice and worth the trip over there for sure!
author: Chris N.

description: So good, so authentic.  I lived in Rome for many years and this pizzeria truly is a good as any you would find in Rome. Great wood fire pizza.
author: Ken S.

description:
If you are in the area I have to say this place is not only a great spot for a date night but also the best pizza in Fishermans warf. The decor is almost like walking into an enchanted forest. Just simply breathtaking. Its like a food truck with a nice decorative tent over it.

They have an outdoor set up however covered outdoor area with heat lamps on top of the corner tables . This was great as it was a bit chilly when I went in April.
We ordered the Romantico pizza which had mozzarella, Arugula, Balsamic Glaze and Heirloom Tomato . The pizza was $18.00 which I thought was okay however I was also expecting a much more larger pizza. It was around 7:45pm when we ordered this pizza. I do feel like I left hungry from here as they were advertised to close at 9 on that day. We tried to order another pizza at 8:30pm and they were already closing their service which was absurd. I was annoyed that even though we were in the restaurant and it was no where near 9pm we still had a half hour , we weren't able to order more food.

This is why I gave this place a 4 instead of a 5. How do you close a half hour before your closing time and stop taking orders?
The pizza also was really good and well done. However, NOT WORTH THE $18.00. If you are going to charge that much money for a small size pizza please increase the portion size. That was way too small of a pizza it was meant for just 1 person.

Even though the scenery and feel of this place was extremely relaxed and romantic. I wouldn't go back to this place for two reasons-  1 THE PRICE and 2 false advertisement on that day. 

Other than that go early and order more pizza on the first go before you leave this place hungry.

I felt rushed and over all paid way more than I feel I should have for this pizza. I understand the fresh ingredients and taste but that was way too much.
author: Binita S.

description: Great pizza and great service. Outstanding little place.i would definitely recommend this little restaurant.
author: Cyndi G.

description: Quaint and appealing from the street. Great service and DELICIOUS pizza! Personal service, reasonable pricing, very pleasant dining area. My new San Fran favorite.
author: Tina L.

description:
I love this place, My workmate just surprised me to this restaurant. On the menu was various pizza types. I chose Pizza Margherita which has added prosciutto as one of its ingredient. What a lovely pizza, i really loved its taste in my mouth.

The outdoor environment of the restaurant is also fine. i will take my family there for a date....
author: Macleod R.

description: I really enjoyed this pizza. The pizzas are all the same size, about a small-medium sized pizza. Good for sharing between two adults. You order and it is created and baked as you wait. The wait wasnt long at all. This place is nestled on Jones street right off the the "main drag" that is Jefferson street. Its kind of enclosed so when you are eating people aren't walking past you looking all in your grill. We had the Americano and added pepperoni. It is a thin crust pizza with a really good red sauce. Its not the sturdy thin crust, its soft so dont add to much to it as it may slide off if you try to pick it up. Parts of the crust were a little more charred than I am used to but it was one of the better tasting pizzas I've had. I will be sure and stop by each time I am in town. Service was great.
author: Kelson P.

description:
This is an absolutely nice pizza place around Fisherman's Wharf. You order and pay first and the ambiance is just delightful.
It's like an upgraded food cart with a thoughtfully designed and decorated patio that is cozy and welcoming. Pizzas are about $12-15 and one serves one hungry customer or two if they are not as hungry.
Take your time to enjoy the details in the decorations and of course, enjoy your pizza. The Bianca is perfect. Win-win.
author: Nancy B.

description:
Well, I'll never go here again.
The pizza was good. But the customer service was awful. This place was recommend to us by a family member. It says it's good for a group and kids and it definitely IS NOT.
By 20 minutes of waiting for someone we were told that we need to start ordering or we need to leave.
Every transaction we made they added $4 for a tip. They got $30-$40 in tip for us being there for an hour and 20 minutes. The whole time some blonde in a yellow shirt was glaring at us, and talking crap about us to some guy (probably owner). We asked if they can accommodate 8 people, and they said yes. If you say yes, then don't be mad at us because we believed you.
author: Helana M.

description: We just got to north Beach and my son was hungry for pizza. Reviews were good here so we tried it. Service was fast and friendly, price was reasonable, and the taste was fresh. My son thought it was the best pizza he ever had. I thought he might have jet lag, but he is a lil chef and entitled to his opinion. I think he could have ate a second pie all to himself. That's how much he loved it.
author: Craig B.

description: Wow, what a gem. Keeping up the good fight, this place. Had the Americano and loved it.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I took my 9yo son here and he LOVED it.  I'll let him take over now and leave his review...

This pizza is great, especially the margherita one! It tastes sooooo good and fresh. You should go there!
author: Cesar L.

description:
I stopped by for the first time with a few friends as we work nearby. There was a sign for a cheap lunch special. I asked about it and the staff said it's not meant for a group and we should get pizzas. I asked how many pizzas we should get for five people and the lady working said 2-3. This would end up being the same price as five lunch specials for the five of us so we pizzas. We got two as we weren't very hungry. Overall the pizza seemed too expensive for the size and quality. North Beach is near here and plenty of places have better food that's cheaper. 

I paid with a credit card and got a mini survey from Square asking for feedback. I gave honest feedback, that I thought I didn't get the quality or quantity that I would expect for the price I paid. I got a response right away from the owner or a staff member saying I should have ordered more pizza for five people and I'm the only one to give negative feedback. They said one pizza is for one person, though that's not what I was told in person. Even so I didn't care much about how much we got, I cared that the price doesn't match what we received. I didn't want anything from them, I was asked to give feedback and I did. 

The owner or worker who responded was rude and condescending. Negative feedback is meant to make a place better and my feedback was far from criticising just to criticize. I wanted them to know others may also be unhappy if the same thing happens to them. Instead of replying to me with something positive or even neutral, or not replying at all, they immediately blamed me for the negative experience and told me what I did wrong. That's awful customer service for someone who's giving honest feedback on a private feedback form. Even if the food was great and it just seemed overpriced, I would never support a place that treated customers this way just for giving negative feedback. There are much nicer places with better food and better people a few blocks down in North Beach.
author: Sionainn A.

description: Awesome little spot In fisherman's wharf! Pizza was ridiculous good ! Will come back again .
author: Sunil T.

description: Wow. Great pizza, nice sheltered outdoor location near Fisherman's Wharf. I considered just ordering a few crusts to go.
author: Scott P.

description:
At times, I admittedly find comfort in food. Never have I requested a table for one. There's just something about eating at a restaurant that, for me, requires the company of another human being. Pizza is perfect for the lone traveler wishing to grab a meal to enjoy in the comfort of their hotel room (me). No utensils required, and still good at room temperature. 

I chose the classic margherita + mushrooms. The crust did consist of overly toasted bits, but I worked around it.  A bit pricey at $17, but they offer $1 off with cash. Decent pie overall. Bought two, gave one to a man that crossed my path on the street that cold evening. A fellow human being whose concerns were far worse than dining alone.
author: Janel E.

description: Awesome taste and atmosphere...friendly staff that greet you with a smile.  Ingredients seemed fresh and pizza had an awesome wood fired taste.  Right next to Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Travis C.

description: Expectations were low since I was in fisherman's wharf.  Pretty solid pizza though!  Def one of the better eateries in fisherman's wharf.
author: Jeremy C.

description: Reminds me of Nook in Vancouver BC, a must try if you want great pizza. Nice setting away from the noise.
author: Yale D.

description:
This place oozes with San Francisco charm. Think lots of cute permanent food truck type places lined up by Fisherman's Wharf. They have a heated seating area that's really cute.
I can understand why they're on the list of best pizza places in San Fran. The crust was amazingly good and I polished off almost an entire pizza. Definitely pricey but delicious.
author: Mandy M.

description: Staff was eh. Pizza was good. Permanent food truck with a small gated seating area. The added heat lamps are nice for chilly days. Originally ordered pizza to go, but the kids wanted to eat there. One of the two workers noticed and took our pizza out of the box and placed it on a pizza board in order to save the box. Great for the environment but it would've been nice if they also offered plates so we didn't have to waste a ton of napkins. The Bianca pizza was good. Might want to request easy on the garlic if feeding a child- at least mine weren't too fond of all the small chunks of garlic.
author: Rose P.

description: Pizza to me is something that is always good, but simple things can ruin it. Caramel Pizza Company nailed it with their delicious pizza. There are tons of pizza places around San Fran and this one happened to be the closest to our hotel so we went for it. Boy was it worth it. Pictures can't really do it a justice but these slices hit the spot. It was ready quick but actually hot which can't be hard to come by. Wasn't greasy and had great flavor. Definitely worth stopping in for a slice or a whole pizza, reasonably priced as well and a great atmosphere with friendly staff.
author: Matt H.

description: Best pizza in San Francisco. Very enjoyable atmosphere with how small the place is.
author: Andy M.

description: Great pizza and fast service! Fun place to grab a bite! Then go next door for amazing ice cream sandwiches
author: Robin V.

description:
Came here from Seattle, delicious pizza, only thing was that it was so overpriced for how small the pizza was. $30 for a pizza that had about 6 slices. Indoor, cozy heated patio so that was really nice.

Edit: I took the 4 star away, pizza was cold in the middle lol. Try again.
author: Marina P.

description:
I just don't understand the 4.5 stars overall reviews, guys!! The only reason we went to this restaurant is because of all the positive reviews. It probably deserves 3 stars vs. 2 that I gave but the "Meh. I've experienced better" of the 2 star review is the truth.

My husband and I ordered a pizza and Caesar salad to share.The Caesar salad was drenched in garlic and oil and barely edible, but we were so hungry we ate what we could. The pizza is NOT sharable, but for the price, we assumed it would be. It was super thin crust with barely any toppings and was only 6 slices.

The ambiance of the 'restaurant' (which is a glorified food truck with a patio) was quite lovely though.

Seriously, save your money and spend the extra $10-$15 on award-winning Tony's Pizza.

UPDATE: See photo of screenshot from Amanda, the owner, to me. Completely classless. I don't care if you're a small business compared to Tony's, you're completely unprofessional and I hope more people see this.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I'm so confused by these 5 star reviews. Maybe we went on an off day. We all thought the pizzas were terrible. All of our crusts were burned. Toppings lacked flavor. The prices are outrageous. Even our 4 year old who would typically eat pizza 24/7, wouldn't eat it. The burned flavor overwhelmed everything to the point where it was inedible. 
We thought the outside dining area was cute so that deserves a star;  the pizza = 0 stars.
author: Melissa K.

description: Great little place would have never stopped if it were not for Yelp. Great pizza and affordable beer and wine right in the heart of it all.
author: Chris W.

description: Nice little pizza spot right next to where we parked so we decided to stop here for a slice, ended up getting a whole thin crust pizza 6 slices for $16. My husband son and I loved it. Their fresh grated cheese is also delicious. If we are ever around here again, we will definitely stop by.
author: Vivian H.

description: Carmel makes excellent wood fired pizza in a permanent food truck fixture with a nice patio to eat. The pizzas range $12+, and are worth every penny. The crispy, wood fired crust is savory, beautifully charred and crisp, and leaves nothing to be desired in a wood fired crust. The sauce is a delicate balance of sweet and savory that is a true testament to the freshly grown organic heirloom tomatoes used in their recipes. Carmel pizza does an excellent job of allowing you to customize a pizza to your liking, or choose a pre made pizza from their excellent menu. Carmel is well worth the trip from any part of the city, and stands up to the "big boys" of San Francisco pizza lore. Carmel is a place that can be truly enjoyed and appreciated by both locals and out of towners.
author: Dustin S.

description: Walked around Fishermans Wharf and found this place, ordered 2 pizzas that came out hot and perfect! Can't beat this place if you are in the area!
author: Bobby B.

description: Great pizza. Good service. I would be careful going there on cold nights. Very chilly. They need some heaters to make it comfortable. Reasonably priced. Defiantly a good spit.
author: Tim B.

description:
We came here right after the airport and we were starving.

The place is very nice and service is good.

We order Quattro fromagio pizza (pictured). It's wood fired oven so it has a good taste. 
I wish they put more cheese because I didn't feel like it was a real four cheese pizza.
They also have some drinks like coke, water, etc.
author: Adam M.

description:
This time
Around the pizza was just mediocre.
Pricing on the other side was NOT! 
Extremely
Expensive and the pizza wasn't event great :( 
Sad bc I used to love this joint
author: Anne H.

description: Forget about those busy places in pier 39 this is a gem hidden from everyone! Awesome pizza, super casual and fast service!! Not to mention the cute little patio they have!! Our next stop for our next trip to SF pier 39...
author: Ode A.

description:
A hole in the wall with one of the best pizzas
All fresh ingredients and very cute atmosphere 
A must go
author: Kian K.

description:
So its a shame but this place would have gotten five stars based on its food!!! 

However lost four stars due to costumer service, they were very rude, my daughter who has dairy and gluten allergies could not eat what we were eating and grabbed a couple of tacos from the food truck beside this one. Except they refused to allow her to sit and eat with us. There was no other customers in the Resturant at all, we were the only ones! 

This is a shame, when I told the young man of my situation he did not even care, just stood by his rude disposition and this just made me madder! 

Will never return due to this!!
author: George W.

description: Amazing pizza place! Was a bit worried about the outdoor-only seating, but it was enclosed and had heaters. We ordered a Margherita pizza and it was so good we ordered a second. I've eaten a lot of pizza and never had better pizza sauce. Delicious!!
author: Ashley S.

description: Pizza is off the charts!  The ambiance was super cool too.  Nice patio, wonderful service, amazing food!  5 stars all day
author: Justin Q.

description:
After you've fulfilled your seafood cravings in San Francisco, the next thing is to venture out and try other foods! Well, thanks to my handy dandy Yelp app, I searched some places and found that Carmel Pizza had a super high rating. My initial thought was to skip this joint and go for more seafood, but decide to give it a try.....and boy was it worth it!! What a lovely little relaxing place in the middle of Fishermans Wharf!! On Jones st near the pier, there are several food trucks that really are a must. This one is one of them. When you enter, you really feel like your in a little happy village away from the hustle and bustle. Ordering is a breeze and in no time, pizza is served to you at your table or you can take it out in a box- whichever you prefer! 
Although I thought that I have had my fair share of pizza and this one would be A-ok....I was wrong. Let's just say that I have never ate a whole pizza in my life....until I ate the pizza here. First off, the crust is crazy super thin so you eat more toppings than crust. The toppings are so fresh it really provides so many remarkable flavors that you forget where you are and you seriously sink into pizza oblivion. 
If we were staying in SF longer, we would for sure return to this amazing place. Thanks Carmel pizza for the once in a lifetime experience!!!
author: Lisa M.

description:
Thin crust pizza that is cooked in a hot oven. Awesome pizza and a nice outdoor feeling. Family of 4 took down 3 pizzas with ease.

Quick service, order at the window, sit if you can find room and enjoy this delicious pizza.
author: Karl B.

description:
Always have a nice experience here, my hubby makes sure we get this every time we're in the city. Kinda embarrassing to say that we're always at Fisherman's Wharf whenever we go (I don't like being that much of a tourist, even if I am one), but seriously, the pizza is delicious and the staff are consistently good.
It seems expensive to some people, but that's pretty laughable considering the location (you can't expect cheap at Fisherman's Wharf) and quality.
We get the Americano, share it between two of us. It's a thin crust, so if you're accustomed to a deep dish or thick crust bready pizza to fill you up until you regret eating this is not the place. If you miss Italy, this is a good spot.
My husband is obsessed with the crust. It's amazing. It is.
They have a frequency card. We just got our 7th pizza (a margherita) free.
author: Ramy S.

description: In town for business and happen to find this place on yelp. Honestly, the perfect little pizza spot. Service was quick and the outdoor seating is refreshing. Reasonable prices and good pizza. Definitely recommend!
author: Kelsey M.

description: Pizza just the way i love it! Thin crust, baked in a wood fire oven, fresh ingredients. I was so happy to find this spot. Friendly and fast service & close by the fisherman's warf. Not so pricy either. i would say it's a tiny little bit bigger than a personal pizza so you might want to order 2 if its 1 or more eating. besides if there's left over who doesn't love left over pizza? I ordered the Margherita pizza, my fave, added ham & parmesan cus hubby needs some sort of meat on it but it would've been just as good without. Don't miss out on this place! super delish!
author: Natalie R.

description: Very cute spot, it's a hidden gem if you ask me. The food was delicious and the girls that worked there were very pleasant. All outdoor seating, clean, and fast service. No restrooms, so just be prepared to walk around the corner!
author: Dominique H.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed the pizza at this small joint in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Definitely consider giving them a shot, but be ready to keep an eye out for them as they sort of blend into the environment, surrounded by other small shops.  The staff was friendly and our pizza was ready surprisingly fast. The crust was well done and not too chewy, which I have found to be a problem at other fire-baked pizza places.
author: Paul S.

description: I walked past this place on my last trip to SF because I didn't think my young boys would appreciate fine pizzas.  Several years later we tried it and are blown away!  It's a must have!  Finest pizza I've ever had. It's an experience :)
author: Michael N.

description: This pizza is awesome. Great thin, crispy crust. Just the right amount of sauce and toppings. The Cesar salad was ok, nothing spectacular but the croutons and Pharm was fresh.
author: Brenda W.

description: Nice little food truck with a very cozy dining area around it, just a few steps away from the Wharf. We were looking for something 'not seafood' and Yelp brought us here. Pizzas were big enough to share so our group of six ordered four and devoured. Tasty flavor combinations provided enough variety for all.
author: Eric W.

description: So yummy...had margherita pizza! Crust was thin, the pizza sauce & mozzarella was really fresh. Caesar salad was zesty and had lots of freshly grated Parmesan cheese. Loved every bit!!
author: Emily P.

description: the pizza could have been a little bigger. It's definitely a two person pizza but the quality of the pizza is amazing. It left me wanting more. We paid $19.25 for a Margherita pizza with Italian sausage and a drink and I think it was a reasonable price. The pizza itself was amazing. It's a short walk from the pier and a good little get away from the crazy tourists. The fast and quality over all of the pizza was like no other. We will most definitely be returning soon.
author: Ariana E.

description: Excellent pizza in a cozy atmosphere! Would absolutely recommend! Pizza was ready in 5 minutes after ordering!
author: Taylor D.

description:
1st class pizza.  I make my own often and it's REAL good. THIS is better tho
The sauce is perfect and the cheese is melted nicely and the crust is heavenly
I'll be frequenting this place often
author: Scott H.

description: We just got into town with our three grade school age children and this place was perfect. Our Three pizzas were amazing, and I've been at hundred dollar per plate restaurants with Caesar dressing that pales in comparison. It lives up to Yelp! Hype!
author: Jeff S.

description: The pizza was perfectly cooked. Loved the taste. Chilli oil was a perfect addition on the pizza. They serve thin crust pizza and You might need the whole pizza as its very light.
author: Sanjay S.

description:
So this feels a bit pricey, even for San Francisco and even for a touristy neighborhood.  A personal pepperoni pizza and a Mexican Coke was $21.90!  That's significantly pricier than the bougie Pizza Politana tent at the Ferry Building.  Price aside, it's yet another tasty wood-fired pizza stand.

Margherita Pizza w/ Pepperoni: Lots of umami tomato sauce, which is usually my favorite part of the pizza.  A generous amount of fresh mozzarella, which ended up forming creamy cheese puddles.  Different from the gooey crispy cheese layer that shredded mozzarella makes, but still tasty.  A modest amount of small pepperonis; kinda wish they were cooked a little longer to be crispier.
author: Adam B.

description: This little hole in the wall, actually a food truck buried within a side street near Fisherman's Wharf really delivers. And I had a New Yorker with me who is extremely picky about pizza.
author: Lisa H.

description: This was the real deal. Crust was perfectly chewy with a crisp finish, red sauce was flavorful, and cheese and toppings were fresh and flavorful. Seating is limited, but the pizzas came really fast. All four of the kids gobbled theirs up, and hubby and I savored ours. This is how pizza is supposed to taste. Will be back.
author: Emily M.

description:
This place is so cute! At first the heated temp was too warm for me, but it got cooler after I sat down. It's a mini garden! Kind of relaxing. They sell beer and wine, along with flavored Pellegrino, Honest Tea, etc. from their self serve fridge. Yelp check in provides $1 off a pizza =) Two 6 slice 10-12" pizzas weren't enough for seven people so we ordered a third:

Capriccosia: applewood smoked ham, artichokes, olives, and mushrooms with mozzarella, not bad ($18)

Margherita: mozzarella & basil, simple ($13)

Crudo e Parma: my favorite! Each delicious bite of that non fatty, less salty prosciutto left me craving more. Arugula baked in the mozzarella! The shaved Parmesan was the cherry on top. I could've eaten this all by myself. ($18)

They have this special chili oil imported from Italy; supposedly packs a punch, but it merely added more flavor to the Margherita. Folks should definitely try it. I can't handle spicy but I liked it! Mopping it up with my last bits of pizza over here ...

Pizzas were thin crust (bonus points!), resulting in quick baking. My only complaint was the burned patches around the crust. I guess it adds to the charm but with frequent reminders to avoid charred edibles from entering my temple, it kind of turns me off. 

Workers were nice, informative. I'd go back for the crudo e parma and end with dessert next door from Baked Bear.
author: Kristine F.

description: Delicious fresh pie. Overpriced because, duh, tourists. One person = $37 (!) for a salad, pie and a glass of wine. Caesar salad WAY overdressed. But again, pizza was perfect.
author: A W.

description: If you love pizza like I do and you're looking for a cool place to enjoy a pie with a date or just solo....don't over look this place. Great crust, fresh ingredients and cooked in a wood oven...and to top it off, a nice comfy patio and great staff especially Gabi which was friendly and helpful with my selection . Will be back...top of my list for pizza.
author: David V.

description: Amazing crispy crust with the amazing chewiness that delights. A bit spendy but worth it!
author: Jesse M.

description: The pizza was good but nothing spectacular. I ordered the margarita pizza due to all the reviews, it was good but not out if this world like I was expecting. The outdoor area was awesome and staff friendly. I paid 21 bucks for a pizza and beer, not to bad but perhaps a little costly considering it was light on cheese, thin crust and not a ton of flavor yet decent.
author: Rachelle L.

description: Pizza was awesome! I have a whey protein allergy and they took time out to check the flour. It is not always listed and if it does go well, the pizza was so good it will be worth it!
author: Rick D.

description: The pizza was burnt, very little mozzarella cheese and the crust was so thin that the sauce bled right through. They would not add a topping to half a pizza. If you want Parmesan cheese be ready to pony up another $1.  Flying insects and poor beer selection, in my opinion.
author: Marcee A.

description: Fresh, wood fired, Neapolitan pizza. My wife and I were strolling around Fishermans's Wharf looking for a lunch spot and we came across Carmel Pizza Company. The entire place is outdoors except for the food prep area which is sort of like a trailer I guess but you can clearly see the wood fired oven while ordering. Wanting something light we opted for the Margherita but I threw a twist in and got anchovies on my half. These things were so fresh they were still swimming. I figured being just outside of Fisherman's Wharf...why not. The pizza was excellent and we couldn't have been happier we chose Carmel Pizza Company.
author: Tom M.

description: Unassuming and amazing!  Worth a try if you like pizza. A MUST for pizza lovers!  Best margarita pizza in SF!!!
author: Andrew Z.

description:
This place is awesome!

I've passed by a couple of times, and saw good reviews so I told myself next time I'm in the area, I'll check it out.

I tried their margherita and it was delish! Good portion size too. Perfect for just one person, or if you get two different kinds, you can share (or not!)

Cute and cozy vibe. They have outside heater lamps too.

In the fisherman's wharf area so a lot of tourists, but this is your best bang for your buck if your craving pizza.

My man friend raved about this place too and he comes here all the time, that they gave him a stamp card!
author: Nika K.

description: Not the best choice on a cold soaking day ( outside seating  roof leak a little) but the pizza is awesome! made in a wood burning oven.  The place is nice clean and tidy and the decor is actually quite nice.
author: Majeed F.

description:
Jewel in the middle of Fishermen's Wharf. Great Napoli style pizza in cute spot. Nothing fancy about it, just great thin and crispy dough with quality ingredients.

Tried pizza Bianca, Marinara and ham with mushrooms. All of them were fantastic.

Top 3 pizza I have tried in the bay (yes, it is that good)
author: Ignacio G.

description:
This is delicious!
We wanted pizza and were looking for the classic thin crust fresh ingredients pizza, pizza with personality. We found it!
The patio area is pretty cool and very inviting, the service was quick and the server pleasant.
We ordered a pepperoni pizza and it did not disappoint. The crust was delicious, the sauce just right, and everything tasted fresh.

Would eat here again without a doubt!
author: Tony H.

description:
One if the best pizzas I had in a long time. Its all freshly made, they have organic veggies and just a sweet spot to chill at after a long walk on the pier. 

You can also order takeout, we ordered over the phone and it was waiting for us as we got there.
author: Alexis S.

description:
Margherita Pizza was quite good.

Why the two stars? Poor customer service and a bad attitude. I called ahead of time and the guy on the phone was curt and very impatient. He was mumbling, not listening, and seemed completely disinterested in taking my order. Secondly, there was an akward attitude by the cashier while I picked up the pizza.
author: Kaz H.

description:
The pizza was amazing. More of a flatbread almost with the super thin crust. They advertise it as a New York style and it definitely delivered, with a California flair. We had the Quattro Formagio with added sausage and it was just big enough for two without getting over full. A bit greasy with all the chess but not overly so. 

It is sort of a hole in the wall off the main touristy area of fishermans wharf but I definitely would go back next time I head down that way.
author: Joseph A.

description: Granted it was just a cheese pizza for our daughter, but for the price it definitely wasn't worth it. Burnt crust, super oily and so-so customer service.
author: Jamie H.

description: Omg this spot is amazing!!! Ordered a custom pizza and it was just perfect. Had to order another to go.
author: Melinda V.

description: I would have given this more stars but the customer service was bad.  The reviews were great on Yelp but the place was EMPTY. every other place had lines. I wondered why and found out. The service was some of the worst I have ever experienced  I guess maybe that is the reason no one was there. There are lots of places in the area. Choose one of them to dine!!
author: Misty W.

description: Tastes good, but rather expensive for what it is. A single-person pizza and a bottle of water goes for like $28.
author: Adrian B.

description:
First I should start by saying I'm not a huge fan of most pizza. They seem to always over compensate by having too much of something or everything. 

We stopped here while exploring a new portion of the city and figured we would take a chance. We chose the simple Margarita pizza and i ate half of it, eagerly! I could eat this more frequently than I would ever own up to. 

Staff was kind and cheerful, the 'oasis' sitting area is comfy and cozy, and the entire experience was exceptional. Bravo and thank you, Carmel Pizza Co!!!
author: Jeni L.

description:
I'm not big on bread. I've been known to eat the inside of a sandwich and leave the bread behind. On big doughy slices of pizza, I'll eat the toppings and leave the entire crust behind. But I do have a weak spot for thin crust pizza. Especially a soft crust with a nice chew. I'll eat an entire slice of that. Crust and all! Carmel pizza company has the type of pizza I'm looking for. On Saturday, September 12th around 1:45pm, Rodney H and I stopped by for lunch.

We shared the Diavola ($17): mozzarella, arugula, asiago, pepperoncini picante, salame piccante. Let's start with the crust. Thin, but not cracker thin, so you still feel like you're eating something substantial. The crust held up the toppings well. Spicy, melty with a nice freshness from the arugula. And I loved the chewy crust. Wash it down with nice cold beer and you have a great pairing. I opted for Anchor steam beer.

CPC is outdoors, but it's actually enclosed pretty well. On a chilly day, you don't feel the wind or cold much. They've done a nice job with the space.

Great pizza in a fun casual atmosphere. Who knew this existed in a touristy area?! I think I now have a reason to come to here more often.
author: Elena N.

description:
During our trip to San Francisco, we decided to have pizza for dinner.  Within easy walking distance of our Fisherman's Wharf hotel was Carmel Pizza.    We loved the simple outdoor seating in the pretty patio.   As soon as we saw the variety of pizzas we knew we had made the right choice.   While the Tutto Porko with mozzarella, Applewood smoked ham, Italian sausage, Italian dry salami and pepperoni was so incredibly tempting, we were in the mood for something lighter.

We settled on the Crudo e Parma, which has mozzarella fior di latte, arugula, Prosciutto crudo di Parma, and Parmiggiano reggiano.  It was prefect.  The crust was thin and crispy with nicely charred spots that you get thanks to a wood burning oven.  The toppings were generous and fresh.

The weather was perfect, we thoroughly enjoyed our pizza and nice glass of wine out on the patio.  A great casual location for some authentic wood fired pizza!
author: Pam G.

description: Delicious pizzas and the outdoor patio was absolutely wonderful on this sunny day. I'd highly recommend it for a pit stop if you're in the area. Service was quick and efficient, so the turnaround on tables is quite fast!
author: Eline M.

description:
We stumbled upon CPC when we were going to Bacon Bacon next door & found that it was closed.  Twice.

So the second time around, we opted to stay & try something else.

Enter Carmel Pizza Company.

Everything about CPC threw me off.

The title threw me off.  
I thought it literally was a Carmel Pizza Company.  I expected a thicker crust & a pie for the masses; a bit generic. 

The space threw me off.  
I initially thought tourist, but it's just...cool.  A patio w heat lamps for the SF chill, a cool mist for our warmer days, bubbles dancing in the air automatically above the entrance, homey touches hanging everywhere.  It's straight up charming.

The pizza threw me off.  
We ordered the Diavola...
arugula, asiago, mozzarella, pepperoncini picante, salami picante.

The crust:
A thin wood fired pizza oven crust that was impressive.  If it's not soggy, you're ahead of the game.  It was not at all soggy.  Win.

The toppings:
A light spread of delicious red sauce.  It was delicate but still delivered big on flavor.  The pepperoncini picante added a divine heat that didn't reveal itself on first bite, but on first inhalation.  The salami picante complimented the pepperoncini like 2 coworkers that love working together.  And the addition of asiago as a star instead of just a small supporting role?  A fantastic medley of flavors.

It was a thoroughly outstanding pie.

We were told that there are no other locations.  This is it.  They started as a catering company, & set up shop here 3 years ago.  What a great addition to SF's pizza landscape.

And A HUGE upgrade to the food options on the wharf.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: We got Americano pizza and Divola pizza OMG everything was so fresh it is a must try if you are in town.
author: Laura G.

description: Excellent pizza, quick service, outdoor dining.  It was so good on the night of the 4th we went back two days later.
author: Matt Q.

description: Perfect, laid back ambiance. Quick and friendly service. Pizza and salads were delicious.
author: Allysia B.

description: One of the best pizzas I've ever had! So good we went back to eat there the next day. Very chill environment with extremely fresh ingredients! If we are ever in San Fran again, we will be going back!!
author: Autumn T.

description:
I don't 'love' pizza, I like it. My husband loves pizza. We were in San Francisco and had several days of large meal and just wanted a simple meal. I checked on yelp while we were walking along Fisherman's Wharf and stumbled upon the reviews for Carmel Pizza. What a find!

First of all it is a glorified food truck, literally. It has been enhanced with an adorable garden like dining patio that is blocked off from the street.  There are no more than maybe 12 tables. They have very reasonably priced bottled beer, wine, soft drinks and water.  The pizza is by far the best I have had in years. Fresh ingredients, the thinnest crust I have ever seen and delicious. 

The staff is very friendly and engaging. Try it, you will love it.
author: Jane M.

description: Ordered the Romantica and the Margarita and both were very fresh with thin crust. Cute food truck like setup right on fisherman's wharf!
author: Steve N.

description:
This is a hidden, quaint permanent food truck. Not a lot of seating so I imagine it could get pretty crowded at lunch time. The staff was nice enough. They welcomed us in just to sit if we needed to. (We'd planned on eating here anyway.)

The pizza was quite tasty (Bianca + sauce + mushrooms). Not too much sauce and cooked just until toasty. I love thin crust pizza. Wish there was oregano/garlic/etc. for the table. House-shaved parmesan for a dollar. For some, the portions for pizza and salad may be a tad small but I think it's just enough not to overeat.
author: Aisha M.

description:
Here's why the one star review: I walk up and ask for a pepperoni pizza. They tell me it will be $17 and change. No idea how big or small the pizza is. But in this tourist trap area (fisherman's wharf) the price doesn't surprise me. Fine. I then ask for a cup of water. They proceed to tell me that I can purchase a bottle of water. I ask "So, you can't give me a cup of tap water?" Their response was "We don't have cups."

Really? Well then get cups. Forcing people to purchase bottled water is BS. Especially when I'm paying $17+ for a pizza. Stop gouging the customers. No tap water in a food service establishment? Not to mention SF has some of the best tap water around. Doesn't matter how good the pizza is, I won't be back.

P.S. No restrooms either.
author: Yelper F.

description: Greasy! Almost inedible. Stopped eating and ate somewhere else. Plus there is an up charge for everything!
author: Jimmie C.

description:
Loved this place! It's outdoors but the patio is heated and so comfortable! Also, not everyone's favorite but it is dog friendly! They brought out a dog bowl of water for our 2 little pup-babies! 
Besides all that the food was really good! We got the Romantica pizza, so good!! So many flavors! We will be back!!
author: Toni Marie A.

description: Wow! What a gem! I lived in San Fran for 9 years and rarely ventured down to Fisherman's Wharf. I returned this past weekend and rented a place near  Ghirardhelli for the airshow. Lucky for me my Airbnb was walking distance to Carmel pizza company. After a poor customer service experience at Tony's pizza I enjoyed meeting the owner of Carmel Pizza company and supporting his business. The heated patio is so quaint and cute. The little pizza oven is housed in a permanent food truck setting and it's so adorable and casual. The Caesar salad has wonderful dressing that the owner makes from scratch. We had 2 different pizzas and both were excellent and super fresh. The heirloom tomatoes were wonderful. I highly recommend this place for a casual fun date or family outing. Very welcoming, low key and great experience.
author: Shannon B.

description: Fisherman's Wharf is packed with chain restaurants, touristy faves, and seafood eateries aplenty so why did we end up at a pizza food truck? Because it's the best place to eat when you're in this area.  Wood-fired, fresh, steaming hot and oh so tasty, Carmel Pizza Company, I left my heart in this specific spot of San Francisco.  Ok, maybe I'm putting a little too much on it but please do check out their Quattro Formaggi because they put lotso cheeses on that delicious crust.  $18 for a pizza for two and some soft drinks.  It was a perfectly beautiful sunny day so sitting in the charming outdoor garden added to our experience.
author: Julie C.

description: The food was not what I would expect for$21 plus tax. I know we are in a tourist area, but the crust was so thin you could almost see through it. We tried it because it was fast, but don't need to go again. Customer service was poor. We went 20 minutes before their "closing time" and were told we had to do take out.
author: Johnny W.

description: We walked from our parking spot like 4 blocks away. We loved the outside set up. The girl who took our order was really nice and pretty. The lighting was perfect. We ordered 5 pies that night! All came out bomb! The pizza with jalapeños on it is really good but boy let me tell you, that sucker is HOT. What I didn't like was the rest room was like a block away. But that's San Francisco for ya...I will return when I'm back in the city.
author: Marc L.

description:
Damn good wood-fired pizza in a cozy outdoor setting by Fisherman's Wharf. 

I am beginning to check off pizza places in San Francisco from my must-try-pizza-list and I recently stopped by Carmel Pizza Company.  I first noticed their sign said that their pizza was fired in an oven powered by almond wood--interesting.  I can't say that I noticed anything different in taste; but, I digress.  The location is right near pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf.  Yes, it is in a touristy area but it is still worth a visit.  The owners seemed to have converted a food truck into a shaded patio area with some interesting decorations featuring succulent plants (see the pic I posted), metal tables, and trellises.  We ordered two pizzas, the Quattro Formaggi with sausage (mozzarella, asiago, gorgonzola, and pecorino toscano;18.00$) and Romantica with pepperoni (mozzarella, arugula, balsamic glaze, heirloom tomatoes, and parmigiano reggiano; 19.00$).  Non-meat toppings were 1 dollar and fancier meaty ones were 2 bucks each.  Vegetable ingredients are locally sourced from the farmers market, a nice bonus.  I should note that they also serve beer and wine. 

Our food was served mind-alteringly-fast.  I forgot how quick wood-fired pizza cooks.  The size was about 14inches per pie.  The pizza was a bit pricey in my opinion but I soon forgot about that when I tasted it.  I preferred the Quattro formaggi over the Romantica because I don't like green stuff on my pizza :]  Overall, this is excellent pizza indeed with fresh toppings and chewy-wood-fired crust that you won't skip eating.   

*Tip: Check-in on Yelp for a dollar off any pizza.
author: David D.

description: Good pizza, Relaxed ambiance, outdoor seating with heaters, and friendly service. Right by fisherman's wharf but not a touristy place. Recommend!
author: Merve A.

description:
The VegeGregian Review:

Very popular for the hip families ;) 
Located on a strip of what seems to be a permanent food truck park very close to the wharf. Cute outdoor seating area with a limited number of tables but people seem to come and go pretty fast. Order at the window of the food truck and they are super speedy with your food!! I feel like we only waited maybe 5 minutes for our food. Definitely check out the fridges to the left of the window where you order for tasty bottled drinks (not just your typical sodas either, they have some healthy fruit juices). 

PIZZA TIME!
Romantica ($17): Mozzarella fior di latte, arugula, Heirloom tomato, Balsamic glaze, Parmigiano reggiano.
Delicious thin crust, fresh toppings, slightly charred but not burnt, moderately generous with the toppings, and decent sized pizza for the price. 
Came here with my mom and dad (3 people). We shared 2 pizzas and it was just perfect for us. 

Tip: Check in on Yelp and you get $1 off any pizza!
author: Greg T.

description: I was in the mood for something other than seafood and found this little hidden gem.  The aroma of the charred crust had me before I even ordered.  Kept it simple and went with pepperoni....came out quick and tasty with enough toppings.  Crust was nice, thin and the sauce was flavorful but could've been a bit thicker.  I really did like this place, true "mom & pop" type of place among the hustle of the Wharf.   I will definitely come back next time I'm in town.
author: Rj G.

description: Great Pizza! Thin crust and all traditional toppings are available. Soft drinks/bottle water are reasonably priced. Beer/wine are $6. Heated patio and $1 off if you pay with cash. 5% SF employee added. Great place if you want a quiet place to grab a bite and a yummy thin crust pizza.
author: Kacie M.

description: Pizza was absolutely delicious. Light and fresh.  Ambiance was nice. Brought wife and kids and shared two pizzas and drinks for 38 bucks. We need a place like this down in Texas.
author: Essmyerdaniel P.

description:
This pizza is amazing. Actually tastes like pizza that would come out of Naples! It's about 250 feet away from my job and my coworkers and I visit the lovely ladies and gents of Carmel Pizza Co. at least once a week. Our boss loves their cheeseless pizza and we love getting a Margarita with Pepperoni! Keep up the good work and continue to feed us delicious pizza, guys! 

Couldn't help but be ... cheesy ... (haaaa.)
author: Maria Francesca A.

description: Great woodfire pizza. A block away from the wharf but worth the walk for those that don't like seafood.
author: Rene M.

description:
Fast service, great fresh pizza and salads with good drinks and some wine / beer. 
Not too much of space to sit but cool place and run by nice girls.
author: Nadav Keren G.

description: This is a great little place. It's a little hard to find, but worth the search. The pizza was great, and the crust was awesome!
author: Joel R.

description: We enjoyed this pizza so much that my daughter wanted to have it again the next night (and we did!). Great neopolitan-style pizza.
author: Shane M.

description:
Placed am order here on yelp, was easy and even got a $1 off... as for the place and pizza, 1star. I didn't enjoy the service, the pizza, the location, or the shops next to it while we waited. Pizza lacked flavor in all areas, sauce, toppings and cheese. The dough was no good, mostly Burnt on the bottom yet undercooked everywhere else. Waited over 20 mins after arriving for 1 personal pizza. 

1star for yelp and 1 for them.
author: Cody B.

description:
Service was really quick.
The crust was great.
The topings really didn't do it justice.
Don't order the americano

They also charge a $1 cover fee
author: David W.

description:
Tourist trap

Won't serve tap water, have to buy bottled

Can't make any changes to pizza, no half and halfs

Pizza is way over priced, $18 for $1 ingredients 

Charge $1 for Parmesan cheese, come on really? 

No bathroom
author: Rich b.

description: An oasis in a desert of tourist attractions. The pizza is neapolitan style and superbly made. The space is relaxing. Great way to recuperate if you've been in the pier area for too long.
author: Micah H.

description: Cute little "whole in the wall" pizza joint. Sauce was fantastic. Ordered the margarita pizza twice on our vacation!
author: Mike P.

description: Adorable and affordable! Cute and quaint little pizza spot. Definitely enjoyed the pizza and the ambiance
author: S B.

description: one of the best vegie pizza I've had. note this is a stationary food truck w wood-fired oven with heated patio.
author: Jim M.

description:
I spent just shy of $50 on two pizzas and drinks for the four of us. I went next door to get a couple of empanadas...which I figured would be a nice appetizer for the pizza. They asked us to leave due to 'no outside food being allowed'...even though we had their pizzas in front of us. So we ate standing up outside their restaurant...there were only two tables being occupied inside.  

Can't say much about the pizza since I just swallowed it quickly....
author: Sam R.

description: Perfect spot to stop and grab a delicious lunch, the diavola pizza is amazing, the peppers on it aren't too hot they're super flavorful!
author: Tailor B.

description: Amazing pizza!  The wood fire adds great flavor to the fresh, local ingredients.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Zachary H.

description: Wanted to try this though the pricing seems happy FH fir what it is. I ordered pizza and wine and asked for ice water. They told me I had to busy it by the bottle and no ice. Whatever.
author: Scott H.

description:
This was a gem of a find in the permanent food truck lot at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco!  The "Bianca" (white pizza) is phenomenal!!!!  Great food, nice 'patio seating' - covered and heated - and very friendly and attentive staff.

Next time I'm in San Fran, I will be back for another pizza!
author: Anthony T.

description: Pizza is good service is terrible our bull was 51$ we gave 40$ cash and putting the rest on a card he still put the whole amount of 51$ on my card and  tried to keep the 40 in cash.
author: Yusmine M.

description:
For us, the pizza lived up to the hype (all those 5-star Yelp reviews)!

Such a cute, casual place... plenty of heaters to keep you warm, cute plants and decor. The service is also very casual and friendly/homey. We ordered one Margherita pizza with added ham and mushrooms to share, and an order of the garlic cheese bread. It was a perfect amount for the two of us! The crust is thin, crispy, and wasn't soggy - like other wood-fire pizzas we've tried. The sauce and cheese combination was delicious --- comparable to the best pizzas we've had in Italy!
author: Leigh R.

description: The wood baked pizza is fantastic here. Price is very good too. Just a heads up, the service was pretty weak. I ordered a pizza to go and they complete forgot about me while sitting there waiting for it...
author: Les S.

description: We ordered a white pie and a marghretti. I was a little disturbed at first cause the white pie had been burnt but thats what you get from a brick oven. First time I also had garlic in every bite. Next time I will ask being allergic to alot of things. The service was good and if there's no room they do accommadate. Soda's were alittle pricey. I had a water on me being it was hot day. An it was not frowned upon so thats was excellent as well.
author: Colleen D.

description: Walking around Fishermans Warf and we decided we wanted pizza. Knowing how great the Italian food is in San Francisco I wanted something good. So we found this placements n YELP and it was only a two block walk so we decided to try it. Glad we did. The Pizza was very good. I like the Margarita. Wood fired, great flavor and a crispy crust. We ordered two pizzas with 2 cokes and a beer. For my kids and me. Might have given them 5 stars but on a $50 bill they wouldn't break a $100 which was all I had. Shocked since they give a discount if you pay cash and it was lunch time. Honestly think the girls at the counter just didn't want to make change. All around good experience and we enjoyed the food.
author: Jim M.

description: Pizza was not bad but if you have to pay 20 dollar it's way too expensive for what you get. Also there is no restroom here, even for paying customers! That's awful!
author: Bort G.

description:
I came here and ordered 1 pizza on July 4th at about 8.30pm. I knew there would be a bit of a wait because it was busy. I waited 30 min and started to notice other people who ordered after me receiving pizza, so I asked how much further until mine would be ready, and was told they hadn't made it yet. I asked for a refund, it was given however I was also short changed.
Being busy isn't an excuse for poor service. I don't recommend this place. Go up the road a little further.
author: Christopher M.

description: Good lord the food in San Francisco is great!  This is the best crust I have EVER had. Only had a cheese pizza since that what my 3 year old likes, but wow.
author: Shawn M.

description: Everything about this place is amazing! Heated Patio, wood fire oven, decor, food and more specifically vibe! Was debating between Margherita and Bianca; our pizzaiolo offered to combine both into one! Looking forward to coming back again!
author: Alex P.

description:
Wow!! I was a little suspicious of the reviews being so good BUT BELIEVE them! Great pizza. Quality pizza, amazing thin crust... Delicious! Look, it is a glorified food truck w tables but they do a very nice job creating a nice outdoor dining area. Great location and staff were so, so friendly. We actually hung around after we ate our pizza and had another glass of wine and chatted with the staff. 

We would certainly recommend this place and next time we are in San Francisco, we WILL come back. Thank you!
author: Chris E.

description: Pizza was delicious, one of the best I've had and I'm a pizza junkie. Also I wAs there on 4th of July and I got my pizza in like 5 minutes and ate it on the cool little street side tables. People were throwing fireworks in the streets by my table and the cops were driving around on dirt bikes trying to catch them. Also there's two beautiful girls working in a hip little food truck by the ocean. I was in pizza heaven. My new all time favorite
author: Joshua W.

description: Everything from the crust to the sauce, phenomenal. Dare I say it, the best pizza I had in years. What's even better is that the price for something this great, what a deal.
author: Marisa B.

description: Bomb little place with great fresh food hot and cute cute outdoor area. At night it closed in with heat lamps. Very cute fun little place.
author: Chrissy P.

description: Loved this place. Pizza was fantastic. Family of 4 split two pies for a late lunch. Highly recommend.
author: Mark S.

description:
I paid 30 dollars for a 10" pizza and 2 Cokes in glass.  

I ordered a "Americana" supposed to have ( mozzarella, Italian Sausage, olives, mushrooms, & ham). My wife and I was so hungry we didn't notice that they forgot to put the ham on it. SmH. 

I guess it was our fault for not noticing, but for this price we shouldn't have to worry.

Also very little toppings.  I would tread carefully.


The servers were nice, but not worth the money.
author: R M.

description: What a great place to grab a pizza. It is unique and AJ along with the staff are awesome. It is casual but if u love true I Italian pizza and a beer or glass of wine this place is the best. Small but very accommodating!!! Try it you'll like it!!
author: Nancy M.

description: Not something that's super great but it's good. I would come here again when I want pizza. First time I had anchovies on my pizza  pretty yummy
author: Glacier M.

description: Great little pizza joint with covered outdoor patio for warmth on chilly afternoons.  Nothing fancy but very tasty wood fired pizza and cold beer.  We got the Americana and Anchor Steam amber ale.  Returned a second time before our trip to San Fran was over.
author: Kathy D.

description: Fantastic pizza. Usually a fan of thick crust, but their wood-fire cooked thin crust is amazing. Friendly staff and amazing food
author: Tyson W.

description: Cannot go wrong here.  We wanted some good food without a fuss and nailed it trying this place.  Awesome brick oven pizza.  Crust was perfecto!
author: K V.

description: We wanted something light this evening and shared a Romantica pizza. Mozzarella, Arugula, balsamic glaze, heirloom tomato, parmigiano reggiano. It was fabulous and was ready in just a few minutes. Order at the window, pay and grab a table in the cute little covered patio. Highly recommended!
author: Michael S.

description: A bit expensive but we are on the San Fran waterfront, basically.  THE PIZZA IS OFF THE CHARTS GOOD!
author: Keith C.

description:
It's roughly 8 am in the morning and a friend and I wake up and tart craving pizza. We brainstorm for a second and I tell her I know of a place down at fisherman's wharf that has amazing pizza and it's delicious. We both agree that's what we want but take probably 4 more hours to get out of bed.

Rested, relaxed and all fresh and smelling like a like a late night drink we walk out into the blinding light of the world. Caught two buses and a short walk with the assistance of gps to the spot. Not a line in sight nor person knowing of this little gem in sight. We walk up and are greeted by a woman, she asked if I have been here before I said "yes" then continued with a flurry of questions. 

The chef or "pizza dude" told me he'd give me a card full o stamps for being a returning customer. I happily responded with thank you! We ordered two glasses of wine, a pepperoni and a pizza called something that completely slips my mind. It did consist of arugula and prosciutto and also a Caesar salad.

We sat patiently after I was told They'd bring our drinks out and we sat and drank. Waited and waited for roughly 10 mins and no salad. No biggie I figured they'd maybe bring it with the pizza. Out comes the pizza and no salad. 

Luckily our senses were overwhelmed with joy and mouths were watering from the fresh Parmesan regiano and prosciutto and pepperoni. We quickly dug in and were in heaven. Thin slices with an airy crust and just enough grease to satisfy but not make you sick or skin greasy and the rich and bold taste of the marinara even though lightly spread across the doughy goodness.

We completely forgot about the salad and nor did we care at that point. So we let it slide. We devoured both pizzas matching slice for slice like Blows in a Ali and Frazier match. Both stuffed and feeling overly satisfied I walked up to pay. 

I told them after handing them my card thy I never got my salad and I guess it slipped the woman's mind completely and she asked I wanted it now. I politely declined and paid. The price was a bit steep but given the satisfaction I didn't have any worry in my mind. 

If you're looking for some of the best pizza (artisan) pizza in the city look no further. You won't have a line here like at Tony's or Cappos of north beach and you get quality service. Although after you get your food nobody comes and checks on you to see if you're satisfied. 

Overall job well done Carmel!!

PS. I may have told my date I've been here but mid way through I told her I've never been lol but have tried a cold Slice from a friend.
author: Robert B.

description: Gr88 place for pizza. We loved the greenery in the small space - very friendly staff and gr88 pizzaSs
author: Namrata S.

description:
I'm not a pizza connoisseur/not a fan of thin crusts so I feel that the pizzas here fall in the 3.5 star range.  

However, what they lack in crust these pizzas make up for in terms of freshness and authenticity (could see the woodpile in the back!).  We ordered a Margherita pizza and a mushroom, dried tomato and sausage pizza.  The thin crunchy crust shifted the focus to the fresh tomato sauce and the cheese, and the results were ultimately satisfying.

Service was somewhat slow, especially since we were the only ones getting food, and the pizza is slightly on the pricey side.
