However, the seating area was a lovely patio type arrangement, open to the air and even with a fountain.  Not a lot of seating room though, more like one of the stands that you see on the side of the road or a food truck with an extended covered eating area, but this pizza place is very much worth a visit if you are dropping by Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Emily Y.

description: My mother and I are frequent SF visitors and I have been looking up and down the whole city looking for a good pizza place. I'm glad to say my search has ended!!  Carmel pizza company has the BEST pizza! If you are ever in town and are craving a delicious authentic pizza come stop by there shop. They have the cutest set up outside and they deliver your pizza really fast to you. Amazing Customer service as well! They deserve 5 stars! :)
author: Leeza S.

description: The smell alone made me take notice, at first I walked past looking for someplace else. But I keep thinking of the smell and the pizza I saw. So I went back and wasn't disappointed. The cheese was awesome, sauce and pepperoni very good. Great experience, is definitely stop back in for another pie.
author: Keith H.

description:
This pizza was delicious. The ingredients were fresh, the wood firing was great, and the cute atmosphere was enjoyable. Great work in creating a great place around a permanent food truck. 

Eat here. Enjoy the food. 
Price? Yes it's pricey, but I guarantee the ingredients are not cheap.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Found this place on yelp and had no idea it was a food cart, being from Portland, this was a pleasant surprise. We got there apparently 1 minute before they closed but we had no idea until they started closing things up. They weren't rushing us out at all! We asked if they wanted us to take it to go but they insisted we stay and enjoy! Super friendly people. The owner, I assume, came out and was tossing dough out on the street. He put on a kind of fun little show, showing off for a tour bus. Just great welcoming atmosphere all together.

The pizza was very good! The crust was done perfectly! I had the 4 cheese pizza and my husband had the tomato and arugula pizza. We both loved it. It did remind me of pizza I've had in the Mediterranean.

As we were leaving and thanking them, the owner, again I assume, came and made sure we enjoyed it and were content. Wonderful experience!
author: Kara E.

description: Decided to try this place based on reviews...pizza was ok...since it was just myself and daughter (she only likes cheese), I asked if we can do a half and half...the answer, NO.  So decided on margarita...then I was told it would be $1 cheaper if I paid cash, which really means they charge a dollar more.  When pizza was brought to us, I asked for parmesan cheese...well this was also an additional charge....NEVER MIND!
author: Pammy C.

description: Incredibly yummy! Fresh and interesting ingredients. Very pleasant atmosphere and friendly staff. Nice little selection of bottled beers and sangria.
author: Laura B.

description: Very good pizza, fresh made,clean environment. I think it's over priced for the medium size pizza you get. The lady at the counter seemed very rude and threaten to charge 20% automatic tip because of large party. We had 3 separate tables with 3 separate bills, Hello!!! Be nice to your customers and they will come back otherwise, not! Oh, another thing, it is not a restaurants. it's like a food truck made looked like a restaurant. Because of rudeness and high $$$ I say 1 star.
author: Xavier S.

description: Great service friendly staff so yummy best pizza I've had in a while and I would definitely recommend them to my folks thx for the grub
author: Dean D.

description:
This is the best pizza I've had ever! The staff are very friendly and serve you immediately. Even though its a food truck in a wood housing,it is amazing. Also, the wood adds some authenticity to it.

I ordered the Margarita pizza with tomatoes and the thin crust was delicious! The cheese was also great. I love this restaurant and I highly recommend this fabulous pizza place.
author: Marshy M.

description:
This place has the thinnest pizza I've ever devoured in my life and it was absolutely delicious! My boyfriend and I shared a build your own pizza and just topped it with pepperoni and sausage. Simple as it was, the pizza was a highlight of our night since it had the perfect amount of melted cheese and since the dough was very thin, we didn't feel so guilty about eating it after eating so much other touristy junk food that day.

Workers are nice and it's an outdoor eatery with extremely limited seating. It's indeed a wonderful experience to eat at such a small gem as this place, so I do recommend to any pizza lover!
author: Katie L.

description: Great little wood fired pizza shop. You can order one of theirs or have them make your own pizza specialty. They also offer good Caesar salads and an assortment of your favorite drinks and some less known flavors. The drinks are in a cooler, they don't have them from a fountain. I will eat here again. For a salad, one pizza and two drinks it was $37.
author: Kristine C.

description: If you want to pay 18 for a thin burned piece of bread with a drizzle of marinara sauce and no flavor, this is your place. No flavor. Bad service. I paid 52 dollars for 3 pizza's. The blonde girl that takes the orders is impatient and rude. There are at least 15 other places to eat within a mile radius. Fellow Yelpers let me down with this one. Smh.  I will NEVER come here again. What a waste.
author: Wana A.

description:
When in Fishermans Wharf one would think youd be grubbing on something fishy, however on this particular day, some of the members in our party werent in a fish mood, so a quick search brought up this small little pizza place. 

Its a very small place with only outdoor seating, a very pleasant atmosphere with cute little plants all around the place. The service was great as well. Super attentive and very friendly, they were great at explaning the size of their pizzas and the best choices since we were all having a hard time agreeing on a couple.

We ended up getting the Margarhita (a cheese and basil pizza which we added roasted garlic to), the Americano (whivh included smoked applewood ham, mushrooms, saugage and onion) and we got a simple pepperoni with olive. The pizza was thin crust and sooooo delicious! It is not a heavy pizza so you are able to eat a lot before actually feeling full.

The only downside was that they didnt offer any bacon as an additional topping for the meat lovers, but that aside this place is the perfect little pizza joint! A must try!
author: Daniel E.

description: Why is it closed? For them to take a break for over an hour in the middle of the day! Only in San Francisco does a popular pizza spot shut down in the middle of the day for a lunch break. They should have a rotating staff.
author: Virjilio V.

description:
Came here with my husband and 3 kids at the end of May 2016.

Items ordered and approx. total $70:
-2 pepperoni pizzas
-1 capriccosia
-2 or 3 waters
-1 beer
-1 glass of wine
-1 San Pellegrino

Pros:
-Great pizza! Thin, fresh, tasty!
-Nice seating area - it's outdoor, but it feels intimate
-Location is great, especially if you don't want to eat at all the regular chain stuff around the pier
-Our food came out really fast

Cons:
-Not a lot of seating, but we were able to all sit at one table together

We'll definitely come back when we're in San Francisco!
author: Dawn S.

description:
This is fast becoming a must stop at joint when I'm in San Francisco! Everything is baked to order... It's an artisan pizza joint without all the foo foo. 

Niece-let wanted a custom job. Sausage, onion and bell peppers! Yum!
author: Eric B.

description: Cutest little restaurant. Service was amazing and the pizza was so good. We even had to go order more.
author: Sally G.

description: The eating area looked like a cute little patio, very welcoming and comfy. The pizza was DELISH! We ordered a margherita pizza and a pepperoni for the kids. The dough was great, thin crust, the ingredients tasted fresh and the pizza was cooked perfectly. I specifically loved that it was a little off of the main pier area, which gave us a nice break from all of the big crowds. Will definitely be back.
author: Mandy G.

description: Little pricey but worth every penny. Cesar salad is also great, proper dressing (garlic key word there) will be back
author: Evan R.

description: Out of all the fancy tourist restaurants down by the wharf, this "food cart" is by far the best if you want some killer pizza! They did a phenomenal job turning this little spot into a welcoming attraction. Not to mention the pizza is outstanding! They do a very authentic job with their brick oven crust and higher end toppings (and I've been to Italy). Plus, the staff was super friendly and quick to serve. This place is a must if you want pizza.
author: Josie S.

description:
This place is amazing. Really simple, good, authentic italian pizza. I got in right before they closed (3:30 on a monday) and was really happy with the pizza that we got. It's pretty much exactly what I'd hoped for from a margherita pizza. I definitely can't wait to go back.

Some advice: pay in cash (card is a dollar extra) and check in on yelp before you pay (I got a $1 coupon!)
author: Amaresh S.

description:
Flew in from San Diego to spend a weekend at Fisherman's Wharf. Found this little place on Jones Street.  It's basically a built up "food truck" with nice outdoor and covered amenities. The pizza is wood fire cooked which just brings all the gourmet toppings to life. Fresh cheese and excellent sausage make the Americana pizza just the best. The service is friendly and attentive.  Even the parmesian is freshly grated! 

I would only recommend this to people who know and can appreciate good pizza.
author: Ramiro G.

description:
Freshest pizza I've ever had!  Tasty, small portion, brick oven pizzas. Had a large group of seven kids and 4 adults. We ordered 6 pizzas (Margherita and veggie) and it was not enough!  Due the high quality ingredients, it's a tad pricey (but worth it). Will be back for sure, just with a smaller group :) 
Oh, and it's worth mentioning, no public restrooms here or within a one block radius!
author: Shanna B.

description:
Well a year later and I'm back in San Francisco and my first lunch stop was Carmel Pizza and I'm glad it was. Just yummy. Light flavorful crust, fresh cheese and tasty mild tomato sauce. 

Amazingly the owner remembered me from last year!

I'll be back, that's for sure.
author: Jeffrey D.

description: Pizza was okay but very small portion for price. Want there with family to find out no bathrooms. Had to walk 2 blocks with kids to find a bathroom.
author: Joseph F.

description:
I really enjoy pizza margarita. Especially after coming home from Italy a few years ago and eating a ton of Napolitano pizza margarita during our visit. The pizza margarita here reminded me of our trip there, add the open patio and you have a very good American Italian experience.  The wife even laughed when I asked to just hang out for a little longer at the patio because it reminded me of Italy. 

Near perfect Italian Coal fired pizza flavor! Will be back for a second visit on our vacation for sure!
author: Jason M.

description: I just had the Diablo pizza here after eating at a terrible seafood place on the wharf. The pizza was absolutely amazing!! If I could eat another, I would have. I love spicy food and the pizza didn't disappoint.
author: Brad L.

description: Great brick oven pizza. Loved the crust on this pizza. Ambiance was cool as well.  Two pizzas fed 2 adults and 2 kids. Great little place to escape from the large crowds in this area.
author: Todd U.

description: Hands down the BEST! The staff was so friendly and awesome!!!! We arrived and ordered about 15 minutes till close, we didn't realize till after we orders! They said they didn't mind and for us to sit down and relax! The pizza was seriously the Best! We will for sure be returning here!!!
author: J.C. F.

description: I came as a tourist, but this place it by far one of the places I have ever had pizza! Friendly staff, great product and right by the action. I highly recommend it as a lunch spot. The sangria is an excellent pairing as well.
author: Jeff S.

description: Traveled here from LA So-Cal, during mid day, 3:20 exactly, they closed down for Lunch, when proceeded to ask attendant how long they would take, guy rudely answered another hour. Disappointed from a location in such a busy neighborhood.
author: Pedro V.

description: Pretty good fresh and local wood fired pizza place, particularly for a super touristy area. If you're not looking for commercial food -- go here.  Note: If you're a super hungry man. You'll need a pizza for yourself.
author: Dan V.

description: Pizza was tasty, but lacked toppings.. I got the americano which seems like it has lots of meat, but literally got barely anything.. seemed like mostly cheese! Good but lacked the toppings.
author: Justine S.

description:
Location is nice, cute atmosphere. The pizza is pretty good thin crust pizza they sell
By the pie not the slice so that was a bit of a downer. Pizzas aren't very big about 5-6 small slices enough for one maybe 2 it's also pretty pricey. I wouldn't come
Here with a group or kids.
author: Bri G.

description: Fantastic pizza! Very authentic Italian pizza. The only issue is that it closes pretty early, around 8pm. So check the times before you visit and don't be put off by the exterior. Thin crust, fresh ingredients.
author: Rudy B.

description: Some of the best pizza I've ever had. Charming little place away from the crowds of Fisherman's Wharf. Absolutely delicious!
author: David G.

description: Good pizza if your on the wharf and don't care for seafood. Wood fired. Fast. A small selection of sodas, beer, wine and water. Small outdoor seating it's chill with succulent plants hanging throughout.
author: Sylvia T.

description: Very quaint food truck / outdoor patio setup... And the most important thing... Great pizza!  Wood fired, excellent crust...and amazingly fast.  Love it
author: Enrique C.

description: Very good thin crust pizza, quaint outdoor dining, quick service and affordable. Definitely would come back!
author: Trey W.

description: Best pizza we have ever had!! Recommend the Crudo & Parma. Local ingredients, great location,Staff is wonderful  very friendly.
author: Ariel H.

description: This place is a hidden gem! We were greeted by two very friendly people after approaching the truck. Ordered the margherita pizza with pepperoni, came out very fast. Thin crust, melty mozzarella and basil, perfect toasted crust on the pizza. If you want pizza on Fisherman's Wharf, this is the place to go! Very reasonably priced, around $13-$18 a pizza. Also has very impressive decor inside the heated, covered area. Would definitely recommend to all of my friends when in the Wharf area!
author: Brady H.

description: Excellent Neapolitan style pizza, made wth quality ingredients. A small quaint pizza stand, located wharf-side in the middle of all of the action. Reasonably priced as well. All they make is pizza and they make it well! Perfectly charred chewy pizza dough, creamy cheese and savory perfectly seasoned sauce. I recommend!
author: Craig C.

description: Amazing Pizza! Met the owner Amanda who is as nice and beautiful as the pizza she made us! We ordered the Americano on National Pizza day and it did not disappointed best damn pizza in Frisco!
author: Steve M.

description:
It's pretty amazing how much this little parking lot on Jones St. at The Wharf has transformed into a little international food court.  It all started with Tanguito for some Awesomely Awesome Argentinian Cuisine.  Next came the quirky Codmother and her Awesomely Awesome Fish & Chips, Fish Tacos, and Deep Fried Oreos and Twinkies.  That leads us to the new kid on the block that just opened, Carmel Pizza Company.  And they're making a huge statement with their Awesomely Awesome Wood-Fired Pizzas and Porchetta Sandwiches.

Let's start with the Pizza.  We ordered their special of the day which was their Caprese Pizza (http://bit.ly/Xc00uv).  It's basically like a Margherita with heirloom tomatoes, fresh basil, and mozzarella.  This was probably one of the better Margherita pizzas I've had in my lifetime.  The crust was thin but had a nice light crispy texture to it and all together with the cheese and toppings made for a really delicious pie.

The La Porchetta Sandwich (http://bit.ly/T45bxV).  OMGYUM!!  I might get bashed on here if I say that this sandwich is way better than Roli Roti's.  But you have to believe me because it really is!  Prepared pretty much the same way with arugula in an Acme Roll, the big difference here is that it's not as greasy as Roli Roti's.  That actually might turn off a few folks because that's actually an important trait their Porchetta Sandwich has, but for me, I can live without it.  The cracklins and Tuscan spices already provide enough flavor and the big plus is they load up the sandwich with a very generous amount of Porchetta.  I suggest you come here and try it for yourself and be the judge.  You definitely won't have to wait as long as you would at Roli Roti.

Hella good Porchetta Sandwich and Hella Good Pizza!  It's an Awesomely Awesome combo that will make me keep coming back here whenever I'm at the Wharf.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Their Margarita Pizza is to die for. I've been to Italy and the food here is same as how the authentic Italian chefs do it. I highly recommend this spot.

The staff is very friendly and the location has an amazing ambiance.

TIP: Make sure to check-in and you'll get a coupon to apply towards your bill!!!
author: Avi H.

description:
Last 30 minutes open and we were welcomed as if we We're the first of the day - we had 5 pizzas and shared them all -  asked for surprise and got fantastic -  the arugula on the Diablo was so awesome !  
Very very low salt that allows for the fantastic flavors of The toppings through - and the sooo exceptional this crust. !
author: H-D E.

description: Quick and delicious! Would recommend to anyone especially if you have small kids just for the fact the pizza was ready in about 5mins. They use almond wood to cook the pizza and I don't think that it made much of a difference.
author: Eva P.

description: This is a hidden gem. Farm-to-Oven wood fired pizza!  They get all their veggies fresh from local farmers market.
author: Kelly L.

description:
It's rare that my experience is so different that the average Yelp review for a restaurant, but that was definitely the case here. I ordered an Americano pizza for pick up via the Yelp app (Eat 24). For $20 I was expecting something bigger and more tasty. It was dry, without flavor and very small for the price - 10" maybe? How the hell does this place have 4.5 stars?

So many better pizza places in SF. I should have known better when venturing into Fisherman's Wharf for food. Go somewhere else and leave this place for the tourists.
author: Stephen K.

description: Good pizza made fresh to order on a wood fire from local ingredients. Great patio to eat on. This place is way better than  beach street pizza.
author: Jeffrey R.

description: Found the place on Yelp because the family did not want fish at the Fishermans Wharf (go figure) and boy it did not disappoint.  Basically just a food truck but don't let that fool you; still a nice setting to eat.  The wood fired pizza is excellent.  I ordered 2 for the family and they ravaged the food.  I ordered another and that was gone in a heartbeat.   We all wanted more.  As a former NYer this was one of the best pizza I have had on the West Coast; very good.  Would definitely go back if in the area.  The only down side is the pizza is a bit expensive but what is not expensive in San Francisco.
author: Marc O.

description: During our stay in San Francisco while we were in town browsing and picking up souvenirs to take back home we decided to stop by and grab some pizza. We couldn't decide what pizza to get, but when we finally decided and pizza arrived, first bite was like heaven!! It was so delicious just writing about it makes my mouth watery. Definitely will come back when we are back in town. You will not regret coming here. The staff was very welcoming and such a cute layout. Plus if you yelp check in and get $1 off woo hoo
author: Daisy M.

description:
Good pizza, we got the margarita. It's made in a wood fire oven and tastes better than most. 
Nice outdoor seating area as well
author: Hana F.

description:
Carmel Pizza Company is amazing!!! My favorite pizza in the entire world. Bomb.com as described by my husband. The ingredients are incredibly fresh and of high quality. The ambiance is quaint and charming - love the outdoor seating with the succulents covering the walls. 

We had a bianco, romantica (with prosciutto added - do this) and the diavola (plus a side of bruschetta). All incredible - the crust is unparalleled - light and crispy but still substantial enough to hold up the toppings. I chatted with the owners - Amanda and AJ - who were super friendly and obviously passionate about food. Amanda lived in Italy and studied cooking there so these two know their stuff. Go eat here now!
author: Dana P.

description: After a long day in the car, we checked in to our nearby hotel and found this terrific gem.  Delicious authentic "rustica Italiana" pizzas delivered from a stone oven built into a permanently ensconced food truck.  Accompanied by two much-appreciated glasses of house red. If you are in the Wharf area and want to get off the well-tread tourist track, hit this local find!
author: Robert M.

description: Waiting for our pizza. Review in a second. Atmosphere, food truck with a clever patio setup. Wood fired oven. Fun! Quiet and smells delicious. Yelp reviews got us here....don't let us down lol. Wow, it's unanimous with our group...BEST pizza we have ever had!!! The thin crust and the balance of ingredients on the pizza is phenomenal. Whenever we are in San Francisco we will be sure to visit. Thanks Carmel pizza, delicious experience.
author: Donna K.

description: Pizza is good but a bit pricey. Could have used more portion of the toppings. It's a cute little spot in a touristy area.
author: Jessie L.

description: Hidden away in the busy tourist trap of fisherman's wharf, Carmel Pizza Company is a true hidden gem. If you are looking for an authentic wood fired pizza this is the spot! Very tasty and local with friendly staff and very very fast service if you are hungry the pizza comes out extremely fast. It is a little expensive but the product you receive reflects the price. There is no indoor seating but the tables that are there are covered and there are heaters too. If you are looking for a good wood fired style pizza and are in the fisherman's wharf area, this is the place to go.
author: Tyler V.

description:
Fantastic pizza, well worth the price! Ambience was very relaxed. The seating area is very adorable, perfect for a little date or even a catching up spot with friends. 

Customer service was great. They were patient when we chose our pizza. And gave us a $1 off if we paid in cash. Love how quick they were with clearing the table when we finished eating. 

At first I was iffy about the pricing. Shared a Margherita pizza with a friend and we loved it! The tomato sauce isn't overwhelming (which is a major plus for me because I hate when I taste tomato sauce than the actual pizza). And the thin crust of the pizza was quite a pleasing touch to it along with the basil.

My other friend got the Diavola. It was a really fresh pizza. The green topping added a unique taste to the pizza and overall was better than I expected to be.

The pizzas are worth the prices!

The downfall was that the pizza was slightly burnt, but it wasn't that serious to complain about. 

The succulent wall is absolutely adorable, by the way. 

Glad that I tried this place out!
author: Amy T.

description:
The best pizza I had in the US and I'm not even kidding. 

The dough, OMG the dough. They have the thinnest, most delicious dough ever. It's slightly salty too so has it's own taste. I could seriously just eat the plain dough w/o the toppings.
That being said, the toppings were great too. All in all, the combination of wood oven + tasty thin dough + fresh toppings gives you the best pizza in the country. Not cheap but definitely worth it.
author: Burçin D.

description: We had a great pizza here! This is pizza! When you eat it, you enjoy the taste of pizza, not filling with dough.
author: Handan A.

description:
Thin pizza with crispy crust. Had the Romantica with prosciutto-delicious. 
Was pleasantly surprised with the awesome variety of flavored San Pellegrinos and juices. 
Played chill Pandora station, Jazzanova-worth the listen.
author: Paige S.

description:
Exactly what I was hoping for! It was a charming outdoor pizzeria located in Fisherman's Wharf with excellent customer service. To my pleasant surprise, the owners were the ones taking my order & making my pizza. They were nice, welcoming, & a pleasure to interact with. 

Great price too, my partner & I split a Build-Your-Own 12" pizza & it was delicious & filling. They also hand-grate their Parmesan cheese, which I thought was a touch of class. I totally recommend this place for any visitors to San Francisco, it will not disappoint & it will be time well spent on your vacation. :-)
author: S G.

description:
My fiancé and I came here because it was down the way from our hotel and the reviews and pictures looked great. As we tried our first bite we thought...it's ok. Not something that you'd say a must have. Flavors are good but very little sauce, crust was a little burnt and on some bites were pretty salty. Plus it was a bit pricey for what you get.

My fiancé just finished his pizza and complained to how salty it was. If you love salty food then this pizza is for you. If not then go for something else.
author: Amanda Y.

description: This pizza was awesome. Crunchy chewy crust and the toppings were perfectly cooked. More importantly, the owner/operator was fantastic. We showed up 10 mins before they opened for lunch and the owner invited us in, gave us a beer, and let us hang out while they fired up the pizza oven (wood fired oven). Great place!
author: Mike R.

description:
Super tasty pizza for lunch 

Had the margarita pep pizza 

Super flavorful and crust is thin n crispy
author: Josh M.

description: Amazing and so friendly - - what a cool experience in a tourist trap area - they take pride in ingredients and craft !
author: Christopher K.

description:
Really tasty pizza in a fun, quasi-outdoor area. Probably more money than you'd want to pay for the amount of pizza you're getting, but they had a margherita for $12 (all the others were $16-$19). 

The pizzas were pretty quick, despite there being a fair number of folks there - ours came out in under 10 minutes. The crust is excellent, that Amici-style, and the sauce was really good, too.

I'd definitely come back if I was in Fisherman's Wharf and people didn't want seafood, but we had a group of 2-7 people. The succulent decor looked really cool as well.

Also, closed on Wednesdays.
author: Ari F.

description: Awesome place! What a treat for my family's visit to San Francisco
author: Karl K.

description: Pizza is good ! Service could be better ! Will be back for the . Got the Blanca with pepperoni! They don't serve by the slice but my family of 3 was able to finish the one size they offer ! Lady at the counter is not very friendly .
author: Jennifer L.

description: It is really hard to find good Italian pizza in the US, but this place makes it right!
author: Varga B.

description: This place was really good!  I walked past it the first day and didn't really notice it because truly, it's just a permanent food truck.  I had to use Yelp the second day to even lead me back to it.  I would recommend it to anyone, just pay more attention or you'll walk right by it.  The customer service was on par too.
author: Isaac B.

description:
My boyfriend and I were visiting from San Diego and staying in a hotel around the corner from Carmels.  The reviews looks good so we figured we would try it out.  The pizza was DELICIOUS!!!  The only thing holding me back from giving it that extra star is the price.  Omg, the prices were outrageous for a pizza!!!  When you order, you are given large, but personal size pizzas.  Between my boyfriend and I both ordering our own pizzas, him getting a beer, and me getting a non-alcoholic drink, he paid $50.  That's kinda ridiculous for pizza.   

Taste alone, the pizza was great!!!  But boy oh boy, the prices turn me off a bit.
author: Nicole F.

description:
There's good pizza and then there's great authentic brick oven pizza. Carmel Pizza Co. was amazing. The ambiance of the outside patio with it's floral decorations and perfect shady gazebo made this experience one to remember. My girl and I loved this place! 

Great place to hang with your buds, bring some brews and kick back. Or just bring a good book an an appetite.
author: Laine W.

description: Looking for pizza not too far from our hotel we found this little gem on Yelp. It's basically a food truck made permanent with a charming patio built around it. We had the Caesar salad - yay - you could taste anchovy in the dressing - along with the margherita and diavola pizzas. Both were delicious but I especially liked the spicy bite of the diavola topped with arugula. This meal went well with a cold Peroni. Seating is all out doors with about 7 or 8 tables surrounded by hanging plants. Casual and comfortable. Order at the window and they bring it out to you. Fast and friendly. Wish they were open early because we would grab another pizza for the ride back to L. A. Oh well, we will be back.
author: Tracy M.

description: Pizza is so good! Glad my wife and I made this our first place to eat in San Fransisco.
author: Steve D.

description:
So happy to be back here, been a long 2 years since I was last able to visit this excellent pizza place.  Hope to make it back again sooner next time I'm in San Francisco.

Ordered my favorite, the Diavolo.  So tasty and fresh.  Just as good as I remember.  Absolutely the best pizza I have ever had in my life!  I even had to go back and order a second pie once I finished the Diavolo.

You have to come here if you are ever in San Francisco!
author: Kris H.

description: Thank you Evan and Carmel Pizza Co for a real authentic Italian pizza!! Best in the area! :)
author: Utku F.

description:
Do yourself a favor and eat here! Get away from all those "touristy" overpriced, not so tasty restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf. 

I was visiting the San Fran area for a few days and found myself eating here for a second time with my girlfriend. It was so good the first time that we came back to try different menu items.

This is LITERALLY my first Yelp review...that's how good this place was..it actually made me want to support and congratulate them on the great experience my GF and I had. Keep it up!!
author: Dave A.

description: Friendly staff. Delicious pizza. Only took 10 minutes to get our food. The Margherita was perfect. The Diavola was tasty but very Spicy!!!
author: Diane K.

description:
Best pizza we have had in our visit at San Francisco. 

Thin crust, amazing taste and the young guys working there were really nice.

We recommend this place if you are looking for a good pizza for a decent price.
author: Yuksel D.

description:
I have been craving pizza for months, and after looking on Yelp, we decided to head to the city and go to the Carmel Pizza Company. So glad we did.

The patio is almost romantic, so original, and cozy!  The owner was out talking with folks, pouring wine, and making sure everybody had what they needed.

I was starving when we got there, and thought I might have ordered too much ... but we ate almost every bite!  :)

We started with a red Italian wine and water, and then ordered the cheesy garlic bread, which came out first. It's basically a cheesy, garlic pizza, and very good. It was a tad salty, but still delicious!

We then ordered a Margarita Pizza, and a build your own pizza, with sun dried tomatoes, mushrooms and pepperoni.  The Margarita was fantastic!! Just the right amount if sweetness and spices!  The build your own was also delish!  Very fresh ingredients, and a tasty, thin crust!

The music selection was spot on, and the owner and staff was on top of their game!!

The kind of place you could just sit and chill for hours!!

Side note:  For whatever reason, the place is sort of hidden, even though it is right there! I think it might be because the signage for The Codmother is so in your face.
author: Julee E.

description:
Hidden gem for sure. Located across from the Walgreen, hidden in plain sight, this place would be the only reason I don't calamari or chowder from the wharf. Very customizable and fast service, this pizza is served on exquisite thin crust. 

The employees know their stuff and they aren't too hard on the eyes either. 

The atmosphere of the patio is almost romantic and the music selection is choice. 

Overall, definitely come check this place out. Thank me later with a slice!

Edit: the guy who makes the dough just came out and did freestyle dough throwing for us to watch. And he spent time answering questions and offered us drinks on him. This place just got to the top of my favorite pizzas list.
author: Nick M.

description: A bit pricey, though it is in a touristy area.  Got the Americano, hit the spot in terms of convenience, and location, pizza was thin for my taste.
author: Francis V.

description: Was looking for something to eat like a slice of pizza, and stopped by and decided to have the pizza itself, which I was really surprise, had the combo, really nice place, clean, organize, staff friendly. little bit expensive but good pizza. 4 stars will be good.
author: Erin J.

description:
After reading other Yelp reviews we decided to give it a chance and glad we did. 

Passing by, one wouldn't give this place a second glance. However, after being seated on their heated patio it's quite a calming environment amidst the hustle of the wharf. Soothing wall fountains, succulent arrangements and a lattice sheltering you from the sun are all welcomed and unexpected treats.

We enjoyed the Diavola pizza which was just enough for two people to enjoy after a day of walking the hills. Well, that and a few beers, of course.

Recommended for any travelers, or locals!
author: Ryan N.

description: These guys are awesome!! I brought a group of 40 high schoolers in for dinner on a Saturday evening. They were so ready for us; the pizzas came out hot and fast. I was overwhelmed with the quality of service that my group received here. In addition, the pizza is wonderful. Chewy, crunchy, fresh tasting ingredients... it had everything I look for in a wood-fired pizza. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
author: Bryce H.

description: Fantastic local pizza. Thin crust, oven baked, fresh ingredients! Stop by if you are in the are and want pizza!
author: Lucas F.

description: Very good, if pricy. Nice little  covered garden patio. Very convenient to tourist areas, but with a local feel. Didn't realize it was a food truck, but that only added to the charm.
author: Mindy L.

description: I dont know how this place had 4.5 stars!  This was the first letdown by yelp.  Came to s.f. Thinking im goin to try a new pizza joint with some hearty toppings n real mozzerella cheese!  This place more than fell short.  Ordered all 4 of their faves and paid about 80 bucks for some artisan bs.  Thin burnt crust with no toppings, no cheese, and no sauce.  These artsy fartsy over priced pizzas are killing me.
author: Kalai F.

description: Greatest pizza in SF.  Maybe the West Coast!  People very friendly and accommodating.  Thin very tasty real wood fired pizza!   Great little sitting patio.  My family and I would come again for sure.
author: Steve R.

description:
Amazing pizza, super friendly staff, fun & cozy outdoor setting.  We had the Crudo e Parma and the Diavola, and both were absolutely fantastic.

We picked up a punch card because we will DEFINITELY be back
author: Matt V.

description: Wasn't sure because there's only a small outdoor seating area but it was actually really lovely and nice sitting out there (even on a cold windy day!). The pizza was delicious and I'd love to go back!!
author: Jo B.

description:
I don't venture out this way very much and I suspect that most of the food around Fisherman's Wharf is pretty awful and is only allowed to exist to feed hungry tourists. 

So when I found myself in the area with visiting in-laws, I had low expectations and this place exceeded them thoroughly. 

The setting is simple and cute. A little semi-covered patio with simple Italian decor. The seating was ample enough to fit 6 people and three kids (they were also very cool and accommodating with our seating). The best pizza in my opinion was the diavalo, which was mildly spicy and tolerated well by most of the family. The prices are reasonable (by SF standards at least) and the pizzas are thin so you could share a pizza with someone or easily take one down by yourself.
author: Baron C.

description: Decent pizza. When looking up the location, we expected a restaurant type setting. When we arrived, we realized that the location was more of a fast food setting. Meal was good and service was friendly. Would eat here again if in the area and looking for something inexpensive.
author: April S.

description:
So, while I was in college at the University of Colorado, I was so broke that I couldn't afford pizza. In fact I would hover around my dorm mates like a vulture and eat the crusts, which I called, "the pizza bones."  I've come a long way from those days, I guess. And I sure appreciate a spectacular pizza. Carmel pizza company is one place that knows how to make one. Top 3 pizza in the bay area. Others include Little Star snd Tony's. 

Amanda runs the place with charming efficiency. She's great! Very hospitable.

GET THIS:
Pepperoni pizza
Cesar salad
author: Scott W.

description: Was skeptical of the reviews but went ahead and ordered via yelp.  First of all the app said pick up by 6:07 ...pizzas was ready at 6:07!  It was hot, no issues with pick- up!  Secondly, the pizza is incredible!  My kids and I ate the crust...it was crunchy and perhaps the best I've had.
author: Chris D.

description: I love pizza. Plain and simple. I eat it more often than any other food, so I know a good pizza from an average pizza a little too well. We came here on the perfect San Francisco day. The weather was perfect so it was great to sit at this outdoor restaurant. The girl who worked here was so nice and helpful, made the experience really pleasant. The pizza? To die for. It was a delicious, thin crust, wood fire pizza. I can tell you right now that I will be looking forward to this pizza at my next trip to San Francisco! Must try while you are here!
author: Taylor R.

description:
Permanent food truck place with really good pizza. Extra thin, the Italian style. 
Unique place and friendly service. They have around 8 tables in the open space.
author: Felix G.

description: Killer pizza! Could really taste the fresh ingredients.  One of the very best pizzas I have had, right up there with pizza I had in Brooklyn!
author: al g.

description:
We are happy today,,,Finally we found a good Pizza Spot and Clean compare to the previous Pizza Joint that we visited....the price is like the same and I think because of the high rent in SAN Francisco.

Customer service is ok it could be better... My gf liked it so I'm ok.... Happy GF Happy Life.

I am not sure if this is a Branch but they should put near Peninsula area too.
author: Raff I.

description: Small place with great pizza. Very happy with this find right off of the Warf. We ordered the margharita pizza and cheese garlic pizza app. Both blew our expectations out of the water.
author: Greg H.

description: Superb food and excellent service at a reasonable price. This might be the best pizza I have ever had.
author: Lynette P.

description: Pizza romantica is awesome!!! Good food great service. It's a small place but nice place.
author: Nazim C.

description:
Just pure and simple, Great pizza decent price..
The service was real good 
Pretty Straight Forward...
Don't Think You Will Be Disapointed
author: Ken S.

description:
OMG ANOTHER THIN CRUST PIZZA WIN.

We've been meaning to come here for a while and we finally dropped in on a chilly night. Ordered the Margherita woodfired pizza and waited about 15 minutes while our tummies rumbled and our appetites built up.

Food:
+Margherita Pizza- amazing! perfect amounts of cheese and sauce on a super thin crust. Can't wait to come back and try the other pizzas!

Service:
Friendly 3 person crew running the truck and the tables outside. 

Ambience:
It's on a busy street in Fisherman's wharf with only outdoor seating and no heat lamps, so bring a jacket or be prepared to face the cold.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
wood fired pizza is a terrific place to take kids and enjoy yourself a wonderfully cold beer and a wood fired pizza.. excellent place for the whole family

 I only wish they would make bigger pizzas that's the only downfall
author: Peter S.

description: Was visiting the area and the location was convenient. Decided to give this place a try and was glad I did. While not cheap, the Margheritta pizza was great and cooked perfectly. The ambiance was cool and oasis like, I'd go again.
author: Greg A.

description: I've been here twice and it was delicious both times. I got the margherita both times, and added pepperoni once. It's so fresh, thin and perfectly crispy. It's seriously good pizza.
author: Anne A.

description:
A great spot to eat surrounded by the tourist traps of Fisherman's Wharf. The pizza was tasty. I am not going to write a novel on my experience, just that is was satisfying and definitely worth a try and some place I will return to when I am visiting. 

The pizzas are small for the price. It was a good snack for us but nothing filling. Might want to get one just for yourself.

Lastly, they do not let you bring other food on to their dining area even if you are buying their pizza. There are a couple of other food trucks next door to them that I wanted to try and I thought I can order a pizza and get stuff from the others but there is a big sign that doesn't allow outside food. I totally understand but eating food from Carmel and its neighbors is an experience and I was a little disappointed I was not able too. I will eat there again and see if I can take the pizza over to the other eateries.
author: Nathan P.

description:
----Update 11/5/15----
Came back for a pizza class and it was amazing! Would highly recommend it if you can get a spot.

New Discoveries:
- 4 cheese, olives, and mushrooms - This combination with their 4 cheeses is amazing!
- Pecorino and arugula - So simple but so delicious!

----
This Neapolitan style pizza is thin crust, doughy and chewy on the outside and topped with just the right amount of cheese and meat. The type of pizza most closely resembles Flour and Water, Mozzeria, and Una Neopolitana in that it is thin, but the crust is chewy not crunchy (e.g. Delfina, Beretta, Delarosa). 

I think I have found my new favorite pizza place in San Francisco.
author: Jess C.

description: Too greasy!   Paid $27 for a tasteless greasy  pizza, their tomatoe sauce didn't have any flavor and the pizza was dripping oil all over our plate and staff didn't ever greet us and they were talking to each other while i was ordering.
author: Tita R.

description:
Tasty pizza at a reasonable price in nice surrounds. On a sunny Veterans Day, Fisherman's wharf was swarming with people, but there was plenty of room here.
The pizza was more like a traditional Italian and very tasty wood fired. Yum. Went nicely with a cold beer too!
author: Marcus D.

description: Obviously one of the cutest pizzerias out there. The covered and heated patio creates a delightful ambiance that doesn't make you feel like you are down by pier 39. The family owned style pizzas are to die for, I highly recommend the Bianca and Margherita. Both a great way to fix that pizza craving we all know you have
author: Kai F.

description:
Great pizza spot and cute outdoor seating area. I loved their Neapolitan pizza. The crust was perfectly cooked, with the right amount of chewiness, cheese and prosciutto. I also really liked their pork belly sandwich. All the ingredients were so fresh and tasty. The staff was also super friendly. Only downside is they charge 2 bucks for a bottle of water, when you can go across the street to Walgreens and get it for cheaper.

But overall, loved the food and service. Will definitely be back!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Lovely little food truck with a patio in the middle
of the hustle and bustle. Food was great, atmosphere felt special and not rushed. One pizza was not enough for two hungry sight-seers so we ordered a second. They came out fast and hot. A little pricey for what you get but that's SF!
author: Meghan S.

description: This place is amazing! Highly recommend it. The atmosphere is chill and friendly, while the pizza is perfect.
author: Randa G.

description: I wasn't having much luck finding good eats till I came across this pizza place. crispy crust, full of flavor, fresh, and the people working are very friendly. Super hungry, ate the whole pie. Worth it!!! YOU MUST STOP BY!!
author: Cristina E.

description: Not sure why so highly rated.  Crust was best part of pizza.   Not enough sauce, light on toppings, pizza was very juicy (not in a good way), and they don't have any Parmesan cheese if you want to add once you get pizza.
author: Jay F.

description:
So good. Best pizza I had in San Fran. Crispy crust great sauce. 

Nice little food truck and garden. They sometimes close early and sell out. Must check this out
author: Adam G.

description:
it's true, it's all true!!   
While I carefully read through the reviews before bringing my family here last weekend, looking for a really good pizza, I was still a little skeptical that it could be as good as the other Yelpers say. After all, I've also seen Pizza Hut locations get 5-star reviews.  Anyway, Carmel was just around the corner from our hotel near Fisherman's Wharf so it was an easy walk.  From the moment we arrived until the moment we ate the last piece, we were in heaven.  First of all, the service was warmly friendly with each question and request we had. Every interaction was met with a genuine smile, which is a big deal during Christmas week in San Francisco!
We were four hungry pizza lovers so it was recommended that we share 2-3 pizzas since they're 10-12 inches in diameter.  Of course, we went for 3 because there's nothing worse than running short of pizza except perhaps running short of bacon at breakfast.  We shared a couple of really good Caesar salads that had great dressing and shaved Parmesan cheese.  The pizzas came out shortly after.  These are Neopolitan pizzas cooked in a brick oven so please don't expect something that looks or tastes like a $5 Hot-n-Ready from LC...this isn't that place.  Instead, expect top quality ingredient combinations on a wonderfully flavorful and chewy thin crust that might have a little bit of char from the oven...it's not burnt, it adds to the flavor and presentation. 
All four of us walked away incredulous that we found such delicious pizza near Fisherman's Wharf.  And I don't mean delicious for Fisherman's Wharf, I mean delicious against any pizza I've ever eaten, but it happened to be near the Wharf.  

P.S. In case it isn't obvious from the other pictures, you do eat outside here under a covered veranda with outdoor heaters.  It was plenty comfortable despite the 55 degree outside temperature.
author: James M.

description:
This pizza is amazing!  Super fresh ingredients, really friendly staff, and the pizza is cooked in a wood fired oven to perfection!  There is a beautiful and charming pizza garden where you can dine in, or you can take out, too.  I ordered several pizzas for a gathering at my home, and my guests (all from North Beach) ate it up, and loved it!  

Do yourself a favor and give it a try I doubt you'll be disappointed.
author: Wendy M.

description: Pizzas are more a personalized size. Beers limited to 3 brands @ $6 bones. Seating is limited. Not really good for groups. It's a like a food trailer with outdoor seating. Pizzas are good!
author: L G.

description: Visiting SF, both being Italian, looking for best pizza in SF, stumbled upon Carmel pizza company, Truly authentic pizza, best we both had since Nonna, awesome pizza,Service great, definitely recommend
author: Thomas D.

description: We had the Americano. Good crust but lacked some spices; fairly bland. Could only really taste the red onion. It was very wet and the cheese was sliding off the tomato sauce.
author: Jeff D.

description: Amazing little gem.  Owners are super sweet. We ordered the Margherita, hands down the best pizza I have ever eaten.  YUM!
author: Carrie H.

description:
Great pizza, great cozie spot.

I headed here for quite pizza after going for a walk around fisherman's wharf.  

What a great choice, pizza was great, the staff were great and just off the busy area of fisherman's wharf.

The outside area is heated and they are licensed AMD have a good range of beers and wines.

I will be back.
author: David N.

description:
This is the best pizza in SF.  Yes I said it.  Living in North Beach for 7 years, I have been spoiled by some amazing pizza spots in the neighborhood but Carmel Pizza Company takes the cake.  

The Diavola is my favorite, it has the perfect amount of spice for those that like their pizza with a little kick.  My girlfriend goes for the Margherita which in my opinion is better than Tony's, is less expensive and you don't have to wait 2 hours to get seated.  Next on the list that I want to try is the Crudo e Parma (from what I've hear the prosciutto on this pizza is heaven-sent). 

The restaurant itself is in a really cool covered patio area.  The ambiance is inviting, relaxing and serves as a perfect escape from the hectic wharf scene.  They have heaters if its cold, good drink selection, and an authentic oven firing up the most delicious pizzas around.  

The owners -- Amanda and AJ -- are amazing as well.  They are incredibly nice/friendly and have studied pizza-making in Italy, so they know their stuff.  They each work very hard to consistently serve the best pizza.  I know, because we go to Carmel Pizza at least once a week -- often multiple times a week, and embarrassingly enough, have gone back-to-back days on more than one occasion.  We have never been disappointed and look forward to eating there like it's the first time, every time.  They also have a frequent diner card -- which, needless to say, we have put to good use.

I recommend this Carmel Pizza to anyone who will listen. Seriously, stop reading this and go try it if you haven't already.  You won't be disappointed.  Having now written this, I'm suddenly craving a Diavola and will probably go there tonight.....full disclosure, I had their pizza last night as well.  I think I have a problem.
author: Bryan P.

description:
I was skeptical because it looked like a hole in the wall and really could it be that good? No line; no waiting for table; less than 10min until served; and friendly/thankful staff. Dinner for 5pp under $50. 
We rate it align with our own local brick oven pizza and it was a better experience!
author: Marial M.

description: OMG! This is the best pizza and from a food truck how awesome! Crust is thin and fabulous-- how brick oven pizza should be.
author: Tara C.

description: The pizza was soooooo good and the ambiance is adorable. My new favorite pizza place!
author: Daphne G.

description:
The best thin crisp pizza in SF Bay Area.  It's almost as in Europe (really thin)!
It's almost unable to stop!
author: Arseny G.

description: I kept passing by it since I was in fisherman wharf for four days & the last day I gave a try I wish I could gone everyday ! The pizza was delicious I didn't bother to add more cheese I only left one slice ! Will be back !
author: Liz S.

description: Hands down the best pizza! Fresh ingredients so tasty very friendly service we got the pepperoni & cheese pizza and AMERICANO pizza
author: J.Sweets S.

description:
3 stars for the food, 4 stars for the service, 2 stars for the wait so 3 stars overall.

We ordered two buffala mozzarella bases. One a basic margarita and the other a margarita plus Italian sausage. After waiting 45 mins (for a food cart!!), they handed me two pizzas. I went back to my car to find one had no toppings on whatsoever. 

The pizzas itself were little on the small side, especially as they cost around $15 each. Granted the base was a true authentic Neapolitan style pizza but there was something off with the tomato paste they used. It tasted very plain, maybe they run out of the marinara sauce so they just used a plain tomato sauce out of a tomato tin. That's what it tasted like. 

The staff were friendly and corrected their mistake (forgetting the topping) straight away when I took my pizza back. But I didn't like that they charge you for the basil ($1 extra). Basil should be a given topping, like the mozzarella or the sauce.

Would I go back again? No prob not especially since there are tons of good pizza places down the road in Little Italy.
author: Violet P.

description: Very quaint and delicious oven fired pizza! Imagine a little food truck that became a permanent structure on a nice outdoor patio. Very cool!
author: Rick R.

description: Complete joke.  Half and half pizza is standard procedure, but these people can't be bothered with that.  Wanted a few cups of tap water with our pizza and wine, but instead of even bothering to ask, the snotty little girl in the trailer just charged me for two water bottles without even a word.  Fruit flies swarming everywhere.  Then they asked for a tip.  A tip?  For standing inside of a trailer?  Are you kidding me?  And to top it all off, this little dump has the absolute gall to charge a $1 COVER CHARGE for the privilege of ordering from a damn trailer!  Shame!
author: Ken M.

description:
We were just checked into the Marriott Fisherman's Wharf and walking to the elevator when the wonderful aroma of pizza caught our attention. This couple was walking with a box from the Carmel Pizza Company and we knew we had to go there for dinner. It was walking distance from the hotel tell which was great with parking the way it is in SF. 

I was expecting an actual restaurant or shop, so following the blue dot on my Map App made it a little hard to find. The pizza joint is a small stand kinda hidden amongst all the touristy stands. It's like you're walking up to a truck/portable stand when you're ordering. Seating is outdoors. It's quite a cute little set up in my opinion. Great place for people watching and also a great spot for eying the F-Line if you're hopping on a bus to get around SF. 

Food is cooked super quickly in a wood fired oven and the flavors really deliver. We ordered a simple pepperoni pizza as well as a prosciutto and arugula pizza. Both were tasty and the highlight of the pizza would have to be the wood fired crust. The smoky, light and crispy crust makes this pizza. This is way better than any other tourist spot in the area. 

They don't serve alcohol, but suggested we could get a bottle and drink there. Friendly people and great service.
author: Kathy T.

description:
My friends and I were debating between Carmel Pizza Company and Codmother.  Being that they're side by side, we almost split the group in half.  Until we decided, let's start with pizza, then have some fish and chips after.  Ok, so we didn't end up doing that, but we were tempted.

Between 6 of us, we ordered 4 pizzas and a la porchetta sandwich.  In fairness, 2 of the guys each ordered their own pizza.  I, on the other hand, split the Diavola pizza, and we were contently full (knowing that we were planning for ice cream sundaes within the hour).  Great, wood fired pizza.  I enjoyed the flavor of the pizza as well as all of the toppings and the crust.  The crust wasn't too thick or chewy.

Since Carmel Pizza Co is basically a stand on the side of the road, if you can plan for nice weather, go there on a clear, warm day.  It'll add to the effect in the patio.
author: Audrey C.

description:
Thanks for the great pizza and Peroni ...the Diavola was just the right amount of spice for me. And really glad I got there just before they sold out.

 I'll be back!
author: Scott E.

description: Pizza is so SO good here. Thin crust goodness. Get the margarita, simple and delicious! Staff is nice and the table areas are super cute.
author: Didi R.

description: We were in the mood for pizza so I used the Yelp app to find this place. It did not disappoint. Great flavor in the crust from the wood burning oven and unique pizza toppings. Great find!
author: Britt J.

description: Very underwhelmed...not really much else to say. A $4 slice at the place around the corner tastes better and is more filling
author: Jeremy W.

description:
If you have to go near the Warf this is the place to go to. Otherwise avoid the area. 
The pizza was excellent! these guys are pizza artists.
author: Leonard H.

description: Convenient near the wharf and ghirardelli square. Great wood fired pizza but pies are small and a bit expensive. Four kids ate four pies at $16 a piece. Five slices per pie.
author: Shaun M.

description:
I would normally not go to a place like this, but it had the best reviews for pizza places in the area... and for good reason. It seems like a food truck w/ a patio area w/ tables and music playing. For a tourist area, this place wasn't very crowded and didn't feel very touristy. The servers/owner were very nice and the prices were decent too.

The pizza was delicious: very simple, natural, and tasty. They even had decent ranch. I look forward to stopping by again.
author: Sadie G.

description:
Thank you to Yelp for helping me to find this place. The delivery driver was out sick on the afternoon we placed our delivery order, but the woman taking our order said that we weren't far from their location, and that she would bring it herself. How nice! 

We had the panchetta sandwich, garlic bread, and the margherita pizza. All were excellent! Well prepared and interesting flavor. The quality of the cheese and the other ingredients were all top notch. All pizzas are 11 to 12 inches in size and plenty for a very hungry person, or two moderately hungry folks - perhaps paired with a salad. I hear their Caesar is great! Can't wait to try it the next time that I am in town. 

I would highly recommend this place if you are in the mood for a good toasty sandwich or a pizza. Yum!
author: Katie G.

description: Got the white pizza with Sausage! Soooo good!! And it came out quick. Definitely would come back
author: Laura M.

description:
I came into town a few months ago for a big conference, and I was trying to organize a dinner for a large group (about 20 of us) at a sort of low key place. Just about every restaurant I could find was totally unavailable even though I started trying to make reservations weeks in advance. I found this place on Yelp, noted the great reviews, and called. Sure enough, they could accommodate us. It was surprising, given all the positive reviews and the photos showing the seating area - it's not that big.

Long story short, it wasn't just that they could get our group in without issue that prompts my 5-star review. The pizza was outstanding. Great thin crust, and awesome toppings. Customer service was top notch - we ordered a bunch of pizzas at the beginning and kept coming back for more sporadically, and they didn't bat an eye or miss any part of the order.

Good experience here. Highly recommended.
author: Omar M.

description: Awesome pizza. Wish it was a little cheaper based on size if the pies but damn good food and great location.
author: Al W.

description:
The crust is perfect just got to say! I was sorry that they were out of the buffalo mozella, it was a Sunday.  
  It was very Neapolitan and it's pizza like its' own, not unlike Chicagos deep dish is pizza on its' own.  So you have to be in the mood for it.  I guess what I am saying as much as I love it, I would often rather have a good old American style saucy cheesy, slice.
author: Rob B.

description: This place was absolutely amazing.  Fast service with amazing food.  You are completely insane if you come to this part of San Francisco and not eat here.  Hats off to the cook.  Try the Romantica its out of this world.
author: Rusty W.

description: The owner does not have any customer service skills at all !!! If you order anything from the most amazing place for fish next store cod mother {she's amazing customer service is amazing cod mother } the owner of this pizzeria will ask you to leave and then if you ask to stay because your party ordered food from her business she will let you know she doesn't care about you or your business !!' Wow!!! All these good reviews but every time I pass by it's empty I'm not sure who's posting these reviews !! Lol ps the pizza is over priced and dry......... So her response was rude condescending as usually no customer service skills at I know she has small business just trying to survive !!! Why bash codmother ??? Why lol
author: Melissa S.

description:
This is without a doubt for me the best Pizza not only in SF... it is the best pizza in the world... not even in Naples Italy I've had anything like this! From the quality of the ingredients to the flavourful balanced sauce, the milky sweet cheese. The crust is incredible, it has the mellow chewiness of neapolitan pizza but still has crispiness at the bottom mixed with char specks from the wood oven.
I used to like Tony's margarita pizza but that was until I tried Carmel Pizza Company. 

If you like the american style pizza like Pizza Hut and Domino's you won't find it here but if you want to experience what a real authentic neapolitan pizza taste like; this is the place.
If you're in SF and you like pizza make the detour, you'll be glad you did.
author: Ron D.

description:
Mmm... I'm not quite sure what all the fuss is about. I had a mediocre experience and I probably wouldn't go back. My rationale:

- The pizza was meh. It wasn't great but it wasn't terrible. It was just a little too wet and bland.

- Our dinner was quite expensive. I think we paid $32 for two pies and, with drinks, it ended up being over $12 per person for our group of three. It's hard to justify spending $12 on a quick pizza dinner.

- For the price, we expected a warmer dining experience and better ware (they gave us paper plates with tacky cartoon Italians on them). But whatever, this was the least of my concerns.

- Aside from the food, the service was great. Everyone was very attentive and friendly. I can't complain about that.

Carmel has average food but good service. It might be the best you can get in Fisherman's Wharf, but it is absolutely not the best pizza in the city.
author: Nick K.

description:
I would rather eat Pieology. This place was overpriced and what made it worse, outside in their chalkboard it said, "pizza ready in 5 mins." It took us 20-25 mins to get our pizza. I honestly think they forgot about our order because people that ordered after me received their pizza before me. 

I don't recommend this place. Stay away people. Not worth the money
author: Hugo M.

description: Great little patio with tasty pizza!!!! Nice staff, got the margarita pizza, it was perfect!! Had a few beers with my husband and enjoyed the great food!!
author: Morgan W.

description: This place was AMAZING! We are in SF on a company trip, and this was chosen as a company lunch and no one was disappointed! from the friendly service, amazing and cute atmosphere, to the phenomenal food (I had the Tulle Pizza (all veggie!), I would definitely say to check this place out!!!
author: Cassie O.

description: Had a great meal here in a sunny Tuesday! We had two pizzas: the Romantico with mozzarella, arugula, balsamic glaze, tomatoes, and parmigiana reggiano and a Margherita with artichoke hearts, sun-dried tomatoes, and pepperoni. The crust is great--thin, crispy, and cooked in a wood-fired oven. Heirloom tomatoes were very tasty. Lovely patio at a location off Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Karen M.

description: Waking from our hotel, we were looking for a 'pizza restaurant' named Carmel. Armed with our GPS, we found it, but it was not exactly what we thought. It was more like a permanently parked food truck or something, with outdoor only seating. Not to worry, the pizza was great. Wood fired oven, super friendly folks, and great price. If you are looking for a traditional pizza place (large, extra-large, combo's, etc) this is not tat place. But they do have  have a great selection, all one size, and well worth the trip.
author: Ed R.

description: Pizza is my absolute favorite food and this pizza is absolutley delicious, it is light and airy but so so good, a little pricey but worth every penny. Atmospherre is quaint, its a permanent food truck with heat warmers and very cool memorabilia and about 10 tables or so, very nice atmosphere, they serve beer and wine too, so so delicious! Go next door to Baked Bear after for a delicious dessert!
author: JoAnna S.

description:
Sometimes a simple pizza is all you need in life, and I'm glad I found CPC. Friendly mom and pop service, quick production, and fresh and flavorful pizza with a great tasting dough. 

If you call and they don't pick up, try again. Keep in mind that they're busy, but they'll get to you.
author: Alfonzo J.

description: Amazing and fresh pizza! Must drop by if your in the area. Food taste divine and atmosphere is so enchanting and relaxing.
author: Daisy R.

description: We stayed 1 block up the street and stumbled upon this place by accident. I'm super glad we found it because it's delicious. The sought tastes great, and the fire roasted cooking only adds to the experience. The place is also very cute. Like a little Italian Hardin in the middle of town. AWESOME!
author: Vaipuarii T.

description: It was good...really good! But, it wasn't AMAZING. We had the Crudo E Parma and the Quattro Formaggi. The prices were a bit steep for the product we received, and it definitely wasn't the best pizza I've had. I would definitely recommend this place, but don't go in expecting this to be the be-all and end-all of pizza places.
author: Noelle K.

description: Had a Blanca (white )pizza  it was very good. Interesting place on the street. We brought it back to our room 1 block away and it was cold might have been outrageous if it was hot but still very good. Would go again and if you are in the mood for pizza you should go here.
author: Nicole T.

description: Stumbled across this place. Ordered the Diavolo pizza, Caesar salad and house wine. The thin crust was charred in places but still had nice chew. Slight heat that built over time. Salad was fresh. I'd skip the wine and go for bear or soda next time. Service was good.
author: Adam M.

description:
Luckily after checking into our hotel we ran into Carmel's pizza. They recently began opening at 11 pm to 2am.
Aj was so amazing to open and begin our order right away. Truly the best pizza I have ever had. I promise to come to this establishment every time I am in the area.
Aj was the nicest guy and the service was impeccable!
Highly recommend!!!!
author: Amanda W.

description: The best thin crust pizza i have ever had. Awesome customer service. Do not forget to ask for their secret hot sauce!
author: KP K.

description: My pizza was lame. The supposedly awesome farmers market toppings were very blah. The crust was basic and not flavored well. The smoke smelled good in the wood fire oven but that did nothing to make my pizza taste good. They have pork on almost every pizza. Not a lot of options. I'd eat somewhere else better near by next time. Oh yeah and expensive. Also after I wrote this review the restaurants owner wrote me an upset email flaming. How unprofessional. I'm not surprised I guess as the bad management reflects on their bad food. The manager must scare people into writing positive reviews or something as this place is overrated.
author: Autumn H.

description: Carmel probably offers better pizza options in all of Fisherman's Wharf. Crust was chewy with a slight initial crunch to it. I found my pizza was a smidge too olive oil heavy that it was dripping everywhere but it was surprisingly tasty nonetheless.
author: Esther A.

description: Hands down best pizza since we have been in Italy!!! This is truly a gem!!! We can't say enough about this place. Super skeptical to try any restaurants in this area because of all the tourists, but we walked in talked to the owner and the wood burning oven had us. We got the Romantico added Prosciutto Crudo and a side of delicious Parmigiano Reggiano....we didn't want it to end!! Please try this place!! You're missing out if you don't! Very relaxing eating area, super awesome staff, great music, and they get their produce fresh from the farmers market! LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Officially hooked....now I just need to figure out how they can send one to Orange County! ;)
author: Meryl S.

description:
I liked the place, especially considering it was open late night and the staff was a delight. Tried a few different pizzas. I don't eat much, but I finished my whole pizza. The restaurant itself is semi-indoors, because it has covered walls/roof, but it's not an actual building. I liked it for what it was and the crowd was a bit of local and a bit of tourists.

The wait wasn't long at all and they had a fun selection of drinks, too.

Great place to stop by when you're famished!
author: Marily S.

description: Cute little place for a delicious pizza! It's like a food truck pizza shop but with patio seating area. Their pizza is seriously the best pizza I've ever had in San Francisco. Find a parking spot near by, snack here, then walk over to Fisherman's Wharf, the pier or Ghirardelli Square. I think yelp check in gives you a $1 off deal, so don't forget to use it!
author: Nori M.

description:
Great little pizza joint down by Fisherman's Wharf! The wife and I we're somewhat skeptical at first being that it is so close to the Wharf and it being such a tourist trap however we were pleasantly surprised! Some of the best pizza we have had since in Italy a year ago. 

We ordered the Pizza Romantico with Prosciutto Crudo and Parmigiano Reggiano! Highly highly recommend this trio! I had an Anchor Steam and the wife had a Sierra Nevada, beer and pizza! Can't go wrong! If your in the area check it out and if your not get down to the Wharf for some EXCELLENT pizza!! We will definitely be back next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Conrad O.

description: Great wood fired pizza. We ate 3 different times here on our trip to the warf. Nestled among a few other permanent food trucks. Very nice covered seating area. Margarita pizza was awesome not to mention you can have Beer or wine with your pizza. Service was excellent as was the owner who takes time to chat with you
author: Paul M.

description: Passed by this place 100 times thinking it was mainstream but...I WAS COMPLETELY WRONG. THIS PLACE IS AWESOME. The outside atmosphere is perfect for feeling that city vibe and the service is far from disappointment ! Pizzas are out the fiery brick oven in no time and they are delicious. As an SF native and pizza lover I give this place 5 thumbs up. A must go to while you're here !
author: Brittany B.

description:
Not sure what really needs to be said beyond this: just go here. It's awesome. 

It's outside with nice shade. AJ is super nice and helpful. The pizza is amazing. Definitely in the top range of any that I've had.
author: G S.

description: Don't have a lot of time to talk, but this pizza is absolutely amazing. You will not be disappointed if you eat here. I have eaten pizza in New York City and Chicago. This is not to be missed.
author: John H.

description: Wow. Trust what the reviews say, this place is worth stopping at. Friendly, funky atmosphere with beautiful succulents lining the walls. The pizza! Simplicity, perfection of traditional flavor, just delicious. So good in fact we ordered a second pizza to go after we finished ours because it was just THAT good. Gorgonzola, mushroom heaven. Visit and enjoy!
author: Meagan P.

description: Enjoyed our experience at Carmel Pizza.  The service was quick and the ingredients were fresh.
author: Kim M.

description: Great pizza, prepared in a wooden stove. The location is great (very close to pier 39) and offers a decent meal for adults and kids. Please notice the prices are a bit higher than a std. Pizza ( probably because they are close to the pier) and they charge you 20% more over menu price. We tryed the std. (Mariners), we tried anchovies and pacorino (great!), also black olives and pepperoni. All were eaten by kids and adults for kids. Don't waste your time in the big tourist places
author: Barak Y.

description:
I stopped by here a couple of Monday's ago with three other dining companions.  We were looking for somewhere relaxed to eat near where we were staying and this fit the bill.  We were surprised whenever we got there that it the restaurant felt more like a truck than a true building and that all of the seating was outdoor but we quickly adjusted.

Upon the recommendation of the cashier we decided to split three pizzas amongst the four of us so that we could try a little of everything.  The pizzas that we ordered were the Quattro Formaggio, Crudo e Parma and Diavola.  They were all cooked in the brick oven and reminded me of many true Neapolitan pizzas I have had before.  Thin crust, good sauce and some cheese although not too much.  All of them also tasted pretty good with my favorite being the Quattro.  All of the cheeses on it made it very tasty.  My least favorite was the Crudo e Parma as I thought the prosciutto tasted a little off but it was still good.

The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  It was a pretty chill place that offered some good authentic Neapolitan pizzas.
author: Jason F.

description: Their 4 cheese pizza was an excellent gourmet pizza from this unpretentious, not intimidating pizza spot. For affordable food in fishermans wharf, this is best in class excellent. Delicious crust and pizza, made fresh with excellent ingredients, highly recommend
author: Oink A.

description: Best pizza I've had in SF. Fresh ingredients, great taste, wonderful thin crust. Would definitely come back!
author: Elad B.

description: Easily the best pizza I 've ever had. Everything is cooked to perfection, exactly what I expect from a place that takes pride in their product. I literally just ate one of their pizzas and I already want to order another. AJ is the nicest guy, who obviously cares about the customer and the quality of the food presented. I will be back every time I come to San Francisco.
author: Corey S.

description: If I could leave this guy six stars I would. If this pizza were sold on the East Coast I would try to invest in the company. This is among the top pizzas I've ever had in my life. And I've had a lot of pizza. A lot. I don't know where to begin. The owners are friendly and charming. The space, though it is "food truck", is almost 100% enclosed with the ceiling, heaters, tables etc. - all what looks like completely custom fabricated stuff. A lot of love has gone into the space.  The pizza is off the charts. Super-duper thin, with small patches of slightly oven-carbonized crust, like the best thin crunchy chewy pita toast you've ever had.    But much better than that.  The ingredients seem like they were all made from scratch five minutes ago. Everything looks immaculate in the kitchen. I personally saw the chef take the prosciutto from between thin wax paper slice by slice.  The mozzarella seems like it was made an hour ago - as he made my pizza he put small hand shaped balls of it strategically across the top like crème fraîche. I wanted so badly to stop eating on the fourth slice but I just couldn't. Luckily the pizza is so thin and light that I didn't feel "impaled" on my own dinner.   The small Caesar salad was phenomenal too.   Everything completely homemade including I believe the croutons.  What an absolute gem this place is!
author: Matthew P.

description:
Eat this now; it's that good. Authentic, delicious, reasonable, fast, incredibly friendly.

Wood-fired Neopolitan-style pizza, charming al fresco dining, and a few beers and wines to choose from: what more could you ever want from a place by a parking lot in tourist central? Awesome!

Note: today at least they closed for the afternoon and reopened at 5 or so but were sold out by 7:30. Also, no restrooms.
author: Spodaddyo O.

description: They were out of a lot come 5 o'clock.  Pizza was DELISH but portions were small which made everything very pricey.  A good choice if you're willing to pay the price.  Loved indoor outdoor feeling- like a fancy food truck!
author: Krista S.

description: Delicious, always a good choice. Not five stars because the location isn't very convenient. It's right in the middle of the touristy fisherman's wharf.
author: Therese M.

description: 5-Star pizza place in Fisherman's Wharf. The dining area is all outside and it is quite cozy with a nice setting. The staff was friendly and the pizza came out quickly. I ordered the margarita pizza and it was very good. It is on the expensive side, but in San Francisco everything is expensive.
author: Zach W.

description:
Great pizza and even better staff!
Don't hesitate to come in to the shaded seating area if you are in the area of Fishermans Grotto. Great change of pace from all the fish I have been having!
author: Josh M.

description:
This place, right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf, serves great pizza.  They use a wood oven and use the classic Napoletana recipe with fresh ingredients.  The crust is a little thinner than other Napoletana pizza restaurants in San Francisco, which is good for me.  Their price is also slightly cheaper than similar restaurants in San Francisco if you pay with cash.  The ambiance is very good; it looks like a little urban park.  The kitchen employees were very friendly and let me enter the kitchen and look at the oven.  The only quibble I have about the place is that their crust is a tiny bit saltier than I wished, although that doesn't penalize them much.  That's still four and a half stars, which I rounded up to five.

Another reviewer posted here that their pizzas were burned.  That was not the case for me.  My pizza was perfectly cooked.  They must have had a bad day with that customer.

This pizza is as good as the ones at similar restaurants like Tony's Pizza Napoletana, Pizzeria Delfina, and Zero Zero.  Highly recommended.
author: Francisco J. R.

description:
