Incredibly surprised that we could walk right up to the counter for Saturday lunch, but won't complain. We love Tony's pizza in North Beach, but it's always such a long wait. Decided to stroll a bit further and check out this place. Appreciated that we could order right away and find a seat with no problem.

The location is funny. It's on a touristy street. But I loved that you could sit outside in comfortable shade. (Heat lamps for cool weather.) Friendly little place with birds flying around. Enjoyed watching the people walking by. 

It seems funny to speak about service at a food truck, but the service was friendly. They even cleared our plates for us.

Now to the pizza: Perfection. Definitely worth the price.  High-quality ingredients. Perfectly cooked. Competes with Tony's! What more can you ask? 

Only complaint - no sparkling water in the fridge. Maybe they had some but I didn't ask.
author: Tammy K.

description: A year later I finally find amazing pizza in the city ! Such a cute spot too. Perfect for bringing a date friends family ... Or just yourself ! Yum.
author: Lauren S.

description: Delicious pizza, cute atmosphere and friendly service!! Seriously if you're in the area, come here.
author: Tara U.

description:
Sunny day, Fleet Week, found parking with time on the meter in front of this place that claims "Best Wood Fired Pizza" with a gentleman there inviting passerbys to come on over and give his pizza a try.  While walking around, a nice CPC gal was giving out cards with promo of free beverage with pizza purchase... Hmmm, the foodie universe in alignment?  Why not  : )

Walked up, ordered cheese pizza.  The folks that run CPC were very nice & friendly, Within several minutes my pie!  Thin crust not bad, overall a very solid pizza.  If not in a rush, nice patio seating to go along with solid service.  The funny during my visit was a gentleman that ordered I believe the La Porchetta sandwich... I believe he was going to "Yelp" the heck out of the sandwich.  I will leave this to your imagination (or may have to come back & try that sandwich.  Oh parking gods...)

Thank you CPC for making my visit around Fisherman's Wharf the tops.
author: W L.

description:
Great pizza!  Also had the Caesar salad it was very good.  Great outdoor atmosphere.

I would recommend the romantico with sausage.
author: Noah H.

description: Quick service, outdoor setting, reasonable prices. I had the dry salami, sun dried tomatoes, mozzarella and fresh parm - delicious! We were there at 7pm and by the end of our meal they had sold out of pizza dough so get there early so you don't miss out.
author: San F.

description:
The pizza is wonderful. We had it delivered to our hotel so we could enjoy the Sunday night football game in our room while it was raining in San Francisco. They said it would be about 30 minutes. We were surprised when there was a knock on our door in half that time. How do they do it so fast?

The pizzas are individual size and 2 were more than enough for both my wife and I. A great salad, some wine and beer and we were happy football fans.

We found Carmel Pizza on Yelp and were very happy with our choice!
author: Dennis S.

description: The thought of dining near Fisherman's Wharf would ordinarily send a local San Franciscan running for the hills. In this instance, it shouldn't. The food here is excellent, in the farm-to-table tradition. Excellent ingredients and combinations make for a thin-crust sensation. A rare gem amidst the tourist crowds. And, as a bonus, most of them seem to ignore it, resulting in a laid back atmosphere mere yards from the hustle and bustle of the wharf.
author: David C.

description: "Best Italian pizza I've had in America!" Proclaimed my excited wife. She lived in Rome for a year and is in love with good pizza. This place rocks! A hidden gem no doubt.
author: Brandon J.

description: I'd prefer to give 4 and a half stars. What I like most though is the base is good and the ingredients seem to be fresh.  Just starting off with something that tastes fresh is always good. I am not a huge pizza fan but I enjoyed it and the kids devoured their pizza also.
author: Michael D.

description: I thought the place was great! I really appreciated that I was able to find a quiet space in North Beach, and was really fond of their patio space. The pizza is a true thin crust just like how I like it. Though I was super excited that AJ was a fellow east coaster from NY, I wasn't too happy that my Margherita pizza was super burnt :( I might come back though because the guys here are super nice & I enjoy the less touristy vibe.
author: Esther K.

description: Love the decor, lovely plants around. You definitely need to order one pizza per person, since the crust is very thin. They charge extra for water. The service was quick, I do recommend the place :)
author: Adwait A.

description: I was in town with my family for four days. I stumbled across this place and was amazed by their fresh taste and thin crust. The staff was friendly and attentive. I ate there three times in my four day stay and tried three different pizzas. My favorite was the prociutto and arugula.
author: Jon C.

description:
Despite being in the wharf area, I figured this would be a fancy restaurant. Imagine my surprise when we arrived and it felt similar to a food truck except with a covered, outdoor area for sitting and eating. A super friendly girl behind the counter took our order (a margherita pizza, crudo e parma pizza, house red wine, and an Anchorsteam beer) and food came out in under 10 minutes. 

Pizza pies are 6 slices on a wood-fired crust. Cheese and tomato sauce is just amazing. I was actually tempted to eat the crust pieces, it was that good. 

I wish they delivered or at least were closer and not located in a major tourist trap area. If you happen to be wandering through the wharf or visiting the city, you cannot go wrong by stopping here. Hell, take time out to go through the wharf even if you dislike the area, it's worth going there.

Prices are a tad more expensive than I'd like, but honestly it's worth it for a good pizza.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
This place is so amazing that I had to set up a Yelp account to write a review. 

It took us a little while to find this place the first time around, but it was absolutely worth it! I bring anyone who comes to visit SF here, and it is by far the best pizza I have eaten in the city. The atmosphere is quite cozy, perfect for a nice dinner with friends. The pizzas are SO delicious, and the service is very friendly. I would highly recommend this place.
author: Nethra V.

description: Sensational pizza! And reasonable prices. It's essentially a food truck with a wood fire grill and a nice shaded seating area. Loved it!
author: Russell H.

description: Super random location but surprisingly good pizza. The dough is perfect - thin and just enough salt. We did take out but I think it would be much better eating there. Also next to the Codmother which is kind of awesome.
author: Karen S.

description: One of the best pizzas I have ever had. Thin crust perfection. Be prepared to sit outside in a 10 table  patio. Very nicely decorated patio with heathers in the Winter. We ordered the margarita and the romantica and they were both perfect. Enjoy.
author: StoryTeller D.

description:
This is a very charming place in the midst of touristy Fisherman's wharf.  It's a semi-permanent  food truck with a nice fenced in patio area with plants in front.  It's on Jones Street which is a half block up from the madness of the main street of Fisherman's wharf where all the traffic is - so a nice respite.

We've have been trying a number of "Artisan" pizza places around the US for the last several years and we live in the SF Bay Area.  I have to say for such a tiny place the pizza was amazingly good!  They use all fresh, local produce purchased from the Farmer's Market and other local vendors.  So ingedents are top of the line.  The pizza was fantastic - crust was very light and crispy, very flavorful and tasty.  All the pizzas were personal sizes which made it handy to purchase a selection to share.

We met AJ,one of the owners and he was very informative and fun to talk too.  Since our childen live in the area, he made sure we not only got a menu but a punch card which enable to get a pizza for free after purchasing 6.  He also let us know that they can hold parties at this place and can hold 30 people - which would be great idea!

We plan to go back here again and try a number of their other selections.
author: Jenny H.

description:
I am 100% a pizza snob. I LOVE this place. I live in Portland, OR and come to SF for work every month and I hit this place up everytime I'm here. Usually pizza joints burn the crust when they do Neapolitan style pizza, but not Carmel, they nail it perfectly.  I seriously dream about this pizza when I'm home. 
To the people that give less than 5 stars - you are insane. This is the real deal.
author: Martine H.

description:
Better than advertised. This place has the most authentic, Naples-style pizza you will find outside of Italy. All ingredients are first rate, fresh and delicious.  I added some prosciutto to a Pizza Margarita and could have eaten it for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It was that good. 

An oasis of affordable quality among the cheap, made-in-China crap that comprises nearly everything else you find on the Wharf.
author: David B.

description: As a New Yorker tired of cheap imitations, Carmel Pizza Company is a refreshing discovery. Certainly some of the best pizza in San Francisco. The style is simple, the presentation is unpretentious, and the owner is welcoming. If you're lucky, he'll show off his skills throwing the dough.
author: Alex C.

description: Carmel Pizza Company makes really authentic and delicious pizza. It's a great spot to get away from the tourist madness that is Fisherman's Wharf for a while and eat a good meal. We ordered the margherita, the crudo e parma, and the diavola. All three were delicious, although the crudo e parma was my favorite. It definitely reminded me of Italy.
author: Regina L.

description: One thing to get people to come in is to be nice to them when they call?   I just called this place for information.  I am from out of town, wanted to see if they delivered.  The gal I that answered was so rude.  I ask do you deliver?  She snickered and sarcastically says nope!  Rude.  Now I for sure will not order and pick up anything from this place.  Rude!!!
author: Monica W.

description:
Fantastic. The crust is perfect, mozzarella, reggiano and olive oil, added with a tomato sauce so pure... 

I personally always search for a simple yet tasty margarita napoli style. This place delivers like no other I've ever tried.
author: Cristian F.

description:
Great pizza. Specially try the Thai Chicken Pizza. Amazing. 
Will go there again if I visit Squaw valley. 
All items were great.
author: Atanu R.

description:
Zero stars for service! I paid for a pizza and drinks...don't tell me we can't eat at an outdoor food stand because someone in my group has food from the stand next door. I could understand if we used your tables without ordering, but a paying customer is just that, a customer.

Also, there was not a single other customer there. Everyone was next door at The Codmother...which the employee went and ordered also and then ate it behind the counter!

Amanda can comment and try to negate the situation as much as she wants but please get your facts straight before doing so. She was not present, we did not order THREE orders from next door and an employee WAS eating from the same place. Again, IF there were customers that needed the tables we would have gladly moved, BUT telling someone that ordered from your place to leave when you don't have a SINGLE OTHER customer is absurd. Insult me all you want...it shows the class of the establishment.
author: Risha S.

description: Great pizza!  Made to order, took five minutes.  Great friendly owners and a great atmosphere.  We went after dark on a 45° cold day and they have an enclosed heated eating area which was really nice.  We had the margherita and a pepperoni pie.  Thought they looked like personal size pizzas in previous reviews but they ended up being big enough that we could share (about a 12" diameter with 6 slices).  But I'm glad we have left over because they were excellent.  Would definitely recommend and will come back if I'm ever in fisherman's wharf again!
author: Amanda R.

description: Soooooooooo Yummy! The atmosphere was great and the service was fast. Such GOOD Pizza! Loved it. Must Try :-)
author: Afshin K.

description:
decent food.. the pizza was burned though a bit.
overpriced, i think, but the ambiance is super cute. the decoration is very well done!
author: Grace P.

description: Loved this place. Staff was extra friendly and kind. Pizza was delicious and left me wanting another. Would definitely come back any day!!
author: Salvador B.

description: The pizza is really good, and ingredients are fresh, but the pizza's are super thin crust and small. We brought 6 hungry kids and 4 hungry adults, and $120 of pizza did not even begin to feed everyone. After 5 12 inch pizzas at $20+ per pizza, we left hungry and underwhelmed.
author: Spencer R.

description: I was very impressed. The environment is great, the pizza was perfect, and The veggies are fresh. I would highly recommend this place!
author: Brittany M.

description: I saw this place on Yelp and I came for lunch. The owners are super friendly. The pizza is just damn good!!!!!!!!
author: Guanchen L.

description:
Best pizza in San Fran

Ate at Tonys last night and no comparison.   The pizza was crisp, hot and wonderful.  The two women working were nice and helpful.   I would eat here every night
author: JR H.

description:
Amazing service!  Incredibly friendly!  Great sandwiches!

I try to avoid Fisherman's Wharf at all costs but I decided to venture in to give this place a shot since reviews were high.  I tried a Prosciutto sandwich which did not disappoint.  AJ (I'm guessing he was the owner) asked me exactly how I wanted it prepared...bread toasted or cold...cheese melted onto the bread.  It was delicious.  Perfectly toasted bread.  Fresh tomatoes and arugula. I was in more of a sandwich mood but will be back to try the pizza which looked great.

On my way out AJ came and introduced himself and shook my hand.  That kind of friendliness is what gets people to come back.  I know I will brave the annoyingly tourist crowded streets to return to this spot because the food and service are THAT good!
author: John T.

description: Cute food truck with a friendly staff, pizza crust is delicious, light, crunchy. I had the romantica pizza and was very happy! They serve beer and wine too!
author: Theresa T.

description: This spot - amid touristy and busy Fisherman's Wharf - is sweet, quaint and cozy. The service was very good as well. The food, however, was sub par. Coming from Upstate New York where food is excellent, I may have higher standards but this pizza was not great. Crust was cardboard-like, barely had cheese  the veggies were fresh but flavors very bland as a whole. And the pizza is actually a whole pizza not personal size. I could eat less than a fourth and carrying around a pizza box the rest of the day was not attractive. I ended up giving it to a man looking for money. So if you're looking for ok food in great ambience, this is your spot. The wine also was not very good.
author: C B.

description:
Love is a strong word. Love is DEEP. I've never been one to take it lightly, love.

I love Carmel Pizza not because of who you are, but because of who I am when I am with you. You make me giddy, happy, and oh so joyful! 

Could it be your simple fresh applewood smoked ham and asiago sandwich with tomatoes and arugula? Or maybe, your roasted garlic "mini pizza" bread. Whatever I order, it is always a win/win situation.

I wish we were together everyday. Call me, maybe?
author: Brandi W.

description: Excellent Pizza.  I normally order a pepperoni, green peppers, and bacon pizza at any pizza place.  I ordered the Capriccosia with added pepperoni.  I absolutely loved it.
author: Bob J.

description: Always delicious pizza, a bit expensive for what it is, but we leave happy. I've noticed it has attracted a lot more business since they have redecorated the front. Pretty at night.
author: K. H.

description: Completely overpriced pizza. Almost $20 for a personal size pizza. Gourmet? I think not. Bland and thin.
author: Sarah S.

description: Had a delicious lunch with my kids here. We ordered the Caesar's salad, and three pizzas and we really enjoyed every single bite. I especially loved the thin crispy crust, the fresh ingredients, the cozy setting and the friendly service. The dessert of fresh peaches with cream looked decadent, too but we were too full. We will be back for sure....
author: Vicky R.

description: Found this place after biking the Golden Gate and was delightfully surprised at how good it was in the middle of touristy Fishermans Wharf establishments.  The friends I came here with did not like how a tip was verbally suggested by the cashier when we paid by card.  The food and ambiance are great though, I'd definitely come here again.
author: Fidela B.

description: Checked into our hotel and checked Yelp for close spot for a quick bite. Absolutely delicious wood fired pizza! Cute place! Yum!!
author: Mary J.

description:
This was a great place to grab a quick lunch. Found it by looking for dog friendly restaurants in the area. 
Found really close parking on the street, came up to the front of the dinning area and was greeted by a man tossing some pizza dough. He greeted us and asked if we had any questions about the menu as we browsed the menu posted near the entrance.
Walked up to the order window and was greeted by a very nice woman, who as we ordered made some suggestions according to your taste.
Food came out very quick, and great service was provided by the waiter who offered plates, cups for our can sodas and even straws if needed. Pizza was amazing so fresh and authentic. The thin wood fired crust is so amazing with the traditional pizza sauce.
The dinning area was very clean, organized, and well decorated. Very nice outdoor dinning area for a food truck type establishment.
author: Christopher D.

description: This place is pretty bomb. Pizza was great, atmosphere was good, and the staff was super funny and friendly.
author: Summer T.

description: Delicious pizza, super fresh ingredients and friendly/fast service! Although they skimped a bit on my margherita pizza. More basil would have made this a 5 star rating. (There wasn't even one basil leaf per slice on the whole pizza.)
author: Melissa C.

description: Best pizza in the bay.  Artfully done with love every time.  As good if not better than a lot of pies I have had in Italy.  A must try for my fellow pizza lovers.
author: Elliot S.

description:
Coming from the Pizza capital of the world NYC baby!!! I was blown away by my the margarita pizza pie. It was amazing one of the best pizzas I have ever had. I had the honor of meeting the owner and he told me about his humble roots of making pizza in the back of a supermarket and now he is treating his many visitors in the fisherman's wharf area to one of the best pizza pies I have ever indulged in. 

For sauce go with the carmel special sauce... it is zesty. 
For Cheese try the mozzarella di buffalo it is tremendous. 

The best wood fire pizza I have ever had... well done carmel well done :)
author: Kais S.

description: This gotta be the best and most authentic Italian Pizza this side of the ocean...those of us who have had the fortune to eat pizza in Italy and have yearned for something remotely close to the same explosion of flavors, look no further...Carmel Pizza is the place...
author: Eric F.

description: Wonderful atmosphere. Came here Saturday night. Flavorful sauce and great quality cheese you can really taste the freshness of each ingredient. Even the basil on my margherita was green and aromatic! I'll come around next time.
author: Katrina B.

description: Disappointed experience.  Ordered the Americano and it came out burnt.  Every bite had a burnt taste to it. There was no way around it since it was burnt at the bottom and on the crust...I am surprised they even served it.  I was there with my coworker and we shared and we left hungry.    Pretty expensive for a small pizza in my opinion.  It was $20 for the Americano.  Next time I will just go to Tony's pizza up the hill where I pay less than $4 for a slice of pizza which is equivalent to half of their pizza.
author: L E.

description: The pizza was good. Nice portion size. It's not the best pizza I've ever had but it's good. Had the mozzarella &basil, with mushrooms. Servers were friendly. Also, the bathroom is a little complicated to get to.
author: P H.

description: We were on a cruise ship docked near Fisherman's Wharf and we wanted some pizza before leaving San Francisco. So, based on Yelp reviews, we decided on trying a pizza from Carmel's. We arrived around 6:30 PM and we ordered a Margherita pizza from the friendly owner. 20 mins later we had our delicious wood fired pizza and we enjoyed every bite. They had also "sold out" for the day, over an hour ahead of closing time. The only downside is the outdoor seating on a typical San Francisco evening can quickly cool your pizza, so plan accordingly. Carmel Pizza Co.is definitely getting another visit from us next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Dennis C.

description: The pizza here is FANTASTIC. I was so pleasantly surprised when I accidentally stumbled on this amazing place while I was randomly passing through Fishermans Wharf. The patio/eating area is just delightful. The service was amazing and I really enjoyed chatting with Amanda, the owner. I will definitely be back. I used to think Tony's is the best but CPC has usurped that title.
author: Noel M.

description:
Not bad, but not good.  All the 5 star reviews let me down.  Turns out if you check in and review them, you get a dollar off.  Which makes me think that's why they have so many reviews.... 

Bummed.  I wouldn't go back.
author: M C.

description: Pizza is ok, I tried the Margherita and a Pepperoni, nothing out of the ordinary. They serve it with very thin crust. 4 stars for me. 1. No rest rooms to wash my hands, 2. They charge $1.00 for cheese, if they sale pizza they should offer chilli flakes and cheese for free. 3. They do not validate parking tickets.
author: jorge c.

description:
Came here after a few days of passing by. It was absolutely amazing!! The pizza. Oh the pizza. 

We got the Americano and the Crudo e Parma. The ingredients were so fresh. The crust was cooked perfect!! The Peroni accented well! 

Patio area is sweet. Heaters keep you warm. Very cozy. 

Definitely a hidden gem on the wharf!  Can't wait to visit again.
author: Janice R.

description: Great crust and a nice peaceful place to hang out despite the hustle and bustle of Fisherman's Wharf. We had the bruschetta which was made using heirloom tomatoes. Ordered the margherita pizza for the kids and they ate it all up. We had the carpricciosa which was also very good. The wood fire oven makes a huge difference. If you're hungry or in a rush, plan ahead because making pizza from scratch takes time. Overheard people complaining why their pizza was taking so long ... *sigh*. If a 5 and 7 year old can be patient enough to wait for their delicious pizza, so can you.
author: Timothy W.

description: This was the worst pizza I've ever had.  I don't understand why the high ratings.  We ordered this to go because we were tired and just wanted to hang at the hotel.  We spent 40 bucks on pizza so burnt is was completely inedible.  The few slices out of the two pizzas we bought that weren't burnt were so soggy you couldn't pick it up.  It's hard to see this place, so hopefully you'll miss it and save yourself a bad experience.
author: Jerry B.

description: Caught this place on a Friday at 7pm, just before they closed for a few weeks to travel to Italy.  Great margarita pizza.  Drink selection was a little mainstream but pie was crisp, thin, delicious.
author: Sam F.

description: This place was just okay, I got the pizza with procuiutto and arugula and much to my chagrin, they put tomato sauce on it. This type of pizza should have an olive oil base, or maybe a pesto base, but tomato? It muddied the flavor of the awesome toppings. If there was a different base, the pizza would've been fairly good. A weird thing that both my husband and I commented on was that the crust kind of tasted like popcorn... It was a pleasant surprise that doesn't sound good but was pretty good. If every other food truck place is closed, eat here, otherwise check out the Codmother
author: Megan E.

description: Solid wood fired pie and great outdoor patio. Warm and welcoming with really cool staff. Diavola Pizza is very good especially with a couple beers and  finished off with an order of peaches and cream. The Italian hot peppers they put on the pizza are really good too. Cheers.
author: Cody W.

description: So placed an order on Yelp for pick up.   Purchased garlic bread and pizza.    Total was $30 online after dollar discount for using yelp.   I get there, and realize the prices online were different and I fork out an extra $5 when there.  Now shame on me for getting pizza when in SF.   But I love thin crust, so when I saw such amazing reviews in a district where sea food is dominant.   The crust was average for brick oven.  The toppings had no taste.  The crust out powered the toppings.   Just to see if the toppings were even good, I pulled some off and eat independently.  Nope.  No taste.   This was the Americana.   Know that like with many thin crust brick oven pizzas.  It will only feed 1 person at best.  Order a salad or garlic bread too.
author: Mitch P.

description: Stopped in unexpectedly and found really friendly people and excellent pizza.   All Alfresco   Open one in Dallas please!
author: Steve W.

description: Wonderful, flavorful pizza!  They are single serving pizzas, but very good. Price was reasonable for the pier 39 area. Service was excellent. Will consider eating there again on my next trip playing tourist guide to SF.
author: Kelly S.

description: Food was just okay. A little pricey, and kind of flavorless. I had a margherita pizza with jalapeños and it was just kind of flavorless. Nothing to write home about. The service was good though & the cashier/waitress was very friendly.
author: Rachel G.

description: Love this place. Yes, it's an outside location. But it's phenomenal. Get the prosciutto on a pizza. The nice thing is that you can pick it. These people are great. Yummy pizza, get arugula salad with balsamic dressing is amazing. Spend time here not at wharf. Whoa. Pizza to for plane. Why not, that yummy. Seriously.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Yea yelpers weren't kidding- amazing, FRESH, mouth watering pizza!! I'm also from chi-town and this pizza was one of the best I've had! I ordered their special that day- caprese with buffalo cheese.  To top that off, the owner is SO polite, friendly and accommodating!! Located in a very cute spot in fishermans warf area, you can sit and enjoy their amazing pizza on tables that have heaters as stands!  Such a surprising find :)
author: Angie E.

description:
Recently discovered this little gem in my neighborhood.  I've been twice so far (in just 2 weeks) and tried a few of their pizzas - all have been great, the ingredients are fresh and the olive oil drizzled about is nice touch.  

The owner is friendly, the staff polite, the food good, and the little cabana is a great spot to wait for your to-go orders, or stick around to eat.  My favorite so far - the crudo e parma and the margarita is a close second!   Looking forward to trying their sandwiches in the future as well.
author: Janelle C.

description: Spectacular pizza! Great staff and the pizza came out quickly like two minutes after ordering!
author: L W.

description:
Average pizza. 

Ordered the Crudo e Parma ($15) and a soda ($2). Pizza is good for one or two person, three if there are appetizers.

Friendly staff.
author: qirk z.

description: Absolute best pizza anywhere! Great people and amazing pizza. Went 3 times in 4 day visit.
author: Pam B.

description: Biggest disappointment of weeks dining in SF. Went based on reviews. Cute little outdoor sidewalk restaurant. Ordered margerita pizza and American at $15 and $19, which is pretty pricey for small pizzas. Both were quite soggy crusts and almost indistinguishable in taste. Nice atmosphere but a big letdown in taste. It was a busy weekend and they were not serving garlic twists because they were low on dough... must have also affected pizza.
author: Greg L.

description: These young women do a superb job all around. This is gourmet pizza with a fast food efficiency! We ordered, sat, and were eating all within 5/minutes. This is a lot when you have two hungry children who are about to melt down. Not only was the pizza outstanding; we also loved the basil plant at our table which we used to garnish our pizza. Well worth the five star rating!
author: Victor H.

description:
No bathroom , were do the workers go?
Nice quite spot off the main drag of the tourist spots.  Pizza so thin and crispy it would be impossible to load it with toppings, and they don't.   I got the American.  Still tasty though.
 2 star rating for lack of restroom facilities.  Basically a food truck with a nice seating area.
author: Katherine M.

description: Not worth it!!!! Spent $60 for pizza thin as paper. Expected something much more than what we received. Okay taste, but not worth the money. Tried the Americano and the Crudo... In my opinion, don't waste your time or money!!!
author: Deja G.

description: Amazing pizza! Had the Caesar salad and marg pizza...to die for. Must eat here!! Pizza sauce is not too acidic and crust is perfection!
author: Amy R.

description: We skipped the fish & chips place next door and opted for pizza. It was well worth it. Fresh ingredients from the farmer's market, chunks of melted mozzarella... Yum.  We had the Romantico.
author: Julie R.

description: Some of the best pizza on the west coast coming from a guy with a passion for pizza.  Great job guys.
author: John H.

description:
Been living near this place for so long and today was the first time I ever tried them, so bummed. Their wood fired oven pizza is as good as it gets, seriously. Ever since lunch, I can't stop thinking about it and I can't wait to go back for more. Their dough has just the right amount of crispiness and softness and their pizza topping was very fresh.

Along with great pizza, the service is super friendly too and the prices are very reasonable.
author: Saadullah S.

description:
HAD to write a review was in San Fran last weekend stopped by this place and lived it the cheese pizza was amazing they had to put something in the cheese I don't know I eat my pizza with ranch bread sticks with sauce was ok but if I would just stick to the pizza 

Mmmmm good food
author: Matthew R.

description: This pizza! My gosh is it good! My grandmother does not usually like pizza, or any other food that's not made by her for that matter. But she raved about this pizza to this day! We where in SF about a year ago and she still talking about it today. Want to take her back just for the pizza. Loved it. Best pizza in SF
author: Janeth H.

description:
We were in San Francisco for 5 days and ate lunch here twice.  We would have gotten it another late night if they had been open.

The first pizza we tried had prosciutto and it was pretty good, but lacked a little in flavor.  The second pizza we tried was the Diavalo or something like that....and was fantastic.  I reeeeally wanted to try the pork belly sandwich, but they were out of it on the second day.   So that is definitely something I'll try next time.

The seating area was small and comfortable.  It felt like a little pizza oasis.
author: Cassie W.

description: I've had Pizza all over Italy,   and this pizza was right up there.   We had quattro formaggi with farm fresh tomatoes  and basil.   We also had Ceasar salad wish was obvious the dressing was not from a bottle.  Very good.
author: Reviewer B.

description: Don't let the other food vendors around this gem fool you!  Step into a wonderful alcove and order some of the best wildfired pizza I've ever had. Margarita and Diavola both highly recommended.
author: Andrea D.

description: Seemed a little over priced. The crust was flimsy so it was more of a taco than a pizza. It's a break from all the seafood spots of the Warf.
author: El Raul S.

description: Excellent thin crust pizza and garlic bread. Great, friendly service and cheap beer. Can't beat that combo!
author: Don S.

description:
My wife, two grandsons and I were looking for  quick bite and I saw the video for the Pizza, Very impressed with the quality of the food. My wife had the Caprisis Pizza, and  the two grandson enjoyed the pizza Panini. I had the pork pancetta. 

The food was very good and prices were a real value  They ended up being sold out shortly                                                                                                                                                 
Overall a very good impression. 
Highly recommended
Bruce
author: Bruce H.

description: Stumbled into this very cute spot looking for some pizza. Solid service, and the quick too. I has a Cesar salad which was great! Great dressing, with just the right amount of dressing and crisp romaine. Now on to the main course. Excellent margarita!!!! Really nice crust, some char, but not burnt, and the right amount of chewy and good bounce. The dough wasn't soggy in the middle. Great cheese, well covered but not overly cheesed. The sauce was very good, great consistency and the right amount and texture. Perhaps it could have used a bit more seasoning, but on the other hand, a touch of pepper, red or black and some salt, give you the option to customize to your own liking. The pizza was not greasy at all. Really, well done! All in all, I would come back here all the time and would be happy if this was my regular pizza place. Alas, I am just a tourist and will have to head back to home. Hopefully I'll be able to have it on my next trip back. In the meantime, I'll have to settle for the pizza of my hometown, BROOKLYN! Seriously though, I mean every word of this review, this place rocks !
author: Joshua S.

description:
Fantastic pizza and phenomenally stinky Caesar salad.  The pizza options are traditional yet varied, giving even old school topping lovers like me something different to try.  We got pepperoni for our kids and the Crudo di Parma (prosciutto, mozzarella, parmesan and arugula) for us.  

We ordered two pizzas, specifically for leftovers, nothing made it through the night.  Something tells me we will be back here again before we leave town.

Loved the different fruit Pellegrino options as well, perfect accompaniment.
author: Kelly F.

description: Very nicely made pizza, served in a quaintly decorated space that provides a refreshing escape from the bustle of the wharf. However to be honest, we wouldn't have stopped here if the line for codmother's fish and chips next door wasn't so long - and this seems to be true for every other customer as well. I guess the point is that I am grateful the alternative to the region's most famous restaurant is good in its own right.
author: Vick Y.

description: Really good pizza. I had the Diavola. Good Sangria served on Saturday and Sunday. Succulent garden is cool. I like succulents. The crust is Legit. Perfect amount of sauce and cheese. It feels like you are in Europe.
author: David R.

description:
yelp, you've done it again!

With some hesitation I tried this place on my last business trip that I stayed in the Wharf.  It was late, and I was actually craving a beer, but decided to check this place out based on the reviews and comments.  Sure glad I did, the beer can wait!

The smells were amazing and overpower every one of the crab vendors across the street.  I sat in the heated cabana and was served a piping hot brick oven pizza.  I didn't think I'd be able to finish it by myself, but it was just too good to stop eating.  I got the pepperoni, only because I didn't see their Caprese pizza, which looks amazing and will be my meal on my next trip.

Friendly crew working there, nothing bad to say about this place!

Now, where to find my beer....
author: Nick G.

description: Amazing Pizza! Friendly staff! I would recommend this to locals and tourists. While on vacation in San Fransisco, we went there two days in a row, because the pizza was that good. Very reasonably priced, top quality pizza, fresh ingredients and great staff. Next time in San Fransisco, we will definitely be dining there multiple times.
author: German C.

description:
Don't judge this book by it's cover!! 
Really really really good pizza. 
Don't think just go.
(and big thanks to yelpers, as I found this place because it was close to my hotel!)
author: Tony J.

description:
I took my wife into the city to get away for the day.  I knew I was gambling a bit considering there are so many places to eat in SF.  Furthermore, the wife is a very picky eater, so trying new places can be hit or miss.  It was definitely a hit here.  

She loved the pizza and the Bruschetta and told me the next time we're in the area, she's going to get it again.  The pizza tasted very fresh and the roasted garlic bread was simply awesome.  

When we arrived, I asked him if he knew what channel the Monday Night Football game was going to be on (49ers) and he said he would make sure it's on.  When we ordered, he threw in a few toppings at no charge when we told him we stumbled upon this from Yelp and also reviewed their actual website too.  The owner personally came out and handed me the remote to the TV and told me to turn it up or down and "make yourself at home."  Even though it wasn't your typical situation where you expect to be waited upon, he was checking in on everyone there to make sure everything was good, bringing extra napkins or condiments etc. 


You could really tell they take pride in what they do, something that is pretty rare.  We'll definitely be coming back whenever we're in the area next.
author: anthony h.

description:
Have to let you know that we had lunch 2 hours ago at a pretty fancy and well known fish restaurant in Ghiradelli square.  I should not have been hungry....

This pie (we asked Amanda what to order, and she recommended the fresh heirloom tomato, basil and mozarella) was FANTASTIC.  The dough is excellent, the sauce is perfect and the whole presentation was great.  Great folks, great product.  In town for only 36 hours, and I already know what I am having for lunch tomorrow and where I will be getting it:  the roasted porcetta roast on ciabatta role!  Can't wait to get back there.

Go get some now!
author: Warren A.

description: Awesome pizza! Quick and authentic wood fired pizza! Nice ppl. Good to take out or stay in only outside seating.
author: AnnaMaria L.

description: The pizza is solid but pretty unremarkable.  They are ridiculous about their neighbors' food.  Four members of my family ordered drinks and two pizzas and they wouldn't let me sit there with the fish i got at codmothers.  Whatever, i just gave them some fish and took a couple bites and left.  Really petty and lame.  I'd recommend taking your food to go and eating at the beach in front of ghirardelli square if you find yourself in a similar situation.
author: Soo Jin M.

description:
My husband and I have never tasted pizza so good until we visited San Francisco and found this place. We are SO GLAD to have literally just stumbled upon Carmel Pizza Company. Their pizzas taste amazing.

We ordered two pizzas, both which were jaw-dropping delicious. The one we absolutely loved (even more than the first) was their special Caprese pizza. With the description it sounds just like a Napoli, but the Napoli has NOTHING compared to this Caprese pizza. What made the all veggie Caprese pizza so delicious was the heirloom tomatoes that they used. Both pizzas came with a few burnt spots on the sides, but that's very understandable with the whole woodfire ordeal. All you need to do it take it off. The crust tasted delicious by the way. :)

If you are around the Fisherman's Wharf area and are hungry for some authentic pizza, I guarantee that you will not be disappointed coming here. My husband and I wish so badly that they would have a restaurant down here in LA. Never tasted pizza so good.

Not convinced? Try it yourself and satisfy your appetite as much as we did :)

Also, the chef is so very kind and eager to serve you. At least he was for us.
author: Masumi T.

description: Split the Bianca pizza with 2 friends - all of us are from near Chicago so our pizza standards are high, this place lived up to it's good reputation, would recommend for sure!
author: Paxton J.

description: Delicious pizza!  The outdoor seating area was pleasant and open.  We had the Diabola pizza and it was out of this world!  Perfect crunchy crust and spicy meat.  It Hit the spot!
author: Kathleen C.

description:
With a wood-fired stone oven it smelled good, so we went to grab a slice, but they don't do slices, so we opted for the cheesy garlic bread. Which ended up being a personal pizza covered in garlic and cheese. I would have got a pizza! Oh well, it was ok, super greasy and way too much whole garlic. The crust was amazing! 

Cute little outdoor place, up the street from the Wharf. The whole place is outside, but with shade and wind protection. The people were really nice and genuine. 

I would def try this place again if in the neighborhood or SF for that matter!
author: shawn v.

description: The pizza was good, not amazing, and the prices were a bit steep -- almost like what you'd pay to be sitting in a nice restaurant, except that this place is outdoors and has no indoor seating, so we were chilly, even with the patio heater. Also, they charge extra for Parmesan cheese, which seems kind of wrong at a pizza restaurant. All in all, it's a decent option for that area, which is quite touristy and extremely crowded, but I wasn't terribly impressed with it.
author: Breezy Q.

description:
Everything tasted very fresh, and they had a good selection of toppings. The pizza is very thin, and therefore gets soggy pretty quickly, but who cares when it tastes so good?

Carmel Pizza Co. is a very small restaurant, but the service was very friendly and fast. Recommended!
author: Samantha D.

description:
It's Neapolitan style pizza served in an outdoor setting.

For $10 it's fine.  But to claim itself as "The Best Wood Fired Pizza"?  In the city, I'd say Tony's in North Beach and Zero Zero have them beat.  And there are a handful of other non-wood fired Neapolitan pizzas I'd consider first (Gialina, Pizzeria Delfina and Pizzetta 211, to name a few).

For the area,  you could do a helluva lot worse.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Had a pizza here today with my grandson.  Super good!  
Crust excellent, sauce fantastic and cheese great!  No beer tho... : (
Service was also really nice.  I'll be back.
author: Hollis X.

description: I would highly recommend this spot!! The pizza's are 10 bucks for about 5-6 slices of heaven. Stop by you won't be disappointed. The owners and staff  are super friendly too!! Ask for A.J. he'll treat ya right!!
author: Boss H.

description: Really cool little place in the heart of a very touristy area.  The succulent garden seating area was unique and relaxing.  The tutto porko pizza had everyone else raving.  Caesar salad also was tasty.
author: Joel V.

description: Best service I've experienced in San Fran. Friendly staff and prompt order execution. The pizza is light and would be perfect for lunch. We had it for dinner and left feeling slightly hungry, but nevertheless we knew we ate something of great quality. We will be back!
author: Rob S.

description: Amazing! A refreshing world away from all the tourist traps in the area Carmel Pizza Company is fresh, fast, and delicious. I loved the thin crust and they way it crisped up in the oven, and the fresh mozzarella on top. It was really good.
author: Jack G.

description:
My family and I ate there twice in four days on a recent visit to San Francisco.  We are *picky* eaters -- our kids are burgeoning foodies in their own right (i.e. they were much happier and more comfortable at Delfina than Denny's).

The short version: This is seriously good pizza.  

The longer version: The owners are doing it right -- handmade dough, high-quality ingredients, fresh toppings, and the right kind of oven to give the crust that perfect combination of chewiness and crispness.  Everything we had there was delicious, from a tangy Caesar salad to a caprese salad with amazing heirloom tomatoes that actually TASTED like tomatoes, and very high-quality mozzarella (very creamy and flavorful -- not the usual rubbery mess too many places try to foist off on hapless diners).  

Everyone that works there seems incredibly friendly and sincerely eager to please -- they seem to really want you to enjoy the food that they're so obviously passionate about.

In short, if you're standing in front of the place, reading this on your smartphone, trying to decide if you should risk it, don't worry.  It's not a "risk."  It's just *really* good pizza.  (And in an area not known for having great food!)
author: Scott H.

description:
Great tasting wood-fired pizza in a hipster outdoor setting.

We had the Margherita and a 'design-your-own' with the zesty sauce, mushrooms, arugula and fior do latte cheese. They arrived in about ten minutes and were delicious.

The owner was also friendly and made some hilarious jokes!
author: Rob K.

description:
Good food has finally come to Fisherman's Wharf!  I've lived in the area for almost a decade and would only ever come for In N Out, but now this short stretch of Jones St had three phenomenal choices.

The food: Very tasty thin crust pizza with farmers market fresh heirloom tomatoes, made fresh and fast!
The vibe: A great outdoor seating area where you can come and eat with your dog
The people: SUPER friendly and make you feel at home

Go, be happy, and tell your local friends to go before the tourists start overwhelming this place!
author: Sri A.

description:
It just opened today and was delicious! Very good wood fired pizza. Amazingly yummy crust, probably the best I've had. 

One pizza feeds two people, hence the $10+ pizzas (depending on what topping you add) makes this a less-than-$10 meal for sure. Today three of us split two pizzas and a salad and had plenty for exaclty $10 apiece!

This is a food truck, so no indoor seating though there is some seating inside a little fence so you are somewhat protected from the bustle of the street. Today, though it was super windy, we discovered that this little patio area is sheltered and sunny in spite of it being freezing only a block away.

Without a doubt this is THE BEST PIZZA in Fisherman's Wharf, whithout even a close second runner up.
author: M B.

description: Pizza was amazing! We gobbled it extremely fast. If you eat here, which you should, you must try the heirloom tomatoes!! Add them if they don't come on the pizza! They made the pizza extra special and the three of us sharing the pizza made sure every tomato was eaten out of the bottom of the box. Very pleased with our pizza!
author: Tara B.

description: Great pizza, reasonable price, really fast service! It is outside so if the weather is cold bring a sweater!
author: Carl N.

description: Such a cute place and the pizzas were awesome! It's like a little food truck but the eating area was covered and there were heaters too. I can't remember the name of the pizza I had but it had arugula, tomatoes, and prosciutto. It was delish!
author: Mai N.

description: Really good wood fired pizza with great atmosphere. Enjoyed the outdoor seating area. While you are  just feet from Fisherman's Wharf, it feels like a world away.   Ingredients were very fresh and the pizza was cooked perfectly. Staff was super friendly.
author: Patrick P.

description:
Yum! Amazing pizza! I love it when someone can take simple, quality ingredients and make something delicious!! I had the Margarita pizza and my friend had the all meat pizza! We were both very happy. Should be 4.5 stars, I have to deduct a tiny bit. I love the olive oil on top but half way through the crust was very soggy. We need to invent a way to keep that wood fire yummy crispy goodness!

If you are in the Fisherman's Wharf area check this place out! You will not be disappointed!!
author: Kellie T.

description: Perfect during a windy day on beautiful Fisherman's Wharf! For around $11 I enjoyed a margherita pizza with super thin and crunchy and fresh crust. One whole pizza is probably good enough for each individual. I'd recommend adding some items on the pizza as well.
author: Daina H.

description:
Delicious food in San Francisco?  Most definitely! But in Fisherman's Wharf?  Yeah there's Gary Danko but elsewhere it's mostly fried calarmi, crab legs and more crab legs, not that those are bad but it's not porchetta and prosciuotto sandwiches!  

Ever since London a few years ago I've been yearning for a great porchetta sandwich and tonight my gf and I found it.  Yes it's called Carmel Pizza company and while I can't say whether their pizza is delicious or not, their sandwiches are some of the best ones I've had in a long, long time.  The porchetta comes with chunks of meat and arugula.  The meat is perfect as there are crispy skin, meat and a bit of fat, the perfect balance.  The prosciutto sandwich is equally just as good.  Lots of meat, arugula, heirloom tomatoes and mozzarella.  The sandwiches are so good, I bought an extra one to go.  Both sandwiches have great balance of flavors while being covered in acme bread.

The guys and girls here are super nice and friendly so service is an A+.  I'm definitely going to come back and get more of their sandwiches and hopefully I will have room for their pizzas.
author: Pierre L.

description: Loved this place! Have passed by and meant to go many times and finally did today. Pizza was delicious, space is adorable and relaxing, owner/chef/staff all so nice and attentive- and made sure everyone enjoyed their pizza. Above and beyond service in every way. I wish I had gone sooner but will definitely be back.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Delicious, crispy crust. Sauce that balances perfectly between savory and sweet. High quality toppings generously scattered. Carmel Pizza Company is producing truly outstanding pizza. Even better, the owners are friendly and helpful, serving a side order of directions to some weary travelers who needed help along with their dinner.

My husband and I split a sausage, mushroom and olive pizza and it was the perfect dinner. We'll definitely be returning on our next adventure in the city.
author: Jen A.

description: A little cozy outdoor patio dining! Thin crunchy crust with great quality ingredients very tasty pepperoni,  nice olive oil drizzle.  This place left me thinking about it long after I left! Will definitely return to this hidden gem
author: Sara S.

description: The service was wonderful.  We called at 9:50 and they were about to close but took our order. The crust was crispy but not burnt, and covered with fresh toppings.  I was not disappointed
author: shelley h.

description: We decided to try this place after reading so many great reviews. We were definitely not disappointed!! This place is amazing and I would definitely recommend it to anyone in the area. The decor was really cute and inviting. The pizza was some of the best I've ever had. The only bad thing is that we didn't have time to go back and try some of their other pizzas. Highly recommend!!
author: Averi E.

description: Found this place on Yelp and gave it a try. Really good wood fired pizza. Service was great! They also have beer and wine.
author: Bonnie R.

description:
Stopped here last night based on the five star yelp rating and was not disappointed. The place is run out of a custom food trailer/building and features al fresco dining in the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf district.  The owner/operators are friendly, enthusiastic and provide excellent service.  But what really gains them the five star rating is the pizza.

They make personal sized wood fired pizzas that seemed to be around 12" in diameter, but I might have misestimated the size.  The crust was exceptionally good, crisp with wonderful flavor.  The sauce was very nice providing an well seasoned background to the toppings without overpowering them.  The toppings themselves tasted fresh and high quality.

I had a half and half pizza with their caprese on one side and their garlic and mushroom on the other.  The tomatoes on the caprese side were heirloom tomatoes and tasted nicely ripe and the basil was delightfully flavorful.  The garlic on the other side was well roasted and added a wonderfully subtle array of flavors that blended well with the mushrooms.  My wife had a combination of her choosing and loved it.  She thought the sausage was especially enjoyable.

We will definitely be back.  The also deliver within five blocks. So consider ordering one if you're in the area.
author: Tony P.

description: You can't go wrong with this place. Pizza is delicious! Plus I like that it's just a hop,skip and a jump from Pier 39,when visiting like me! :-) Sitting is limited but that's ok it's worth the wait
author: Daniel G.

description: Superb pizza, quaint location, great customer service, a fantastic place to grab a bite to eat and hang out.
author: Walt M.

description: Pizza was good. The service was awesome! The atmosphere was perfect. Food was on the pricey side but, knowing the location I'm sure the overhead was high. I would definitely choose this place over any of the surrounding corporate restaurants.
author: Brandon V.

description: Can't believe they have this awesome of a place so close to tourist central. This is now our most favorite pizza joint in SF.
author: Thiru S.

description: Best 4 cheese pizza in SF. Thin and crispy, rivals the best in Europe. Very friendly and helpful staff. As a cheese lover I will be back to try the other great pizzas cooked in a wood fired oven.
author: Michael F.

description: my 2nd review since 09, because I only review whats worthy. This is by far the best pizza i've ever had besides my own.  Order, eat, and fall in love. nuff said!
author: ed k.

description:
Excellent Pizza! their Margarita with basil is to die for. 

WARNING! Once you've tried their pizza, you can't go back to regular pizza. Sorry.

How come I gave a 4 stars rating since their pizza are so good? Good question, cause i've been getting burn spots on my pizza. 

Sorry.
author: Jason H.

description: Amazing!  Walking around the warf looking for something good to eat and found this place!  It's like a serene retreat away from the noise of tourists but just down the block. The pizza and bruschetta are so good I will def have this on my list of places to eat when I visit San Francisco!
author: Sadiha A.

description: Good pizza but wear a jacket if it's cold! Out door cafe area. Pizza came within 5 min for us but it was not very busy.
author: David T.

description: Carmel is a patio-only pizza stand near Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. They make the pizzas in just a few minutes and bring it right to your table. The pizza I had was very good and cooked perfectly with a dusting of salt on the crust to make it extra tasty.
author: Scott H.

description: We were looking for a quick bite and chose this place based on yelp reviews. In this case they were totally wrong. I've had box pizza that was better than this. They wouldn't split the pizza in half so we each could have toppings we wanted. And then the sauce had zero taste, the toppings were sparse and for a thin crust pizza it was downright limp. I wouldn't eat here again unless I was starving.
author: Teresa Q.

description:
Best pizza this side of Union and Stockton St.

Be sure to ask for your $1 off for paying with cash.
author: Eric T.

description: Great pizza!  Just delicious, convenient, well-priced.  It was a perfect lunch and a nice break from the crowds of tourists.
author: Heather H.

description: Great pizza. Nice thin crust with awesome flavors. Price is slightly higher but quality of service and taste makes up for that.
author: Ravi J.

description: This little place really lived up to it's reviews.  All fresh ingredients great service and just awesome pizza.  What a great find.
author: Eric G.

description:
We just returned from San Francisco and had the BEST pizza my boys (ages 17 & 20) said they had ever had. The owners AJ and Amber were incredibly friendly (which, sadly, we found to be the exception there rather than the rule).  They gave us samples of some delicious roast pork that they serve in sandwiches. It was just so flavorful. We also ordered the Cesar Salad which was perfectly dressed!  
A delightful experience for a small place that has only been open for 2 weeks.  We hit the jackpot when we found this tiny little gem!
author: Pam B.

description: The marguerita pizza was tasty, however more importantly AJ the owner took our order and very friendly. Keep up the great work and we'll definitely be back for more pizza pie soon.
author: George B.

description: The best pizza I have had in a very long time! All locally sourced natural ingredients. Quick, friendly service with open air seating. We will definitely visit the next time we are in town! My tastebuds are super happy!
author: Denise V.

description: Wow, simply amazing. some of the best pizza I've ever had. try the Americano and the Crudo y Parma!
author: Stephanie s.

description: Ordered the margherita pizza. It was good, nothing special or memorable (like from tony's).  What really bothered me is that they charge $1 for parmesan cheese.  That's ridiculous.  I don't care if u import the cheese and/or grate the cheese yourself.  I've never heard of a pizza joint charging for parm cheese.  What's next, wanting crust on a pizza is gonna be extra charge?
author: A.S K.

description:
Miss Popular.

Me: Exhausted after a night with the legendary Eric Prydz.

Them: Exhausted after what sounded like a legendary catering job.

Some of the best pizza in the city is coming out of Carmel Pizza's brick oven. Word must be traveling fast.

Crust with just the right amount of crisp. Sauce with just the right amount of seasoning. Mozzarella and bell peppers add just the right amount of complementary flavor.

Pizza seemed bigger than the advertised 11". Polished with enthusiasm. Wanted another. Not just a slice. Entire pie. For the very reasonable price of $10.

Despite exhaustion their was nothing but smiles along with a palatable enthusiasm from the staff about the dream they are trying to achieve.

Have no doubt they will get there. One pizza at a time.
author: Jason B.

description: I've never written a review before--that's how good this pizza is. Ask for the chili sauce!
author: Alexis H.

description: Lovely spot tucked away from the madness of Fisherman's Wharf area. Pizza was delicious.
author: Dave M.

description:
I took my two boys (13 and 16) for a long weekend in San Francisco.  We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott, which has 3 pizza places within a half block of the hotel.  I looked all of them up on Yelp and this one had the best reviews, so we decided to try it.  After a LONG day walking around the city, we were exhausted and hungry.  The place is small, but wasn't too busy for a Saturday night.  All outdoor seating, but they have heat lamps so it wasn't cold at all.  We ordered 2 pizzas between the 3 of us.  We had a cheese pizza and a pepperoni pizza.  Our friends that were with us had the pizza panini.  Everything we ordered was delicious. They use very fresh ingredients in everything, and the pizza is thin crust, but the crust is amazingly delicious.  They say the pizzas are supposed to be sort of individual sized, but we had 2 pizzas between 3 of us and there were a couple of extra pieces, so our friends ate them.  We could not waste that delicious pizza!

They serve beer and wine, although a limited selection, and sodas, which are in a case and you help yourself.  Very informal, but definitely worth a visit.  We liked it so much that we decided to go back again a couple of nights later.  

The second time i ordered a ceasar salad, which was $9 so i though it would be fairly large.  it was really just an individual portion.  I think the pizza's and other items on the menu are reasonably priced, but $9 for a ceasar salad...really?
author: Jo B.

description: Who knew that hidden in the depths of touristy Fisherman's Wharf, a superb Neapolitan's pizza could be found.  As a native San Franciscan, I try and avoid the Wharf area, unless I am playing "tour guide" to out of town friends.  Carmel Pizza is one of the very few reasons I break this rule.  The wonderfully thin, crackling crust from the wood fired oven is sublime.  The toppings are fresh and judiciously placed, not too much, just right.  So yum!!!!  If you want your taste buds to be transported to Italy, go to Carmel Pizza Co.
author: Funk G.

description: What a wonderful experience, especially for the area. The crust was outstanding, the toppings fresh (especially the tomatoes) and the staff were helpful, attentive and genuinely hospitable. At first I was disappointed to see that it is more or less an enclosed outdoor space rather than a building, but in the end it was very pleasant and comfortable.
author: David B T.

description: Fresh. Hot. Grease free and very tasty ingredients. Beer selection could be better but the pie itself delicious.
author: Chris P.

description:
I absolutely loved getting pizza from here a couple of times when I visited San Francisco. The pizza was so fresh and tasty and the service was really friendly.

For the toppings I chose prosciutto, heirloom tomatoes and basil, it was a nice combination :-) .
author: Em C.

description: The pretty much nailed my ideal pizzeria experience, food, service, music, and decor .... Perfect!
author: Jason G.

description: Yummy. You need to sit outside but it isn't as bad if u sit under a heat lamp. The Caesar salad is really garlicky. The pizza's are great, don't forget to get a punch card if u are local.
author: Joy C.

description: This was the best pizza I've had EVER. Great service in an open atmosphere, real brick oven. You can see them placing your pizza right in. Great!
author: Becky C.

description: delicious Italian style thin crust pizza! a gem in the midst of fisherman's wharf mediocrity.
author: Amy G.

description: It's the best kept secret on the Embarcadero. Very reasonably priced and good selection. The sauce is incredible. I had The Marinara and devoured it. House wine has a great flavor too. Beautiful spot away from the usual fish and chips and chowder bowls. I'll definitely go back!
author: Michelle R.

description: Got to say the pizza here was pretty good. My wife and I had the Margarita pizza and we were very happy with it. The pizza has that wood fire taste that I love! It is outdoor seating only, just keep that in mind.
author: Doug P.

description:
If u want to eat like a Roman then you have to eat here! Wood fired perfection with a thin crispy crust and the freshest toppings, I don't think I waited more than 5min for my pizza...oh and don't forget to order the Caesar salad you won't regret it. 
Patio seating, dog friendly and if your looking for refuge from the windy waterfront then CPC will be your oasis.  Thanks for coming to S. F
author: Jason M.

description:
Pizza was good, but light on the sauce. Excellent customer service and pizza only took about 10 minutes. Light sauce probably allows pizza to cook faster.  Maybe they would add more sauce on request. 
No restrooms on premises. 
Next to Fisherman's Wharf
author: Jake D.

description:
The owners are both great and are reason enough to stop by and check this place out.

Doesn't hurt that the pizza is also fresh, delicious, inexpensive, and the perfect size for dinner or lunch.  This place has the perfect laid back vibe to offset the hectic tourist trap known as "Fisherman's Wharf".   Great little patio with the Rat Pack, Chet Baker and all kinds of other music playing through out the day.

I live within walking distance and this is the only place I go to eat at the Wharf.  Wish i worked near by so AJ could drop off some delivery.  

(I have heard the Porchetta is delicious, but so far it has been sold out by the time I get there.  Gotta be a good sign.)
author: Kenneth H.

description:
They close at 8, but we ordered at 7:45 for pickup and they were happy to accommodate us. The wood-fired pizza was excellent all around (and I'm snobby about my pizza) and the staff was very friendly. We didn't stay to eat but the small outdoor eating space was warm and comfortable. Only knock is that the pizza was a tad small for nearly $20. I think they need a larger-size option.

Recommend!
author: Josh G.

description:
I'm giving this 4 stars for being the best in area which is really missing any decent pizza -- difficult when compaing to NY or Boston pizza. 

Wood fired pizza is very good - crust is excellent but the sauce is a little too sweet and missing flavor.  Great selection of toppings -- mushroom and roni was a good choice.
author: Sal C.

description:
excellent pizza. no frills setup but great finished product. A little pricey for what you get, but given the area, it is hard to pass up. 

Check-in on yelp and get $1 off. Also, once you order, get a time estimate and then go wander with the tourists at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Clay S.

description: Excellent wood-fired pizza! The food was great and the staff was friendly! The bruschetta was phenomenal as well!
author: Josh H.

description: Seriously good pizza. We ordered the Margherita and the Crudo e Parme and they were both stellar. The service was great and quick. If I lived closer I would be here all the time. I could eat the pizza here all day.
author: Jon W.

description:
Went there on the recent trip to SFO and needed a quick lunch. I would not have picked this place from walking by, but seeing the good reviews here and being a pizza aficionado I gave it a try.
The bruschetta and the pizza margarita were tasty, albeit small, and expensive but what in SFO isn't? 
The ambiance is a little unusual, all outdoor seating in the middle of tourist traffic and ordering at a trailer window, but not unpleasant. I would certainly come back for a another taste.
author: Uli B.

description: This place is so fresh and delicious! One of the best pizzas I've had! I ordered the margarita pizza. It was very simple but done perfectly. The sauce really stood out to me...I ate the whole pizza myself! The place is small but not crowded. Nice atmosphere. I'm not a fan of Fisherman's Wharf but on the bright side it makes for a great stop when you are showing your tourist friends around :)
author: Claudia L.

description: My husband and I made this one of the stops on our food tour last year. We were instantly impressed. The atmosphere is great, lots of people watching. The outdoor patio area is very relaxing. They have lots of succulents and signs posted around. The service was great and the Margharita pizza was delicious and wood fired. You can see all the wood piled up in the back. The pizza is thin crust and full of flavor. I would highly recommend this place to anyone in the area.
author: Angela R.

description: First night we came they were closed early due to running out of pizza.  Came the next night and they were out of sausage.  Got a couple of pizzas with a beer and waters.  Lady at the window indicated I should consider a tip, although they only bring out the pizza to your table and do nothing else.  No cups of water, water must be purchased by the bottle.  The actual pizza tasted pretty good, light and crispy crust.  Will not come back with the family, maybe if I am alone and in need of a bite.
author: Ravi A.

description: Really delicious: an authentic,  light option for a summer dinner.  I could see it getting easily crowded,  as it's a small place,  but we lucked out and came when then it was quiet and tranquil.  We even got to see a bird snatching a few drinks out of a wall fountain.  Great choice for the Wharf area
author: Cody W.

description: Amazing napolitano style pizza, which i happen to love. It came out fast! Couple things: it's little more than a walk up window with a patio built around it, so don't expect a full on sit down italian-style meal. The pizza is excellent for its style, not deep dish. It's very thin crust and baked in a wood burning oven. They do serve beers in a small selection (I counted 3). The patio is heated. Caesar salad was dee-lish!
author: Francesca H.

description:
The pizza was delicious, the service was gracious and the owners were friendly and accommodating. We were not disappointed!

The crust on the pizza, as mentioned by others, had just the right amount of crisp and tasted amazing. The pizza sauce was flavorful and the amount of cheese was perfect. 

If you love tomatoes and happen to be able to catch them when they have stocked in-season heirloom tomatoes (Auguts-September?), I highly recommend adding them to your pizza or getting the caprese salad - these toms are to die for! 

Would recommend this pie any day!
author: Toni D.

description: Perfect little pizza place!  It looks like a food truck that has found a permanent home.  Really fresh and good.  The crust is thin and the fresh tomatoes are very fresh.
author: Cynthia C.

description: I believe this is the best pizza place in all of San Francisco. I love the food and the service that my mother and I received.
author: Dona D.

description: This is PERFECT  (for what it is )-- a food truck (permanently) parked down by Fishermans Wharf.  Great thin crust pizza made to order, fresh ingredients, fast! I hate to admit, but I ate the whole pizza (margarita). Hey, I walked it off afterwards!
author: debbie s.

description: The BEST pizza I've had since my visit to NY! Ingredients are super fresh and the crust has the perfect balance of chewiness and crunch. Is this place foreal?!
author: Lioness C.

description: Excellent crispy crust and fresh ingredients. Little charming courtyard. Smell of a wood fire in the middle of the city. Highly recommend for lunch.
author: Todd G.

description: Great pizza, good house wine. A little pricey for the food but overall a great alternative to some of the more touristy spots in the area.
author: Alex D.

description: I've been here multiples and am never disappointed. The ingredients are fresh and any pizza you order will be great.
author: Andrew Y.

description: Friendly staff, the girls are both great and full of personality! Pizza was cooked to perfection, heaps of flavour... and piping hot. Highly recommended. Big fan of wood fired pizza... makes all the difference.
author: Clinton H.

description:
I am literally signed up for Yelp just so I could write a review for this place. My wife and I were visiting on vacation and read that this would be a good stop for pizza lovers. We were not let down. I was blown away with the quality of the pizza and the incredible flavors. I ordered the Diavola, I might be spelling that wrong...but it was spicy and was loaded with flavor. My wife had the Margherita which was equally as tasty. The fresh brick oven taste of the cooked dough still has my mouth watering. 

Staff was awesome as well and very friendly. If you are looking for a place to stop around Fisherman's Wharf for some food, skip everything else and go here if you love pizza. I am still craving it!
author: Dan L.

description: Just finished a Diavola pie, thin crust, perfect char from the wood oven, cold Peroni to wash it down. Very satisfying pizza, not your typical pizza joint pie, more an experience from a shop in Italy. Well done, will come back again next time in San Francisco.
author: Kurt B.

description: Hole in the wall pizzeria in the rain. Food was great and the out door under cover heated seating was excellent. What a lunch in San Fran!
author: Deb B.

description:
On a day like today, having a meal here makes perfect sense.  We came here for a snack this afternoon.  The weather cannot be more ideal with the sun shining, accompanied by a gentle breeze.  We felt like the tourists that surround us as we ordered our Margherita pizza with Buffalo Mozzarella and took one of their patio tables.  The pizza was made with such great tasting dough that my partner ate the entire half of her share, crust and all, which I've hardly ever seen her do.  The toppings of tomato sauce, mozzarella and basil were just the right amount for the pie.  

With such friendly service, sweet little dining space, all we need are more days like today to turn us into regulars!
author: Yvette F.

description: The pizzas are great yea but they're over priced and their policies and staff were rude. I ordered 3 drinks and a pizza waiting for my bf who had gotten a taco next door. Once he came in and sat down they told him he wasn't allowed to eat his food on their premises. So he had to sit there while they watched him for 15 minutes waiting for my food while his food got cold. Very inconsiderate. We're new to the neighborhood but definitely will not come back.
author: Ilja D.

description:
It was such a treat to dine at Carmel Pizza Company this evening!  Our two pizzas were delicious, and establishes this neighborhood spot as our new favorite pizza place!  There is unfortunately a dearth of good food in North Beach, and Carmel offers Italian cuisine on par with the top restaurants in SF.  We also had a great time chatting with AJ and Amanda, and watching the impressive pizza-tossing talents of Salvatore :)

We will be back to try the panini (we witnessed repeat customers coming back specifically requesting this dish) as well as some of the other tasty specials on the rotation.  We're thrilled to welcome Carmel to the neighborhood!
author: melita s.

description: Great sidewalk food. Nice service, good food, wonderful downtown atmosphere. A must for a quick bite for lunch.
author: Sean W.

description: Great wood fired pizza at a cute outdoor patio. Yummers! The margharita is especially delish and they make the BEST Caesar Salad at the Wharf!
author: Brian L.

description: Great wood-fired pizza from a converted food truck.  Super friendly service. A fantastic option from the old Fisherman's Wharf spots.
author: Brian C.

description: We stumbled on this place as my family was searching for somewhere to eat. I was pleasantly surprised, the pizza was excellent and the staff was very friendly. The patio atmosphere was quite nice too. It is a bit pricy but not unreasonable for Fisherman's Wharf. I will definitely hit this place up again if I'm in the area.
author: Patrick R.

description: This place is WAY, way better than one would expect in such a touristy area.  And, when we returned three days after our first visit, the friendly young woman remembered us, which blew me away.  Run, do not walk, to Carmel Pizza - just do it before they close around 8.  We'd have gone a third time but were running too late.
author: Sue B.

description: I was looking for a rich pizza experience near fishermans wharf when I discovered Carmel Pizza Company. Wow! The Neapolitan style fire oven baked pizzas are amazing!!! I chose my own toppings including their own special zesty sauce and  my pizza was delicious. Much better than some of the cheaper soggy pizza by the slice options nearby. The ingredients are fresh and gourmet. What more can I say? The staff was very kind and helpful. They checked on us throughout the meal. Don't be turned away by the tent/lattice style building construction. This place is a winner!
author: Benjamin D.

description: I love pizza. Coast to coast in the states and even dark alleys in Rome don't have a pizza close to the pie here. I only wish there were more convenient locations in the city for us locals.
author: Anant A.

description:
Yesterday I came from the Monterey peninsula for an appointment and happened upon the Carmel Pizza Company.  I'm from Carmel, so I had to go see what was what!  Plus, I love great pizza.

Amanda prepared my anchovy/pepporini/mushroom pizza and it seems to be ready in moments!.

Thin crust, the freshest ingredients and ready in a flash!  I loved it!

I sat at one of the outside tables and was joined by AJ, who, with Amanda have this amazing addition to the outdoor restaurants on Fisherman's Wharf.

AJ was as friendly as Amanda and I felt right at home.

I hardly ever write reviews, but I just had to recommended Carmel Pizza to anyone who is traveling to San Francisco or lives there.  Truly, I haven't had pizza this good outside of Italy.  I heard Amanda studied in Florence and that AJ's Italian.  Maybe that's why.

Thanks for reading my review.  One happy pizza lover!!!
author: Loves L.

description: Very good pizza. If you don't like brick oven pizza (I.e. Occasional char), then don't eat here. But then you'd be missing out...
author: Julia F.

description: The perfect pizza?  This is a great place to eat if you like perfect pizza, eating in a casual - outdoor setting at a restaurant where they really care about the product. I can't think of anything I would change about it.  Had the imported mozzarella, arugula and prosciutto.  Great crust and delicate body...mmmm.
author: Eric L.

description: California born and raised, but understand where real pizza is made- New York! If you want amazing traditional New York pizza- go to New York, BUT if you want BETTER: go to Carmel Pizza Co! Great pizza, great service, great people, great experience EVERY TIME!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Best pizza in North Beach.  My wife and I are local.  We had two pizzas, both imported buffalo milk mozzarella: (1) arugula, pesto, mushrooms; and (2) pepperoni (pre-baked), Italian sausage, mixed bell peppers, and sun dried tomatoes.  Both were perfectly baked in a wood fired grill, and delicious!  I wolfed down mine in about 5 minutes.  This is our new favorite pizza place in North Beach.  

By the way, the owners are cool, too: A.J. and Amanda are from Carmel, and just happened to decide to open up a top pizza joint in the City!  Love it.
author: Chas J.

description:
Owner invited me in off the street I was planning to go somewhere else but had seen a few good reviews so I took a shot at it. The wood fired pizza there is delicious and the owners are friendly and genuinely concerned about your experience. 

AJ (male) was polite and seemed to be happy talking with a few of the customers.  Amanda (woman running the oven) was busy but still asked how everything was.

I couldn't get a paper receipt if used a Credit Card but they emailed it to me on the spot and I had it on my phone before I sat so so that was actually better in my book. Nice people, cute decor for an outdoor side of the street, and good food what more could you ask for.

i don't know when I will be back in the area but when I am it will worth the walk down the street to visit.
author: Brad A.
