description: Great pizza! Especially loved the sauce, and the crust was nice & crisp. A tad bit pricy for the size, but still a fan.
author: Y L.

description: The pizza is freshly made, but ours was a bit burned and had a lot of rukkola and a little everything else. The waiter is really weird.
author: Maria O.

description: Called on a Saturday night at 8:35 not expecting a speedy delivery. However, they told us it would get here in 45 min. Fine. 1 and a half hours later still nothing. After we call to check on the status we were assured It would be 5 minutes as they were "taking it on the way out, since it is closing time." Psyche, another 45 min later and it finally arrives. Was the pizza worth the wait? Nope.
author: Heather R.

description: Wood fired pizza.  No indoor seating which was a little disappointing.  We got pizza to go for our hotel room.  They even made a custom white pizza for us on the fly.  Not the best pizza I've ever had, nor the worst.  I'd give them another try.
author: Liss B.

description: Ever since we moved to San Francisco, my husband and I have only been to the Fisherman's Wharf on three types of occasions, one when we first moved here, second, when we have guests and lastly, when we craved good artisan pizzas at Carmel Pizza Co. They are always very friendly and the pizzas are always good. Fresh ingredients! My husband is from Europe and loves the thin-crust pizzas as they reminds him of home. The pizzas comes in whole pies. My husband and I usually order two and we are always able to finish them quite easily. Well, maybe we just have big appetites.
author: ZW N.

description: Best Pizza in San Francisco. The owners are super friendly and the place is super cute. It's such a surprise finding a great spot like this in a touristy area! Pizza tastes exacly like back home! Well done!
author: Alessandro M.

description: Great little pizza spot! The pizza was delicious! Crispy and full of flavor. The patio is adorable! The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because of the price. The prices are too high for the size of the plates.
author: Hungry Penguins ..

description: Excellent and fresh handmade pizza. Nice casual patio seating with good service and warm welcoming staff! In the mood for pizza it's a must, definitely will be back!
author: Scott V.

description: What a great surprise nestled amongst the tourist traps of Fishermans Wharf.   Excellent service and great pizza for a fair price.
author: D S.

description: Thank you, yelpers, for leading me (again!) to a great place! Pizza was DELISH - great sauce and crust - and the place was perfect for a leisurely lunch outside.
author: Rupa S.

description: Really good thin crust pizza!  Fun outdoor food truck patio.hotel recommended as a favorite with locals.  Staff very friendly and quickly moved tables and chairs to accommodate group of 8
author: Jenn T.

description:
I should never have Bay Area pizza after coming back from New York. Compared to the insulting manhole covers that pass for pizza in this city, this place is at least trying. The pizza is one of the best to be had around here. The bright spot is the crust, however the sauce is far too sweet and I had no sense of any olive oil added.

They definitely get 5 stars for friendliness and courtesy and for picking up an otherwise hopeless area to have a meal in. These folks obviously care about what they are doing.
author: George S.

description: Great pizza.  Very affordable given the location.  If your staying in a nearby hotel give them a try.  Husband and wife team. Support local biz and avoid the tourist chains located throughout the area.
author: Jon L.

description:
I work in the neighborhood. This is the second time I've tried to order something from this place. Today I tried to order a sandwich and they said my card didn't work.  UHhhh OK. They said have an ATM now.  UHhhh OK.So I tried their ATM (OH my card WORKS FOR THE ATM!???) and after I noticed they have a $4.95 fee I canceled. 

Took my card elsewhere, just like I do every day, and it WORKS FINE. Can't help but think I got funneled to their ATM so they can grift me. 

AND well a $5 ATM fee is INSANELY HIGH. The rest of the neighborhood charges $3. I'm going to keep an eye on my bank for any crazy charges. San Francisco is full of places to get food. I don't need to deal with this crap for a $9 sandwich plus a $5 fee.
author: Theresa R.

description:
On the advice of our son, my husband & I ate lunch here on a recent trip.  We chose the Margherita - it was wonderful! Great sauce, cheese and crust and very hot! They
use wood to bake their pizzas.
The outdoor seating was very relaxing after walking up and down hills!  The decor is unique - some of it being framed succulents!  The staff was super friendly and one
girl came out and talked to us for quite awhile.  We enjoyed our pizza and our visit here.
Although it is located near Fisherman's Wharf, it does not have the crowded tourist
atmosphere as some places.  Visit Carmel and enjoy a great pizza!
author: Denise B.

description: Very enjoyable fresh pizza.  friendly staff and clean for being a food truck type place.  I will be back as I was pleasantly surprised by how tasty and easy to order.
author: Brian N.

description: Great place for a "food truck" stop! We went for dinner the other day and were the only ones there before they closed. The girls working were very helpful and attentive. They waited patiently until we were done eating. We ordered the Romantica pizza and it was delicious!!
author: Molly L.

description: Very Good pizza! A must try if you are in the area. It's operated out of a trailer (similar to a food truck) with outdoor seating not too far from Fisherman's Wharf and close to Ghiardelli factory. Beats all the touristy eateries which charge way too much for their food. A must place to eat!
author: Chris D.

description:
The best pizza I've had in SF!
Really unique - razor thin crust, fresh toppings, and you can really taste the olive oil.  Huge departure from the greasy cardboard you find elsewhere.  I live in the area and have had it three nights in a row - totally a hidden gem in an area that is usually filled with overpriced and undercooked tourist food.  Not to mention that for some reason the music is always really good there.  I recommend the arugula with olives!
author: Jakob C.

description: Pizza was good but a little on the greasy side. Also I'm use to a crust that has a little flavor to it so it was kind of bland to me. Would eat again.
author: Mai T.

description: Hand tossed pepperoni pizza baked in a wood oven. OMG. This was some really great pizza. The owners were also very welcoming and friendly. Will definitely come back here next time I'm in SF.
author: Tim T.

description: These guys do it right. Wood fired thin crust pizza. Always ask for their recommendations. Price is right. Great memories just as if I was back in Italy.
author: Giacomo S.

description: This spot is legit!  Generally I don't make it to the Wharf for anything other than an occasional Alcatraz sweatshirt, but that's going to change.  The owner and employees are super nice and accommodating for whatever you may want.  The pizza and sandwiches are simple but absolutely delicious.  Wouldn't change a thing here.
author: William B.

description: This was a great find on  yelp. Came to the city yesterday to take a bay cruise and turned to yelp to help me find a lunch spot near the pier. This was a great little spot for lunch. Pizza was very fresh and delicious. Prices were good too. I would come back for sure.
author: Barbara G.

description: Great pizza. Nice people. Fun outdoor seating near Fisherman's Wharf. Avoid the tourist traps and eat here!
author: Doug J.

description: This wood-fired  pizza hit the spot after a day of sight seeing in San Francisco.
author: Julie M.

description: Best pizza!  Amazing crust, authentic Italian pizza and friendly owners.  I love their pizza margarita with basil.
author: K. L.

description: I'm here from New York. Great pizza !!! Highly recommend ! I got artichoke and olive
author: Bryan M.

description: Great pizza and awesome employees!! Delicious food and super fresh ingredients! Will definitely be back!!
author: Danielle M.

description: I've had margherita pizza at many places, and this is as authentic as it gets. They stay busy so be prepared to wait a little, but it's worth the wait.
author: Slick V.

description: Food and service are very good.  Pizza's are for small for two people if you are hungry.  Much better then the tourist traps around the wharf!
author: M T.

description: Very small pizza place. Walk-up ordering to what looks like a food truck and seating (about six tables) on a patio in front of the truck. Very simple menu and a long wait (about 15+ minutes for two 11" pizzas), but our pizza was really good. We had the caprese special - super fresh tomatoes - and the one with prosciutto and real Parmesan cheese, mmmm. Thin crust, but a little too much crust for my taste. Great way to kick off our time in San Fran, though!
author: Kendall T.

description: Surprising to find quality pizza in a such touristic area.
author: c a.

description: Recently was in San Francisco vacationing with family and recommend this place. Another great find on Yelp.com The pizza was fresh and excellent! The staff/owner was friendly. The place was able to accommodate our group of 11 without any problems. In addition to their great pizzas, the Caesar Salad was to die for!
author: Julie R.

description:
Best pizza in the wharf!

Working in the area, we're always on the lookout for new lunch options.  Carmel Pizza has definitely made the cut.  Everyone was super friendly, food came out fast, pleasant seating area out of the wind, and with the wood oven aroma in the air, this place earns an instant 5 stars.

The food was delicious.  The pizza wasn't greasy and the toppings were fresh.  Three of us split two pies and a salad; it was the perfect amount.  Everything very reasonably priced as well.  Nothing by the slice here, great for mix-n-match with friends or for leftovers.  The Caesar salad was big and not drenched in dressing.

Great addition to the Jones street lineup.  Look for the red 'truck' with a wood fence.
author: Nick S.

description: of the 5 pizza places we tried this was absolutely the best . the crust the fresh tomatoes and the prosciutto was excellent. a definite winner!!
author: Laurence K.

description: This place has really good food and music it's hella good lovely decorations and really good salad and bread and pizza
author: Chloe M.

description: Love this place! wood fired pizza was to die for and the fresh made salad was super! This pizza was just what San Fran needed! Bringing Italy to san Fran! A very cute and comfortable patio with great music and fabulous service. It is the kind of pizza that keeps you coming back! They deliver too!
author: Patty N.

description: The porchetta sandwich is amazing and its available all day long.  I will need to go back and try the pizza.
author: Fatty A.

description: Great customer service and the pizza was awesome. It's a very thin pizza but a lot of flavor. Yummy
author: Shawn R.

description: I'm teetering on the fence of 4/5 for this place.  The place is 5 stars for a small venue/foodtruck type place, but rounding down due to limited seating and no beer/wine choices to enjoy with the pizza.  I took mine to go, so I could enjoy at my hotel with a beer, and that can cause a little cool-down sog factor as you cart the pizza in the cool SF air to your eating place.  I would say it would probably be best to consume on the premises.  The pizzas are not overly big, so most can eat one themselves, and you might want to order two different ones and go halfsies if you are with someone.  I really enjoyed the seasonal Caprese pizza with heirloom tomatoes.  The crust was cooked just right with some softness and crunch on the edges.  The sauce was zesty and brought out good flavors of the fresh buffalo mozz and hairloom tomatoes were killer.  I recommend this place, but next time I will enjoy onsite in their little seating "garden" outside the truck.
author: Dan M.

description:
This place isn't open yet, but they were giving out free samples today.  All I can say is WOW.....finally a good pizza place in the neighborhood AND they deliver.  

They have some super fancy expensive oven that produces the best crust I've ever had.  The owner also mentioned they will have porchetta sandwiches and homemade caesar salads.  

I believe the sign said they open the first weekend of June so this will definitely be added to the regular rotation for my wife and I.
author: derek t.

description: Laudable effort.  Excellent pizza, nice people making it.  I wish them the greatest of success.  This pizza rivals Tony's; the price, absence of an extreme wait time, and nice people makes it that much better.
author: A B.

description:
The Summary: 
Amazing pizza place near fisherman's wharf.  If you're in town and in the mood for Pizza, you MUST go here.

The Food:
At this place as with any good pizza place, toppings are like frosting: good, but not what really makes the pizza great.  It's all about the crust, sauce and cheese and on those three, this place hits all the high notes.
Crust is thin and flaky, yet chewy.  Perfect if you like thin crust.
Sauce is light, but very savory.
Overall, delicious.

Ambiance:
It's small and kind of hidden, on the east side of the street between Lincoln and Beach, across the street from Wallgreens.
Nice little spot.  Can be romantic. Staff is very friendly.

Notes:
They only sell full pizzas (11 inches, 6 slices); not by the slice.  But one person with a good sized appetite can eat a whole pizza by him/herself easily.
author: Joe S.

description: Fernando picked out this place, there was an advertisement for it as SFO Airport. We were both surprised when we arrived to find it was a food truck with a wood fire going to cook up the pizza. There was outside seating in front of the truck, and as it was a beautiful day, we were excited to try it out. The service was amazing, the two working that day were the most chill, laid back, and nice individuals we met in SF. The prices were super affordable and the pizza was delicious! I would definitely stop by again the next time in SF and I would encourage anybody looking for good food in the Fisherman's Wharf area to give this place a try! It's not touristy, it's like a hidden gem that the locals are keeping for themselves. Glad we found it!
author: Nicole S.

description: This traditional thin-crust pizza is absolutely incredible. With just the right amount of everything an amazing sauce, this pizza will change your life. I recommend the margarita pizza with arugula added.
author: Ryan L.

description: Great little pizza shop in the heart of fisherman's wharf. Awesome woodfire pizzas, nice to pick up and bring back to hotel since there is only outdoor seating. Reasonable price for 11inch pizza. Non greasy and perfect amount of cheese.
author: Emily R.

description: Delicious! I can't believe they make that pizza on a truck. The people were nice too!
author: Jennifer F.

description: Came here with some out of town friends on a day trip to San Francisco. You could immediately smell the woodfired pizza. We ordered the pizza with pesto, tomoatoes and prociutto. We also got the porchetta sandwich. Both were absolutely amazing. Highly recommend the porchetta! I was completely impressed! Service was great, a little quirky, but very helpful. Wish this place was closer to me!
author: Lauren Y.

description: Absolutely amazing! Probably some of the best pizza I've ever had! The staff was very friendly and the pizza came out in 5 minutes!
author: Garrett M.

description:
Fabulous Pizza and Sandwiches!

Wow! What a surprise.. Amongst all the tourist seafood and fast food dreck served in Fishermans Wharf I stumbled on this place with a healthy appetite. My business colleague & I each ordered one of the specialty sandwiches - the Porchetta and the Prosciutto. Amazing taste. We never even tried the pizza - but judging by the satisfied sounds coming from the tables all around us it was a big hit too.

The service was quick, friendly and very "perky". The staff were definitely eager to please and checked back on us several times.

One word of warning - all seating is outside, so be careful if you visit in bad weather.
author: John C.

description: 6 slices in a serving. "Local" discount! Large salad. Pizza was perfection and they even threw it back in the oven to keep it warm because I added to my order and had to wait longer. Most definitely will be back!!!
author: Valerie E.

description: Could be the best Neapolitan style pizza in sf competing with Delfina and Farina.
author: Sumner W.

description: On the first night of our trip we walked the few blocks from our hotel to Carmel. We had the Diavola pizza which was spicy and had great flavor. An unusual combination but the perfect meal to take back to our hotel and eat! My husband was not a fan of the arugula piled high but other than that, great experience!
author: Julie B.

description: Great pizza...so authentic. Great staff. They were nice enough to let us sit on their patio even though some of our party order from next door. We will definitely be back!
author: Kari H.

description: Delicious, fresh, friendly. Don't miss Carmel Pizza for authentic pizza and salads that are worth the wait!
author: William D.

description: Wonderful folks running this joint with delicious pizza as well! I had a courier get  a pizza for me for my lunch and she showed up with a free sandwich too that they threw in. This was very nice and also completely unnecessary but greatly appreciated! I will definitely be coming back for the great food and service as well!
author: Bowen H.

description: Brick oven pizza food truck on Fishermans wharf with seating available. Extremely friendly staff, the owner (?) let us into the truck to take pictures of the oven!! We had the Diavolo which was delicious although we usually like a lot more toppings.
author: C M.

description: Went out last Friday with a coworker to this cool place. The sun was out and warm and what better thing to eat than something from Carmel Pizza Company. The service at first was very slow (due in part to new hires) but when the end results came out, it was GREAT! I ordered the apple smoked ham on a warm Acme ciabatta deli roll and man was it ever delicious! I can't wait to try their pizzas!
author: Marco R.

description: Awesome brick oven pizza!! And try their Porchetta sandwich! Very delicious. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Will definitely come back next time I'm in town.
author: Andrew R.

description:
After reading the reviews we were very excited to try some good pizza. We went there at 6:15 on Wednesday Nov 13th and it was closed. No sign or hours listed on the gate.
We were very disappointed
author: Eric B.

description: Would have gave half a star if it was an option. Overpriced and nasty. Taste like a burnt wheat thin with tomato sauce and candle wax cheese. They didn't even have ranch breh. $37 for two personal pizzas and it didn't even fill 3 people. Overpriced and overrated. Should have went to Blondies.
author: Liam D.

description: Quick and great service, location is a bit odd, but I like the pizza. Came out perfectly
author: Ting B.

description: Awesome little food truck with a cute patio to eat in. Really delicious pizza, great value. In a location where most of your food options are fast food, mega chains or chowder this was a refreshing and tasty option.
author: Corie N.

description: We are a pizza lovin' family.  Found the ratings on yelp so we gave it a try.  It was delicious.  I love the little patio courtyard, it made for the whole experience.  The pizza is made fresh to order and the sauce is not traditional marinera.  They are tomato based so we opted for the grilled onion, garlic and just pepperoni.  I'm telling you we were in love.  I wish they had one where we live; or maybe not because we'd be there all the time.  The only two negatives are no beer and I prefer my drinks with ice which they just have canned drinks.  Next time were in San Francisco we will be back for more pizza!
author: Yvette G.

description: I love Carmel Pizza! AJ is great and he does his pies just right! He uses really fresh Ingredients,  the perfect amount of sauce, and the crust is always thin and crispy! The best part is he delivers on his bike! If you like wood fired pizza give it a try!
author: Jesse W.

description:
I seriously thought this would end up being a case of inflated rating syndrome so common to yelp especially at the beginning of a restaurant's life.  i figured, considering the location, this place is getting reviewed by tourists, friends of the owner, and possibly some crackheads with internet access.  

WRONG.

when we finally figured we'd give it a try since we live down the road, wow we were really impressed.  i don't like to sit there and eat and would rather take the food home, but the pizzas are great just out of the oven.  cooked perfectly, tasty crust/sauce combo, great ingredients including bufala... this place is a true hidden gem.  it's easy to park and grab/go on the weekdays if you live anywhere close by.
author: eshwar k.

description: Been to Carmel Pizza four times now and it never disappointed me.  The heirloom tomato pizza was one of the best I have had.  Their crust is to die for.  Excellent place to bring guests who want to visit the wharf.  Great for people watching.
author: Susan F.

description: GREAT authentic Italian pizza and great service!! :)
author: Marina B.

description: This was an awesome place! I was looking for some top local restaurants. This was a block away from my hotel. The pizza was awesome and both AJ and Amanda were very welcoming and couldn't have been nicer hosts for us. The pizza is perfectly cooked and is probably among the top pizza I've ever had. I will come here again, no doubt about.
author: Weston M.

description: Friendly service and really yummy wood oven thin crust pizza. We had pepperoni mushroom & heirloom tomato. Tucked into a quiet corner just off Jefferson across from Walgreen's. Not the most scenic location but the pizza rocked.
author: Leah M.

description: Great customer service and AMAZING pizza.
author: Ernesto C.

description:
AJ and Amanda!  Thumbs up!  My bro and I are always coming by, but wanted to post up a hearty 5 stars for you guys.  Thanks for always taking care of us 'locals' and putting out quality food at a fair price.  You are both so friendly, and we really appreciate the hospitality.  We'll keep bringing our friends and coworkers by!

Dreaming of porchetta...
author: E. H.

description: This place is great!  If you are in the city, it's a must stop.  Great pizza, reasonable price.  Probably the best part though was the service. Amazing service that I will never forget.  Me and my friends stopped here while we were on a bike ride in the city and it was definitely a great break.  Thank you!
author: Cameron P.

description: Charming, very little place, wood-fired pizza, outside seating only, great food, very tasty. I would definitely recommend it. The place was busy, and took a little while, but it was really worth it. The crust was very thin, and the ingredients are plenty, so it was deliciously moist, but not greasy. Next time in SF, I'll bring my autistic son to this place. I think he'll like it. The pepperonis were tasty, without being over-the-top spicy, which is typical these days. You can choose a Neopolitan sauce, or a more garlic version, which is very nice. Pick your items or pick a special. No one I saw got the same thing! Definitely an intimate outdoor cafe feel, only it's pizza. Very friendly chefs. Very good value for what you get, perfect size for sharing.
author: Cole J.

description: Great simple pizza. I got  pizza to go but i would definitely want to eat there next time the atmosphere is so nice. Friendly people and prices, A must place to stop and eat! Yum
author: Miles R.

description: Exceptional! Absolutely loved it. Fresh ingredients, friendly service and FAST!
author: Paco Or Frank C.

description: Simply amazing, great food casual atmosphere.
author: Parker D.

description: Yum!  We ordered a pizza with prosciutto and arugula - and tasty mozzarella over a little sauce - and it was great!  Baked in a wood oven, with a super cute couple running the place.  This is the real deal!
author: Alex G.

description: Oh my goodness. You just simply can't know how good this pizza is until you try it! The owner personally delivered our pizzas to Nob Hill one Sunday night. Not only was he amazing, but the ingredients on the pizza were so fresh, the crust crunchy and chewy. Perfect! No greasy pizza here! Just wonderful and both ended up being about $14 each! We we absolutely be back :)
author: Emily S.

description:
On a rainy cold night in San Francisco, the usually tourist swarming Fisherman's Wharf felt a little deserted.

This place is just across from F Tran's terminal stop.  Menu is not expansive, but even the tomato sauce has 2 versions - pure tomato or Carmel's secret garlic infused sauce.  12 inch is too small to share for 2 , and 1 or 2 slices too many for one person.  Basic starts at $10, and you choose toppings, either $1/$2 each.  

We both liked our pizza, and the friendly owner adds much to the atmosphere.  We were ushered in the warm cabana next to the space heater.  My 2 toppings pizza tastes good, but the amount of toppings was a little skimpy, so next time I'll make sure to pile them on.
author: daphne w.

description: Well worth the walk from peir 39. I thought that no way a pizza "truck"  could rate 5 stars for actual food. I was so wrong on so many different levels. The food here is far better than other food that I have had in other very expensive restaurants. The wait was nonexistent and the pizza sauce is to die for. Quality bar none. Will be a regular stop when my family and I visit the city. Thanks Carmel Pizza Company.
author: Robert H.

description: The pizza was excellent as was the service. The owner was very friendly and accommodating. I would definitely come here again when I'm back in the city.
author: Mark G.

description: My work is right by here, and I came across this place when I was walking by. And this place caught my eye because I am a Pizza Fanatic! Tried their regular pizza with panchetta & mushrooms and it was SIMPLY AMAZING! Love that thin crispy crust with QUALITY flavors. You just can't get that around this Wharf area with it's many tourist trap restaurants. Came here a second time, and go the mozzarella version with pepperoni and mushrooms. Awesome again. It's pretty obvious I am coming here a third time, and so on! Oh and Amanda & AJ know what they are doing! And that is running a top notch pizza joint!
author: Charles L.

description: I thought it was kind of odd to see 25 reviews with five stars but this place is real good. Don't know about the best pizza in the world. But it's very good. The people are nice and it's dog friendly.
author: Bob B.

description: Great Pizza joint. Awesome sauce as my daughter described it. But keep your eyes peeled be because it's HARD to find. Directly across the street from the Walgreens with a tiny little sign. Definitely worth the trouble in finding it. It's good!
author: Evelyn B.

description: Great Pizza! Do yourself a favor and try the pizza here! Some of the best I've had.
author: Michael T.

description: Great pizza!  Thin crust cooked to perfection. The perfect combination of pesto and pizza sauce. We are pizza snobs and we loved it! Only complaint...we didn't order a bigger one!
author: Rose F.

description: We split the capriccosia pizza for lunch. It had a lot of sauce and the edges were a bit overcooked. It seems pricey for what you get, but we did enjoy the pizza.
author: Aaron L.

description: Had the special Caprese pizza, fresh mozzarella, heirloom tomatoes and super fresh off-the-chain basil. The thin crust didn't weigh me down and I demolished the whole thing. Tasted great and I got a dollar off thanks to Yelp!
author: Shawn K.

description: Delicious!! Not heavy or greasy but authentic, lots of toppings, great all the way to the crust, not to mention great customer service. AJ and Amanda are awesome!!!!!!
author: Pearl N.

description: Wonderful pizza! Like a lot of people I've eaten a few  pizzas before. This was one of the few pizzas that will linger on your Minds taste buds ! Nice server/ cashier. Only reason 4 not 5 stars ..no beer no bathroom. Yummy!
author: Johnfucious S.

description: Burned crust. ordinary pizsa. nothing special.  They stacked the yelp rankings by giving away items for reviews.
author: Alex C.

description: Fantastic wood fired pizza.  This is a small outdoor location so be prepared to sit outside, but even on a freezing day this pizza would still be worth it.  Only problem was that it was so good that it burnt my mouth since I couldn't wait for it to cool down!
author: Kasey O.

description: I chose the truck next door, but 3 members of my family chose the pizza.  They LOVED it!
author: Matt D.

description: Hidden gem amidst the tourist traps in Fisherman's Wharf.  Great pizza, clean space, quick service, and super friendly staff!  Get the Caprese with Heirloom tomatoes.
author: James S.

description: excellent pizza in a tourist location. if this were in a different location I'm sure it would be a locals favorite. but seeing as I'm a tourist, it was a great stop for a ten buck lunch per person.
author: jordan r.

description: La Porchetta sandwich is very good.  Tender pork with crispy skin in a sado..yum!  Next time I'm going to try their pizza!
author: William S.

description: Everytime I come to San Francisco I make it a must to check this place out. Best wood fired pizza I've ever had ! The maguerita pizza is my favorite
author: Alyssa T.

description: Wow.  Don't have to go to Italy for real pizza anymore.  From the sauce that is fresh and light, the fresh vegetables and whole milk motz, to the best wood fired crust I have ever chewed...this comfortable patio has brought the true essence of the Italian pizza experience.  You guys nailed it...see you this afternoon.  Again.  Thanks, now we can't eat pizza anywhere else ever again.
author: Taylor A.

description: I likes it. They are really thin crust. One pizza might be for one hungry guy. I really liked their sandwich. It was really yummy. Did not like that the charge you for the really Parmesan cheese to put on your pizza, really.  They aren't cheap they could  give it to you for free.  Pretty good I would go back but just to have a snake not to get filled up.  They people are nice that worked there.
author: Jam M.

description: Delicious hand tossed pizza, best thin crust I've had in a long time! AJ provides very friendly service while Amanda makes you an amazing brick oven pizza. Definitely worth stopping by, especially since prices here beat those of restaurants around the wharf area. We'll certainly be returning soon and I suggest you give it a try!
author: Cami G.

description: I'm weird when it comes to pizza: i eat toppings only (yes, i know..). But this one i swallowed whole and was looking for more. Fresh ingredients, excellent quality and great service. Just wish it was a bit bigger.. :)
author: Zzzeed Z.

description: I have been to Carmel Pizza Company many times over the last two summers. My family and I ate there three times last summer in three days and tried their pizzas and La Porchetta. The food is very good! Fast forward to this summer as I was out to the area again on business. I dropped them a quick message on FB that I would be out and asked if they would have the La Porchetta as some days the sell out pretty quick. Imagine my surprise when I show up at 5:00 and the girls recognize me. They show me the note they had made to save a La Porchetta for me. 1st class if you ask me!! Until next year, I will think about the wonderful food that is waiting for me!
author: Matt G.

description: My hubby and I ate here after reading about the pizzas on Yelp.  I ordered a cheese and he ordered a pepperoni pizza.  The crust was delightful and crisp.  The cheese was a mixture of 3 cheeses and was absolutely delicious.  The pepperoni was spicy and great.  I highly recommend this pizza.  The place has great ambience for a truck place.  The pizza arrived in less than 5 minutes after ordering it.  Super friendly people.
author: Kathy K.

description:
EDITED ON 10/22 to add: I appreciate the additional response from the owner and want to be totally fair here. I have absolutely no reason to slander their business. With my 10 percent employee discount -- which they've since DISCONTINUED -- I paid $8 for the pepperoni pizza two years ago. I think I know what I paid and I think she knows, too. A few months ago the price was $15 total, with tax. I think that's where the discrepancy is when she says $14, which is fair enough.Regardless, you will see that the price of their pepperoni pizza isn't listed on their current online menu, nor are the prices of their toppings. BUT -- let's just say it's true that the price started at $10 and is now $14. That's still a 40 percent increase! Are you saying the price of your pepperoni and/or other artisan ingredients has gone up that much? And if so, aren't you able to absorb at least some of that price increase for the sake of your customers? 

Seems silly to go back and forth on this. The pizza's good, but, no matter the rationalizations or excuses -- the price increase was, IMHO, outrageous. I don't think anything more needs to be said. 

09/30/14

They can provide as many excuses as they want... Plenty of other family-owned artisinal businesses in the area haven't raised prices one iota in the last two years. The price of the pepperoni pizza has gone from $8 to $15. Fact. I have no reason to slander a restaurant, least of all a family-owned one. Wishing them the best but it's too steep...
author: Matt P.

description: Got the romantico pizza and it was awesome. Atmosphere is very cool with a succulent garden.
author: Anna G.

description: If you like your crust very thin, undercooked and soggy - then try it, but I don't recommend it.  Cute place though - only outdoor seating, but covered.
author: Barbara T.

description: We are from Mill Valley and took the kids into the city via the ferry. Found Carmel Pizza online, ventured over and discovered the best pizza we've ever had in Bay Area. My husband spent a year in Florence and he said that its the closest pizza he's tasted to the pizza from Florence since he's been there. Thanks for a great experience!
author: Mary R.

description: Had never eaten here before. Stopped in for peperoni and italian sausage pizza. really great crust and flavors. Leftovers reheated the next day were great too. We will come back.
author: Jan B.

description: We had a simple, delicious pizza marguerite; the best one we had in all of little Italy.  Great crust!
author: Rich F.

description: The place was ok. We were so excited to try it given the previous reviews. We got our garlic bread add the same time as our pizza. Both crusts were so thin that the slices were difficult to eat. Some spots were also charry tasting due to the fire grill. It tastes ok but was nothing exceptional.
author: Tessa M.

description: Pizza was burnt and garlic bread was burnt.  Food is overpriced for quality even if not burnt.
author: Craig B.

description: These guys know how to do it right!!! The freshest ingredients with an amazing woodfired crust...some of the best pizza I have EVER had!!!  Come out and support these guys, you won't be disappointed.
author: Andrea K.

description: I created a yelp account just because how amazing their food is! It pleased four generations of our family. Our children 2-7 to grandmother. Even my vegetarian mil was able to enjoy a great pizza!
author: Tabatha G.

description: I work two blocks away and come here for lunch quite often. It is the best pizza in the universe. Recently, I have been getting the panini sandich, which is a very innovative cross between a pizza and a sandwich. Nothing like a normal panini, at least twelve times more delicious.  Amanda and AJ are very cool. In fact, I think I will go there today. The ingredients are obviously chosen with a great deal of care and are high quality.
author: Natalie V.

description: Mamma Mia!  I'm not a fan of the carnival-like atmosphere of Fisherman's Wharf. But if you are in the area you should try this place. It's just a glorified food cart with some seating. I took my food back to my hotel room. Oh my goodness. The wood fired oven and fresh ingredients really make a difference. Not recommended for vegetarians, but if you are in a mood to cheat...
author: M G.

description: Darn good pizza, and a pretty good Caesar salad too. Very nice owners. I guess it's the best food from a truck I've had!  Must try.
author: Mark W.

description: OMG!! Unbelievably amazing pizza! The crust is by far the best I've ever had. Very authentic traditional Italian thin crust. Hands down the best pizza in the area, no contest.
author: Andre C.

description: The owner of this stand gave us a demonstration on how to spin a ball of dough into a full pizza pie .. Not only did we learn something, it was also amazingly delicious.
author: Alex A.

description: unexpected surprise.  Just looking for a close pizza place on Yelp, found Carmel.  Terrific crust, very good pies.  Just a little small/pricey, but outside of that, good stuff.  Top 4 pizza places in SF (not saying a huge amount though).
author: michael d.

description: Awesome! Both sauces rock!!! We were there on a Friday afternoon. Prompt service. Ordered 2 pizza's & took about 20-30 minutes. The 2 young ladies helping us were great!
author: Patrick W.

description: Awesome food. Awesome service. Extremely genuinely nice people.
author: Allan R.

description: Finally ate here on our last day on the wharf.   For the wharf a fair deal on a thin crust pizza - the crust was a little too floppy and had trouble holding the toppings, but probably as I told them I was in a hurry and they didn't cook it long enough.   Giving it 4 stars as it didn't "wow" me.   The service was great - very nice people.   Can easily take it to go.  Recommend this for people on a budget or who are tired of sit down restaurants with slow service.
author: David M.

description: I wanted to like this place so much but it was  more  just ok- for my experience. Girl that took my order was nice but really didn't help much as I wasn't sure what kind of pizza I fancied. I realize not her job but she just wanted to take my order and get on with it. She assured me that the pizza would be great and that was it. Ended up with a different pizza then I ordered. I didn't complain as I didn't have time to have them change it and I am sure they would of had I asked. So that is certainly not their fault!  It is thin crust and others that were eating there sure seemed to enjoy their pizza. I have definitely had worse pizzas and I am sure I would give them another shot when I am back in the area. I know that they sold out of pizzas the night before so I am certain that they are doing something right. Tons of topping choices. I would be sure to be more specific with my order next time. My guess if you check this place out and know what you want- you will love it! We will be sure to try again next time. The owner/chef seems very sweet and cares about her customers liking what they get. My own fault for being rushed and not letting her know.
author: Shansar A.

description:
AJ and Amber, If you read this:  STEVE & LISETTE say "HI"!

So the wife and I were up in Frisco to visit some friends.  Had to come down to pier 39 to get my fill of Oysters.  Upon parking the car, we were met by a gentleman looking over a small wooden fence, who told us if we were looking for a great wood fired pizza, his place was the place.  
Let me say, I did not miss having the Oysters!  AJ introduced himself (Owner) and we told him to make me his best Pie....He made a Caprese!  Fresh cut heirloom tomatoes, fresh basil, fresh mozzarella.   This was the best pizza I had in a very long time!  
The passion AJ exuded when discussing his pizzas is what makes this place the best place for pizza in San Francisco.  You know without a doubt, this man is going to put a little love and a lot of care into making the absolute best product! 
It was so good, I convinced my wife to walk back for a second time on our short Vacation to try his slow roasted pork sandwich and fresh made Caesar  made.....OUTSTANDING!!!!   I wish I could remember the name of the sandwich, but it was Fabulous!!!!!   
AJ and his Fiance Amber(who we met later, she was shopping for the ingredients for the day) are simply wonderful people who are passionate about their craft!  It shows in their attitude and their FOOD!!!!
author: Steve B.
